English: Now there was a certain man of Ramathaim Zophim, of the mountains of Ephraim, and his name was Elkanah the son of Jeroham, the son of Elihu, the son of Tohu, the son of Zuph, an Ephraimite.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo đơ̆ng pơlei Ramathaim Suphima lăm tơring groi kông Êphraim anăn sư Êlkana, kon drŏ-nglo Jêrôham sâu Êlihu, sâu i Tơhu, sâu ach Sup, bơngai adrĕch Êphraim.

English: And he had two wives: the name of one was Hannah, and the name of the other Peninnah. Peninnah had children, but Hannah had no children.
Bahnar: Sư đei 'bar 'nu akăn; minh 'nu anăn sư Hana, minh 'nu nai anăn sư Pênina. Pêninia đei kon hơ'lơ̆p mă-lei An ưh kơ đei hơ'lơ̆p.

English: This man went up from his city yearly to worship and sacrifice to the LORD of hosts in Shiloh. Also the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, the priests of the LORD, were there.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm Êlkana lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei sư tŏk năm tơ pơlei Silô akŭm kơkuh păng wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi kơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Tơ noh đei 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Hêli, bre Hopni păng Phinêhas, pơm 'bok soi Kră Yang.

English: And whenever the time came for Elkanah to make an offering, he would give portions to Peninnah his wife and to all her sons and daughters.
Bahnar: Năr Êlkana pơyơ̆r tơmam soi sư klah asong minh kơ Pênina akăn sư păng kơ rim 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, kon drŏ-kăn sư.

English: But to Hannah he would give a double portion, for he loved Hannah, although the LORD had closed her womb.
Bahnar: Na sư asong ăn kơ Hana 'bar yua kơ sư hưch dêh kơ Hana, mă-lei Kră Yang ăn kơ sư hơwŏng.

English: And her rival also provoked her severely, to make her miserable, because the LORD had closed her womb.
Bahnar: Pênina jơ̆ păng pơklai jơhngơ̆m sư, yua kơ Kră Yang ăn kơ sư hơwŏng.

English: So it was, year by year, when she went up to the house of the LORD, that she provoked her; therefore she wept and did not eat.
Bahnar: Ling-lang thoi noh lăm rim sơnăm; rim wơ̆t Hana tŏk năm tơ hnam Kră Yang Pênina ơh pơklai lăm jơhngơ̆m. Dĭng mah Hana nhơ̆m păng ưh kơ sŏng sa.

English: Then Elkanah her husband said to her, “Hannah, why do you weep? Why do you not eat? And why is your heart grieved? Am I not better to you than ten sons?”
Bahnar: Êlkana klo sư khan kơ sư, ơ Hana, yua kơ kiơ ih nhơ̆m? Hăm yua kơ kiơ ih ưh kơ sŏng sa? Yua kơ kiơ jơhngơ̆m ih sơ'ngon? Liơ ih đei inh bơih ưh kơ gĭt hloh kơ đei mơjĭt 'nu kon drŏ-nglo hă?

English: So Hannah arose after they had finished eating and drinking in Shiloh. Now Eli the priest was sitting on the seat by the doorpost of the tabernacle of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đang kơ lu sư sŏng sa tơ pơlei Silô bơih, Hana iung, kơplah noh Hêli, oei ngôi hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ jê̆ 'măng mơ̆t tơ hnam Kră Yang.

English: And she was in bitterness of soul, and prayed to the LORD and wept in anguish.
Bahnar: Hana jơhngơ̆m sư rŭng răng ưh kơsŭk sư krao apinh Kră Yang sư nhơ̆m sơ'ngon dêh.

English: Then she made a vow and said, “O LORD of hosts, if You will indeed look on the affliction of Your maidservant and remember me, and not forget Your maidservant, but will give Your maidservant a male child, then I will give him to the LORD all the days of his life, and no razor shall come upon his head.”
Bahnar: Sư pơma pơkă khan: Ơ Kră Yang Tih Hloh, tơdah ih lăng mơnat kơ đam drŏ-kăn ih, 'blŏk bĕ kơ inh 'nĕ kơ hiơt kơ inh đam drŏ-kăn ih, mă-lei gô ăn kơ đam drŏ-kăn ih đei minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, thoi ei inh gô ăn sư kơ ih Kră Yang đĭ chăl arih sư, ưh kơ gơh yuă dah hơkôih sŏk sư.

English: And it happened, as she continued praying before the LORD, that Eli watched her mouth.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei krao khan 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, Hêli lăng 'bơ̆r sư.

English: Now Hannah spoke in her heart; only her lips moved, but her voice was not heard. Therefore Eli thought she was drunk.
Bahnar: Hana pơma lăm jơhngơ̆m sư, hơkŭng sư đĕch pơpơ̆; đe ưh kơ đei kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r sư ôh. Na Hêli tơchĕng khan, Hana suai sik.

English: So Eli said to her, “How long will you be drunk? Put your wine away from you!”
Bahnar: Na Hêli khan kơ sư. Dang yơ ih praih kơ suai sik? Lê̆ pă et.

English: But Hannah answered and said, “No, my lord, I am a woman of sorrowful spirit. I have drunk neither wine nor intoxicating drink, but have poured out my soul before the LORD.
Bahnar: Hana tơl, ưh, ơ yŏng tơ'ngla inh, inh minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn ơh sơ'ngon dêh. Inh ưh kơ đei et sik ôh, kư̆m ưh kơ đei suai mơ̆n, yua kơ inh tơ'bôh đĭ jơhngơ̆m inh kơ Kră Yang.

English: “Do not consider your maidservant a wicked woman, for out of the abundance of my complaint and grief I have spoken until now.”
Bahnar: 'Nĕ jơ̆ kơ inh đam ih thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn kư̆ kă, yua kơ inh pơma âu dang ei kơlih kơ jơhngơ̆m inh rŭng răng ơh sơ'ngon.

English: Then Eli answered and said, “Go in peace, and the God of Israel grant your petition which you have asked of Him.”
Bahnar: Na Hêli khan, năm mă 'lơ̆ng bĕ krao khan bĕ kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael ăn kơ ih tơdrong ih krao apinh sư.

English: And she said, “Let your maidservant find favor in your sight.” So the woman went her way and ate, and her face was no longer sad.
Bahnar: Sư drơ̆ng, apinh ih ăn kơ inh đam drŏ-kăn ih đei mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp ih. Na Hana wih brŏk păng sŏng sa, muh măt sư ưh pă sơ'ngon bơih.

English: Then they rose early in the morning and worshiped before the LORD, and returned and came to their house at Ramah. And Elkanah knew Hannah his wife, and the LORD remembered her.
Bahnar: Lu sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; đơ̆ng noh lu sư wih brŏk tơ hnam lu sư tơ pơlei Rama. Êlkana oei hơdai hăm akăn sư Hana, Kră Yang 'blŏk kơ sư.

English: So it came to pass in the process of time that Hannah conceived and bore a son, and called his name Samuel, saying, “Because I have asked for him from the LORD.”
Bahnar: Na truh tơ Hana anăp na tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo. Krao anăn sư Samuel,b yua kơ sư đei khan, inh đei apinh bơih sư đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: Now the man Elkanah and all his house went up to offer to the LORD the yearly sacrifice and his vow.
Bahnar: Êlkana păng đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ sư tŏk năm wă pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang tơmam soi lăm rim sơnăm, wă pơsĭt tơdrong sư đei pơkă bơih.

English: But Hannah did not go up, for she said to her husband, “Not until the child is weaned; then I will take him, that he may appear before the LORD and remain there forever.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Hana ưh kơ tŏk năm hơdai ôh, sư khan kơ klo sư, gô kon hơ'lơ̆p lê̆ mŏ, inh gô năm chông ba sư, wă kơ sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng oei hloi tơ noh ling-lang.

English: So Elkanah her husband said to her, “Do what seems best to you; wait until you have weaned him. Only let the LORD establish His word.” Then the woman stayed and nursed her son until she had weaned him.
Bahnar: Êlkana klo sư khan kơ sư, pơm bĕ thoi ih tơchĕng khan 'lơ̆ng. Gô bĕ dĭng tơ sư lê̆ mŏm. Wă kơ apinh Kră Yang pơsĭt nơ̆r ih pơma. Thoi noh sư oei hnam, rong kon drŏ-nglo noh truh tơ sư lê̆ mŏm.

English: Now when she had weaned him, she took him up with her, with three bulls, one ephah of flour, and a skin of wine, and brought him to the house of the LORD in Shiloh. And the child was young.
Bahnar: Truh tơ sư lê̆ mŏm bơih, Hana chông ba kon sư năm hơdai sư. Păng kư̆m dui ba rơmo tơno pêng sơnăm, minh êphac tơpŭng, minh pơm get akar sik hơmu. Sư chông kon sư tơ hnam Kră Yang tơ pơlei Silô. Kon hơ'lơ̆p sư noh oei 'lơ̆p.

English: Then they slaughtered a bull, and brought the child to Eli.
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bet pơlôch rơmo noh na chông ba hơ'lơ̆p noh tơ Hêli.

English: And she said, “O my lord! As your soul lives, my lord, I am the woman who stood by you here, praying to the LORD.
Bahnar: Păng khan: “Ơ yŏng tơ'ngla inh arih ling-lang ơ yŏng inh, inh bơih bơngai drŏ-kăn mă oei dơ̆ng tơ âu 'bơ̆t anăp ih krao apinh Kră Yang.

English: For this child I prayed, and the LORD has granted me my petition which I asked of Him.
Bahnar: Inh krao apinh yua kơ bơngai hơ'lơ̆p âu; Kră Yang ăn bơih tơdrong inh krao apinh sư.

English: Therefore I also have lent him to the LORD; as long as he lives he shall be lent to the LORD.” So they worshiped the LORD there.
Bahnar: Na inh pơyơ̆r sư kơ Kră Yang yua; lăm đĭ chăl sư arih dang yơ; sưd noh jing tơmam Kră Yang boih.” Klaih kơ noh lu sư drap kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang tơ noh.

English: And Hannah prayed and said: “My heart rejoices in the LORD; My horn is exalted in the LORD. I smile at my enemies, Because I rejoice in Your salvation.
Bahnar: Hana krao apinh păng khan: Jơhngơ̆m inh chơt hiôk lăm Kră Yang; Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk chơt. 'Bơ̆r inh pơma pơgreh khan kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh. Inh chơt hiôk Ih dŏng pơklaih inh.

English: “No one is holy like the LORD, For there is none besides You, Nor is there any rock like our God.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu 'lơ̆ng rơgoh thoi Kră Yang ôh, Ưh kơ đei bu nai thoi Ih; ưh kơ đei tơmo ayơ pĕng lu nhôn thoi Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: “Talk no more so very proudly; Let no arrogance come from your mouth, For the LORD is the God of knowledge; And by Him actions are weighed.
Bahnar: Thôi, 'nĕ pă pơma pơang dêh. 'Nĕ pă ăn tơdrong pơang lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ih; Yua kơ Kră Yang bơih 'Bok Kei-Dei băt đi; Sư boih kŏng pơtŏ lăng đĭ tơdrong bơ̆n jang.

English: “The bows of the mighty men are broken, And those who stumbled are girded with strength.
Bahnar: Hră lu bơngai kơtang tơgơ̆ bơih, mă-lei lu bơngai tơrăn oei đei jơhngơ̆m pran kơtang.

English: Those who were full have hired themselves out for bread, And the hungry have ceased to hunger. Even the barren has borne seven, And she who has many children has become feeble.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai phĭ jơnap athei jang kơ đe wă kơ đei tơmam sa. Mă-lei lu bơngai pơngot pă đei pơngot dơ̆ng. Drŏ-kăn hơwŏng tơpŭ đei tơpơh 'nu kon, Mă-lei drŏ-kăn đei kon lơ bơih oei sơ'ngon.

English: “The LORD kills and makes alive; He brings down to the grave and brings up.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn lôch păng ăn arih; Sư tơhuŏng bơngai lăm pơlei bơngai lôch păng gô tơiung hơtŏk arih dơ̆ng.

English: The LORD makes poor and makes rich; He brings low and lifts up.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn kơ đe dơnuh, Păng tơiung đe mơdrŏng; Sư tơjur đe păng kư̆m pôk hơtŏk mơ̆n.

English: He raises the poor from the dust And lifts the beggar from the ash heap, To set them among princes And make them inherit the throne of glory. “For the pillars of the earth are the LORD’s, And He has set the world upon them.
Bahnar: Sư rô̆ tơiung bơngai dơnuh đơ̆ng 'mui teh; Sư pơdơ̆ng tơiung lu bơngai kơ'bah đơ̆ng lăm 'mui tơnuh, Wă kơ lu sư dơ̆ng hơdai hăm lu bơngai yŏng pơgơ̆r. Păng kư̆m ăn oei lăm anih đe pơyom. Jrăng plei teh noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang, Păng kơpal jrăng noh sư pơdơ̆ng bơih plei teh.

English: He will guard the feet of His saints, But the wicked shall be silent in darkness. “For by strength no man shall prevail.
Bahnar: Sư wei-lăng jơ̆ng lu bơngai kiơ̆ Sư tơpăt; Mă-lei lu bơngai kơnê̆ sư gô tơlơ̆ lê̆ lăm măng mu. Kon bơngai ưh kơ kĕ ôh yua tơdrong pran kơdih.

English: The adversaries of the LORD shall be broken in pieces; From heaven He will thunder against them. The LORD will judge the ends of the earth. “He will give strength to His king, And exalt the horn of His anointed.”
Bahnar: Ơ! Kră Yang; Ih gô pơrăm lu bơngai ayăt hĕch hoch đĭ. Đơ̆ng plĕnh Sư gô ăn grơ̆m re pơrăm lu đe noh; Kră Yang gô sek tơlang kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai. Sư gô ăn tơdrong pran kơtang kơ pơtao Sư Păng ăn tơdrong kĕ jei kơ bơngai mă Sư đei hling đak pơgang 'bâu phu.a

English: Then Elkanah went to his house at Ramah. But the child ministered to the LORD before Eli the priest.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Êlkana wih brŏk tơ pơlei sư tơ Rama, kon hơ'lơ̆p noh oei tơ noh bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp Hêli 'bok soi.

English: Now the sons of Eli were corrupt; they did not know the LORD.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Hêli jing bơngai kơnê̆ tơpă, bre sư ưh kơ băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang.

English: And the priests’ custom with the people was that when any man offered a sacrifice, the priest’s servant would come with a three-pronged fleshhook in his hand while the meat was boiling.
Bahnar: Tơdrong juăt lu 'bok soi pơm hăm kon pơlei thoi âu; tơdah đei bu wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi, lu đĭch đam 'bok soi năm kơplah đe oei pai 'nhĕm, ti sư chĕp chơ'mŏng chơkrơ pêng tŏ hơnĕnh.

English: Then he would thrust it into the pan, or kettle, or caldron, or pot; and the priest would take for himself all that the fleshhook brought up. So they did in Shiloh to all the Israelites who came there.
Bahnar: Sư 'bet lăm gŏ glah, gŏ 'bŭng, gŏ 'bei, dah lăm gŏ teh. 'Nhĕm sĕch ayơ mă đom tơ chơ'mŏng chơkrơ, 'bok soi gô iŏk kơ sư kơdih. Noh tơdrong lu sư pơm hăm kon pơlei Isơrael bơngai bu mă năm tơ pơlei Silô.

English: Also, before they burned the fat, the priest’s servant would come and say to the man who sacrificed, “Give meat for roasting to the priest, for he will not take boiled meat from you, but raw.”
Bahnar: Mă adrol kơ wă 'buh rơmă, lu đĭch đam 'bok soi truh khan kơ bơngai wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi noh, Ăn bĕ 'nhĕm sĕch noh kơ 'bok soi wă phang, yua kơ sư ưh kơ wă iŏk 'nhĕm mă iĕm pai hơtŭk sĭn, sư wă iŏk 'nhĕm oei hơdrih đĕch.

English: And if the man said to him, “They should really burn the fat first; then you may take as much as your heart desires,” he would then answer him, “No, but you must give it now; and if not, I will take it by force.”
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bơngai noh khan kơ sư, gô đei 'buh lê̆ rơmă sư adrol 'mơ̆i, na ih gơh iŏk mơ̆ng kơ ih wă, sư khan ưh, ih athei ăn hrei âu hloi, tơdah ưh kơ ăn, kơnh inh gô hơđuh iŏk.

English: Therefore the sin of the young men was very great before the LORD, for men abhorred the offering of the LORD.
Bahnar: Noh tơdrong yoch bre kon drŏ-nglo âu tih tơpă 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Yua kơ lu sư pơjăm tơmam soi pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang lăng ưh kơ gĭt.

English: But Samuel ministered before the LORD, even as a child, wearing a linen ephod.
Bahnar: Gah Samuel bơ̆jang 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, sư oei 'lơ̆p, hrŭk ao Êphôt đe tanh hăm brai se.

English: Moreover his mother used to make him a little robe, and bring it to him year by year when she came up with her husband to offer the yearly sacrifice.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm mĕ sư tanh ăn kơ sư minh blah ao tai iĕ, năm ba kơ Samuel, năm hơdai klo sư năm wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lăm rim sơnăm.

English: And Eli would bless Elkanah and his wife, and say, “The LORD give you descendants from this woman for the loan that was given to the LORD.” Then they would go to their own home.
Bahnar: Hêli sơkat pŭn hiôk ăn kơ Êlkana hăm akăn sư khan, apinh Kră Yang ăn kơ ih kon hơ'lơ̆p păng bơngai drŏ-kăn âu đei kon hơ'lơ̆p plơ̆ng wă tơplih kơ kon sư mă pơjao boih kơ Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng noh bre sư wih brŏk tơ hnam bre sư.

English: And the LORD visited Hannah, so that she conceived and bore three sons and two daughters. Meanwhile the child Samuel grew before the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang mơnat kơ Hana, na đei anăp tơpŭ pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo păng 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-kăn. Kon tơdăm anăn Samuel rai wơ̆ 'lŏ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: Now Eli was very old; and he heard everything his sons did to all Israel, and how they lay with the women who assembled at the door of the tabernacle of meeting.
Bahnar: Hêli đĭ kră dêh sư kơtơ̆ng kơ tơdrong bre kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael păng tơdrong lu kon sư 'bĭch hơdai hăm bre bơngai drŏ-kăn bơ̆jang 'bơ̆t anih 'măng Bơsŭn Anih Akŭm.

English: So he said to them, “Why do you do such things? For I hear of your evil dealings from all the people.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ bre kon sư, Liơ lu iĕm pơm tơdrong thoi noh? Inh kơtơ̆ng đe roi pơđâu lăm kon pơlei kơ tơdrong măr iĕm đei pơm.

English: No, my sons! For it is not a good report that I hear. You make the LORD’s people transgress.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ pă pơm thoi noh, ơ bre kon drŏ-nglo inh, ưh kơ 'lơ̆ng ôh tơdrong inh kơtơ̆ng lu kon pơlei Kră Yang roi pơdah rai să.

English: If one man sins against another, God will judge him. But if a man sins against the LORD, who will intercede for him?” Nevertheless they did not heed the voice of their father, because the LORD desired to kill them.
Bahnar: Tơdah minh 'nu bơngai pơm yoch hăm bơngai nai, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm 'long sơlam bre sư; mă-lei tơdah pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang, bu mă gơh krao tơgŭm sư? Mă-lei bre sư ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng ôh nơ̆r 'bă lu sư; Thoi noh Kră Yang pơlôch bre sư.

English: And the child Samuel grew in stature, and in favor both with the LORD and men.
Bahnar: Samuel rai wơ̆ 'lŏ lăm akâu; pơm ăn kơ Kră Yang hăm kon bơngai bơ̆n lăp đon.

English: Then a man of God came to Eli and said to him, “Thus says the LORD: ‘Did I not clearly reveal Myself to the house of your father when they were in Egypt in Pharaoh’s house?
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ Hêli păng khan kơ sư, Kră Yang khan boih thoi âu, hăm trŏ kơ Inh đei tơ'bôh bơih Inh kơdih kơ hnam 'bok ih kơplah lu sư oei lăm char Êyiptơ pơm đĭch Pharaôn?

English: Did I not choose him out of all the tribes of Israel to be My priest, to offer upon My altar, to burn incense, and to wear an ephod before Me? And did I not give to the house of your father all the offerings of the children of Israel made by fire?
Bahnar: Inh đei rơih iŏk 'bok sư bơih 'bok ih đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch bơngai Isơrael ăn kơ sư pơm 'bok soi Inh, tŏk tơ chơnang soi Inh, soh pơgang 'bâu phu, hrŭk ao Êphôt 'bơ̆t anăp Inh; Inh kư̆m ăn bơih kơ adrĕch ih dôm tơmam soi 'buh đơ̆ng adrĕch lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: Why do you kick at My sacrifice and My offering which I have commanded in My dwelling place, and honor your sons more than Me, to make yourselves fat with the best of all the offerings of Israel My people?’
Bahnar: Thoi yơ mă ih pơjăm tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi phe 'ba pơyơ̆r kơ Inh, tơdrong noh Inh tơtă bơih? Liơ mă ih chu yom kơeng kơ kon ih hloh kơ chu yom kơ Inh păng sa dôm lu tơmam soi wă kơ bek păng tơmam soi 'lơ̆ng hloh đơ̆ng lu kon pơlei Isơrael Inh pơyơ̆r?

English: Therefore the LORD God of Israel says: ‘I said indeed that your house and the house of your father would walk before Me forever.’ But now the LORD says: ‘Far be it from Me; for those who honor Me I will honor, and those who despise Me shall be lightly esteemed.
Bahnar: Lei na Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei khan. Inh pơkă bơih hăm hnam ih păng hnam 'bok ih gô bơ̆jang kơ inh ling-lang hloi. Mă-lei dang ei Kră Yang khan: Ưh kơ lei ôh. Inh gô pơyom kơ bơngai bu mă pơyom kơ Inh, bơngai bu mă pơjăm Inh, Inh kư̆m gô pơjăm sư.

English: Behold, the days are coming that I will cut off your arm and the arm of your father’s house, so that there will not be an old man in your house.
Bahnar: 'Nâu, đơ̆ng âu tơ anăp Inh gô pơtôch lê̆ lu bơngai oei đơ̆ng pran kơtang đơ̆ng adrĕch ih, hăm lu bơngai đơ̆ng adrĕch 'bok ih. Thoi ei wă ưh kơ đei bu arih dĭng kră lăm adrĕch ih.

English: And you will see an enemy in My dwelling place, despite all the good which God does for Israel. And there shall not be an old man in your house forever.
Bahnar: Ih gô 'bôh đei tơdrong rŭng răng lăm adrĕch Ih, mă khan đei pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ lu bơngai Isơrael ră mă-lei kư̆m oei ưh kơ đei bu arih dĭng kră lăm adrĕch ih dơ̆ng.

English: But any of your men whom I do not cut off from My altar shall consume your eyes and grieve your heart. And all the descendants of your house shall die in the flower of their age.
Bahnar: Inh gô oei lê̆ minh 'nu đơ̆ng lăm adrĕch iĕm, wă kơ oei bơ̆jang tơ chơnang soi inh, mă-lei bơngai noh arih pơmat-tat chhŭr nuih lăm jơhngơ̆m. Yua kơ lu kon hơ'lơ̆p păng lu bơngai nai gô lôch kơ đao gưm.

English: Now this shall be a sign to you that will come upon your two sons, on Hophni and Phinehas: in one day they shall die, both of them.
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu gô truh kơ 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo ih Hopni păng Phinêhas wă tơbăt kơ ih; dôm tơdrong gô trŏ thoi Inh đei khan bre sư gô lôch lăm minh năr.

English: Then I will raise up for Myself a faithful priest who shall do according to what is in My heart and in My mind. I will build him a sure house, and he shall walk before My anointed forever.
Bahnar: Na inh gô rơih chă kơ Inh kơdih minh 'nu 'bok soi tơnăp tơpăt, bơngai noh gô pơm lăp kơ jơhngơ̆m Inh; Inh gô ăn kơ sư đei minh adrĕch 'lơ̆ng tơpăt wă kơ pơm 'bok soi ling-lang hloi hăm bơngai mă Inh đei hling đak pơgang 'bâu phu.

English: And it shall come to pass that everyone who is left in your house will come and bow down to him for a piece of silver and a morsel of bread, and say, “Please, put me in one of the priestly positions, that I may eat a piece of bread.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu mă oei arih lăm adrĕch ih gô năm apinh minh hlak jên hu păng minh tơpei 'bĕng, na khan, Inh wă apinh ih, tơmơ̆t inh lăm lu 'bok soi wă kơ inh đei 'bĕng sa.

English: Now the boy Samuel ministered to the LORD before Eli. And the word of the LORD was rare in those days; there was no widespread revelation.
Bahnar: Samuel oei 'lơ̆p sư bơ̆jang kơ Kră Yang 'bơ̆t anăp Hêli. Kơplah noh nơ̆r, Kră Yang mă pơma dơnuh anăp mă hui kơđei, kư̆m hui kơ đei ăn kơ kon bơngai 'bôh tơdrong kiơ.

English: And it came to pass at that time, while Eli was lying down in his place, and when his eyes had begun to grow so dim that he could not see
Bahnar: Hêli măt ưh pă bang, pă 'bôh nhen, lăm minh măng ei, sư 'bĭch tơ anih sư juăt kơ 'bĭch tep.

English: and before the lamp of God went out in the tabernacle of the LORD where the ark of God was, and while Samuel was lying down
Bahnar: Ŭnh kơđeng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh tam mă păt, Samuel 'bĭch tep lăm hnam akŭm Kră Yang tơ anih đe dan hom pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: that the LORD called Samuel. And he answered, “Here I am!”
Bahnar: Kră Yang krao Samuel; na sư tơl: Đei inh tơ âu!

English: So he ran to Eli and said, “Here I am, for you called me.” And he said, “I did not call; lie down again.” And he went and lay down.
Bahnar: Sư kơdâu năm tơ Hêli khan: Đei inh tơ âu, ih krao inh ah. Hêli khan: Inh ưh kơ đei krao ôh, năm tep dơ̆ng bĕ. Samuel năm tep dơ̆ng.

English: Then the LORD called yet again, “Samuel!” So Samuel arose and went to Eli, and said, “Here I am, for you called me.” He answered, “I did not call, my son; lie down again.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang krao dơ̆ng: Ơ Samuel! Samuel gruih iung, năm tơ Hêli khan: Đei inh tơ âu, ih krao inh ah. Hêli tơl, ơ dăm, inh ưh kơ đei krao ih ôh, năm tep dơ̆ng wăi.

English: (Now Samuel did not yet know the LORD, nor was the word of the LORD yet revealed to him.)
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Samuel tam mă băt kơ nơ̆r Kră Yang; nơ̆r Kră Yang tam mă pơma tơklă 'bơ̆t anăp sư tơ'bôh kơ sư.

English: And the LORD called Samuel again the third time. So he arose and went to Eli, and said, “Here I am, for you did call me.” Then Eli perceived that the LORD had called the boy.
Bahnar: Kră Yang krao đơ̆ng Samuel wơ̆t mă pêng; sư gruih iung năm tơ Hêli, na khan: Ih krao inh ah? Kơplah noh Hêli băt kơ Kră Yang krao bơngai hơ'lơ̆p noh.

English: Therefore Eli said to Samuel, “Go, lie down; and it shall be, if He calls you, that you must say, ‘Speak, LORD, for Your servant hears.’ ” So Samuel went and lay down in his place.
Bahnar: Na Hêli khan kơ Samuel: Ih năm tep wăi. Tơdah đei nơ̆r krao ih dơ̆ng, ih tơl: Ơ Kră Yang, apinh Ih khan bĕ, Inh đĭch Ih oei mơ̆ng! Samuel năm tep tơ anih sư dơ̆ng.

English: Now the LORD came and stood and called as at other times, “Samuel! Samuel!” And Samuel answered, “Speak, for Your servant hears.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang năm tơ noh, Sư krao dơ̆ng thoi adrol ki: Ơ Samuel! Ơ Samuel! Samuel drơ̆ng Apinh Ih bơtho khan bĕ, đĭch đam ih oei mơ̆ng!

English: Then the LORD said to Samuel: “Behold, I will do something in Israel at which both ears of everyone who hears it will tingle.
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Samuel: Inh wă pơm tơ lăm Isơrael minh tơdrong, bơngai bu mơ̆ng 'bar pah đon sư gô hrơ̆ng hreng.

English: In that day I will perform against Eli all that I have spoken concerning his house, from beginning to end.
Bahnar: Năr noh, Inh gô pơm 'blep dôm tơdrong thoi inh đei khan lê̆ adrol boih gah hnam dơnŏ Hêli: Đơ̆ng blŭng-a truh tơ tôch.

English: For I have told him that I will judge his house forever for the iniquity which he knows, because his sons made themselves vile, and he did not restrain them.
Bahnar: Inh đei khan lê̆ adrol bơih Inh gô phak hnam dơnŏ sư ling-lang, yua kơ sư băt boih bre kon drŏ-nglo sư pơm yoch pơjăm Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei sư ưh kơ găn bre sư.

English: And therefore I have sworn to the house of Eli that the iniquity of Eli’s house shall not be atoned for by sacrifice or offering forever.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, inh đei pơkă sĭt tơdrong yoch hnam dơnŏ Hêli ưh kơ gơh huai iŏk, mă khan hăm tơmam soi hăm sem dah hăm tơmam soi phe 'ba.

English: So Samuel lay down until morning, and opened the doors of the house of the LORD. And Samuel was afraid to tell Eli the vision.
Bahnar: Samuel tep dĭng truh hơdah, đơ̆ng noh sư pơih 'măng hnam akŭm Kră Yang. Sư hli na ưh kơ pơ̆n roi dôm tơdrong tơ'bôh kơ sư noh kơ Hêli.

English: Then Eli called Samuel and said, “Samuel, my son!” He answered, “Here I am.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Hêli krao Samuel: Ơ Samuel, kon dăm năm tơ âu, sư tơl: Đei inh tơ âu.

English: And he said, “What is the word that the LORD spoke to you? Please do not hide it from me. God do so to you, and more also, if you hide anything from me of all the things that He said to you.”
Bahnar: Hêli jet: Kră Yang đei pơma bơtho tơdrong kiơ hăm ih? Ih 'nĕ ôn kơ inh ôh. Tơdah ih ôn lăm dôm nơ̆r mă Kră Yang đei pơma dơnuh bơtho hăm ih, apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei phak ih mă trăp.

English: Then Samuel told him everything, and hid nothing from him. And he said, “It is the LORD. Let Him do what seems good to Him.”
Bahnar: Na Samuel roi đĭ dôm tơdrong, ưh kơ đei ôn kiơ hăm sư. Hêli tơl khan: Sư bơih Kră Yang, apinh Sư pơm dôm tơdrong thoi Sư lăp đon!

English: So Samuel grew, and the LORD was with him and let none of his words fall to the ground.
Bahnar: Samuel wơ̆ 'lŏ gơh hơgei, Kră Yang oei hơdai sư: Kră Yang ưh kơ đei lê̆ minh nơ̆r hơyơ đơ̆ng Sư mă đei pơma boih. Sư gô pơm keh.

English: And all Israel from Dan to Beersheba knew that Samuel had been established as a prophet of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng Đan truh tơ Bêrsêba, đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael băt ngăl kơ Samuel jing 'bok khan lê̆ adrol tơpăt đơ̆ng Kră Yang ăn.

English: Then the LORD appeared again in Shiloh. For the LORD revealed Himself to Samuel in Shiloh by the word of the LORD.
Bahnar: Kră Yang jur tơ'bôh dơ̆ng akâu Sư tơ kông Silơ, tơ kông Silơ Kră Yang tơ'bôh akâu sư kơdih, jur pơma dơnuh hăm Samuel.

English: And the word of Samuel came to all Israel. Now Israel went out to battle against the Philistines, and encamped beside Ebenezer; and the Philistines encamped in Aphek.
Bahnar: Samuel roi tơbăt ăn kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael nơ̆r Kră Yang. Isơrael năm blah bơngai Philistin păng anih lu sư oei 'bơ̆t jê̆ Êbênêser, gah Philistin anih lu sư oei jê̆ pơlei Aphek.

English: Then the Philistines put themselves in battle array against Israel. And when they joined battle, Israel was defeated by the Philistines, who killed about four thousand men of the army in the field.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin lu sư gă năm blah Isơrael; Isơrael thuơ kơ đe Philistin păng đei bơngai lôch tơ anih tơblah noh dang puăn-rơbâu 'nu.

English: And when the people had come into the camp, the elders of Israel said, “Why has the LORD defeated us today before the Philistines? Let us bring the ark of the covenant of the LORD from Shiloh to us, that when it comes among us it may save us from the hand of our enemies.”
Bahnar: Wă kon pơlei mă oei arih brŏk tơ kơđông linh, lu đe kră Isơrael khan: Yua kơ kiơ năr 'nâu Kră Yang ăn kơ đe Philistin tơblah pơrăm lu bơ̆n? Lu bơ̆n năm tung iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang đơ̆ng Silô; brŏk tơ âu Sư gô oei hơdai bơ̆n dŏng pơklaih lu bơ̆n đơ̆ng ti lu bơngai ayăt kơ bơ̆n!

English: So the people sent to Shiloh, that they might bring from there the ark of the covenant of the LORD of hosts, who dwells between the cherubim. And the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, were there with the ark of the covenant of God.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, lu sư wơh bơngai năm tơ Silô, tung iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Tơ'ngla mă oei tơ lăm lu chêrubim. 'Bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Hêli, jơ̆ Hopni păng Phinêhas, bre sư kư̆m năm kiơ̆ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n.

English: And when the ark of the covenant of the LORD came into the camp, all Israel shouted so loudly that the earth shook.
Bahnar: Wă Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang tung tơmơ̆t truh tơ lăm kơđông linh, đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael jreo hiôk chơt tih, teh mah pơpơ̆.

English: Now when the Philistines heard the noise of the shout, they said, “What does the sound of this great shout in the camp of the Hebrews mean?” Then they understood that the ark of the LORD had come into the camp.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r noh, na jet khan: Nơ̆r jreo re hiôk chơt tih lăm kơđông linh lu bơngai Hêbrơ noh kiơ kih? Lu sư kơtơ̆ng băt khan Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang đe 'nao tung truh tơ lăm kơđông.

English: So the Philistines were afraid, for they said, “God has come into the camp!” And they said, “Woe to us! For such a thing has never happened before.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin lu sư hli, lu sư khan: Lu yang 'nao truh lăm kơđông linh. Đơ̆ng noh lu sư ôr khan Răm boih kơ lu bơ̆n! Mă đơ̆ng sơ̆ ưh tam lah kơtơ̆ng khan đei tơdrong truh thoi noh.

English: Woe to us! Who will deliver us from the hand of these mighty gods? These are the gods who struck the Egyptians with all the plagues in the wilderness.
Bahnar: Răm boih kơ lu bơ̆n! Bu gô pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng ti lu yang mă mơsêh kơtang dang noh? Noh bơih lu yang mă pơrăm kon pơlei Êyiptơ tơm tơdrong truh tơ lăm char glă.

English: Be strong and conduct yourselves like men, you Philistines, that you do not become servants of the Hebrews, as they have been to you. Conduct yourselves like men, and fight!”
Bahnar: Ơ bơngai Philistin, mă nuih bĕ, tơblah mă kơtang bĕ! Kơnh hli kơ iĕm pơm đĭch kon pơlei Hêbrơ, thoi lu sư đei pơm đĭch lu iĕm! Athei mă nuih kơtang năm blah bĕ!

English: So the Philistines fought, and Israel was defeated, and every man fled to his tent. There was a very great slaughter, and there fell of Israel thirty thousand foot soldiers.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin năm tơblah, bơngai Isơrael thuơ kơdâu ôn brŏk tơ bơsŭn lu sư kơdih. Noh bơih jĭ minh tơdrong tơblah thuơ tih dêh; pêng-jĭt rơbâu linh trong teh lôch glơch glach.

English: Also the ark of God was captured; and the two sons of Eli, Hophni and Phinehas, died.
Bahnar: Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe blah iŏk, 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Hêli, Hopni păng Phinêhas, lôch.

English: Then a man of Benjamin ran from the battle line the same day, and came to Shiloh with his clothes torn and dirt on his head.
Bahnar: Minh 'nu bơngai Bênjamin kơdâu ôn klĕch đơ̆ng anih tơblah, truh tơ Silô lăm năr noh, sư hek hơbĕn ao hiah đĭ, iŏk 'mui teh săi 'bĕnh kơ kơ̆l wă tơ'bôh đei tơdrong sơ'ngon.

English: Now when he came, there was Eli, sitting on a seat by the wayside watching, for his heart trembled for the ark of God. And when the man came into the city and told it, all the city cried out.
Bahnar: Lăp bơngai ei truh, Hêli oei hơ-oei kơpal tang-dŏ sư 'bơ̆t cheng trong, răp gô hăm jơhngơ̆m hli tơtăm; Hêli sư hli tơtăm kơ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei. Wă bơngai noh mơ̆t lăm pơlei roi, đĭ bơngai lăm pơlei bu bu kư̆m ôr hơdrăi.

English: When Eli heard the noise of the outcry, he said, “What does the sound of this tumult mean?” And the man came quickly and told Eli.
Bahnar: Hêli kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r ôr re na khan: Tơjrông tơjrang kơ kiơ hah? Na bơngai noh hăt hot kơ roi ăn kơ Hêli.

English: Eli was ninety-eight years old, and his eyes were so dim that he could not see.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Hêli đĭ tơsĭn-jĭt tơhngam sơnăm bơih. Măt bơbul, ưh pă gơh 'bôh.

English: Then the man said to Eli, “I am he who came from the battle. And I fled today from the battle line.” And he said, “What happened, my son?”
Bahnar: Bơngai noh khan kơ Hêli: Inh âu bơngai mă klĕch đơ̆ng anih tơblah năr âu. Hêli jet khan: Ơ dăm, lei tơdrong truh liơ liơ?

English: So the messenger answered and said, “Israel has fled before the Philistines, and there has been a great slaughter among the people. Also your two sons, Hophni and Phinehas, are dead; and the ark of God has been captured.”
Bahnar: Bơngai noh tơl: Bơngai Isơrael thuơ kơdâu ôn 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei Philistin; kon pơlei bơ̆n thuơ tih dêh. Đơ̆ng noh, 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo ih Hopni păng Phinêhas kư̆m lôch păng Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe blah iŏk bơih.

English: Then it happened, when he made mention of the ark of God, that Eli fell off the seat backward by the side of the gate; and his neck was broken and he died, for the man was old and heavy. And he had judged Israel forty years.
Bahnar: Wă sư roi truh tơ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, Hêli arăng hơron pơ̆k hraih đang đơ̆ng tang-dŏ hơtat kong koi lôch hloi; yua kơ sư đĭ kră trăp trĭn. Sư pơm 'bok sek tơlang đe Isơrael lăm puăn-jĭt sơnăm.

English: Now his daughter-in-law, Phinehas’s wife, was with child, due to be delivered; and when she heard the news that the ark of God was captured, and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and gave birth, for her labor pains came upon her.
Bahnar: Mŏ mai sư, akăn Phinêhas, oei anăp wă jê̆ rơneh; kơtơ̆ng khan đe blah iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei păng kơtơ̆ng khan Hêli tơnei sư păng klo sư lôch, na kơtă ei sư jĭ anăp sư pơtăm kŭl-tăng tơpŭ hloi.

English: And about the time of her death the women who stood by her said to her, “Do not fear, for you have borne a son.” But she did not answer, nor did she regard it.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t sư wă jê̆ lôch, lu bơngai drŏ-kăn kơ'mĭn khan: 'Nĕ kơ hli ôh, ih tơpŭ kơ minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo. Mă-lei sư ưh pă tơl, ưh pă đei kơtơ̆ng kiơ.

English: Then she named the child Ichabod, saying, “The glory has departed from Israel!” because the ark of God had been captured and because of her father-in-law and her husband.
Bahnar: Sư anăn kơ kon hơ'lơ̆p sư noh Ikabôt,a wă khan: Tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đĭ weh jăk đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael; Sư pơma noh wă khan gah Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe blah iŏk, hăm tơnei păng klo sư lôch.

English: And she said, “The glory has departed from Israel, for the ark of God has been captured.”
Bahnar: Sư pơma dơ̆ng: Tơpă, tơdrong ư-ang Kră Yang đe Isơrael đĭ weh boih đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael yua kơ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe đĭ blah iŏk bơih.

English: Then the Philistines took the ark of God and brought it from Ebenezer to Ashdod.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ kon pơlei Philistin blah iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, đơ̆ng Êbênêser tơ pơlei Asdôt.

English: When the Philistines took the ark of God, they brought it into the house of Dagon and set it by Dagon.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, lu sư iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p 'Bok Kei-Dei tơmơ̆t lăm hnam kơkuh kơ yang Dagôn dan 'bơ̆t jê̆ rup yang Dagôn.

English: And when the people of Ashdod arose early in the morning, there was Dagon, fallen on its face to the earth before the ark of the LORD. So they took Dagon and set it in its place again.
Bahnar: Pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng kon pơlei Asdôt lu sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih 'bôh đơ̆ng rup yang Đagơn păk kơmŭ brum 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, Pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng dơ̆ng, lu sư iung đơ̆ng hrôih kư̆m 'bôh rup yang Dagôn păk kơmŭ brum tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, mă-lei pơgê noh lăp oei 'bôh pă akâu, kơ̆l păng 'bar pah ti kơtĕch 'bôh tă tơ 'măng.

English: And when they arose early the next morning, there was Dagon, fallen on its face to the ground before the ark of the LORD. The head of Dagon and both the palms of its hands were broken off on the threshold; only Dagon’s torso was left of it.
Bahnar: Pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng Asdôt iung đơ̆ng hrôih, 'bôh yang Dagôn 'bĭch kơmŭ brum tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, kơ̆l păng 'bar pah ti kơtĕch kơdih phara pha. Klơ̆m lê̆ 'bơ̆t 'măng hnam, oei pă akâu sư đĕch oei 'bơ̆t kơtă ei.

English: Therefore neither the priests of Dagon nor any who come into Dagon’s house tread on the threshold of Dagon in Ashdod to this day.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi ei, truh tơ dang ei, lu 'bok soi tơm Dagôn, mă bu bu wă mơ̆t tơ lăm hnam sư noh, lu sư wer ưh kơ pơ̆n chro jơ̆ng yak trong 'măng ei.

English: But the hand of the LORD was heavy on the people of Ashdod, and He ravaged them and struck them with tumors, both Ashdod and its territory.
Bahnar: Ti Kră Yang tuh ăn tơdrong pơmat-tat tih kơ kon pơlei Asdôt, ba tơdrong hli krưp, pơm ăn răm truh tơ lăm lu sư păng lu pơlei oei jê̆ kiơ̆ ei đei, tơdrong jĭ tôch hơbuh.

English: And when the men of Ashdod saw how it was, they said, “The ark of the God of Israel must not remain with us, for His hand is harsh toward us and Dagon our god.”
Bahnar: Wă kon pơlei Asdôt 'bôh lu sư đei tơdrong truh, lu sư pơma tơduă lu sư khan: Ưh pă gơh lê̆ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael tơ âu hăm lu bơ̆n dơ̆ng, yua kơ ti Kră Yang ăn tơdrong gleh phak truh tih tơ lu bơ̆n păng tơ yang Dagôn, lu bơ̆n.

English: Therefore they sent and gathered to themselves all the lords of the Philistines, and said, “What shall we do with the ark of the God of Israel?” And they answered, “Let the ark of the God of Israel be carried away to Gath.” So they carried the ark of the God of Israel away.
Bahnar: Lu sư wơh krao akŭm đĭ lu yŏng pơgơ̆r đe Philistin, na jet: Bơ̆n wă pơm liơ hăm Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael âu? Lu yŏng pơgơ̆r tơl khan: Athei tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael năm ba tơ pơlei Gat. Na đe năm tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang. 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael truh tơ noh.

English: So it was, after they had carried it away, that the hand of the LORD was against the city with a very great destruction; and He struck the men of the city, both small and great, and tumors broke out on them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đơ̆ng rŏng kơ đe tung Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei truh tơ pơlei Gat boih Kră Yang phak pơlei ei, ăn đei tơdrong truh kơ lu sư hli rŭng răng. Lăm kon pơlei noh, đơ̆ng hơ'lơ̆p truh tơ đe kră; đĭ lu sư tă kơ đei jĭ pơtôch ngăl.

English: Therefore they sent the ark of God to Ekron. So it was, as the ark of God came to Ekron, that the Ekronites cried out, saying, “They have brought the ark of the God of Israel to us, to kill us and our people!”
Bahnar: Na, lu sư wơh đe tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ pơlei Ekrôn, wă Hom Pơgơ̆p noh truh tơ pơlei Ekrôn kon pơlei Ekrôn ôr krao: Đe tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael truh tơ bơ̆n wă pơlôch bơ̆n păng kon pơlei pơla lu bơ̆n!

English: So they sent and gathered together all the lords of the Philistines, and said, “Send away the ark of the God of Israel, and let it go back to its own place, so that it does not kill us and our people.” For there was a deadly destruction throughout all the city; the hand of God was very heavy there.
Bahnar: Lu sư wơh krao akŭm lu yŏng pơgơ̆r đe Philistin, na khan: Athei tung ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael, wih ba sư tơ anih sư so lê̆ tơ âu kơnh hli kơ nhôn păng kon pơlei nhôn lôch. Yua kơ kon pơlei krưp; tơ noh Kră Yang kư̆m ăn tơdrong gleh phak tih dêh.

English: And the men who did not die were stricken with the tumors, and the cry of the city went up to heaven.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă tam mă lôch kư̆m đei jĭ pơtôch đơ̆ng lăm pơlei đei nơ̆r ôr krao truh tơ plĕnh ti

English: Now the ark of the LORD was in the country of the Philistines seven months.
Bahnar: Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang oei tơ lăm char Philistin đei tơpơh khei.

English: And the Philistines called for the priests and the diviners, saying, “What shall we do with the ark of the LORD? Tell us how we should send it to its place.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin krao lu 'bok soi păng 'bok pơjâu, na jet khan: Bơ̆n wă pơm liơ kơ Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang? Roi bĕ kơ lu nhôn băt pơm thoi yơ gơh pơdrâu Hom Pơgơ̆p noh tơ anih so.

English: So they said, “If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, do not send it empty; but by all means return it to Him with a trespass offering. Then you will be healed, and it will be known to you why His hand is not removed from you.”
Bahnar: Lu sư tơl khan: Tơdah lu iĕm wă ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang đe Isơrael wih 'nĕ kơ năm ba hoh đĕch; iĕm athei chĕp ba tơmam soi wă huai iŏk tơdrong glăi, na lu iĕm gơh klaih păng kư̆m băt yua kơ kiơ Sư ăn tơdrong gleh truh ling-lang tơ iĕm noh.

English: Then they said, “What is the trespass offering which we shall return to Him?” They answered, “Five golden tumors and five golden rats, according to the number of the lords of the Philistines. For the same plague was on all of you and on your lords.
Bahnar: Lu sư jet: Tơmam soi yă kiơ lu nhôn pơyơ̆r kơ Kră Yang wă kơ huai iŏk đơ̆ng tơdrong glăi? 'Bok soi păng lu bơngai pơjâu tơl khan: Pơđăm tŏ rup pơtôch pơm păng maih păng pơđăm tŏ kơne pơm păng maih, kiơ̆ kơ kơsơ̆ yŏng pơgơ̆r bơngai Philistin, yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu iĕm păng lu yŏng pơgơ̆r kư̆m đei tơdrong gleh truh lei-lăi ngăl.

English: Therefore you shall make images of your tumors and images of your rats that ravage the land, and you shall give glory to the God of Israel; perhaps He will lighten His hand from you, from your gods, and from your land.
Bahnar: Pơm bĕ lu rup pơtôch păng lu rup kơne mă oei pơrăm phe 'ba, na lu iĕm pơyơ̆r ư-ang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei đe Isơrael; Rŏ lăng sư huay pă ăn tơdrong truh phak lu iĕm, lu yang iĕm păng mir 'ba dêh char iĕm.

English: Why then do you harden your hearts as the Egyptians and Pharaoh hardened their hearts? When He did mighty things among them, did they not let the people go, that they might depart?
Bahnar: Liơ mă lu iĕm oei arăng kơ̆l thoi lu bơngai Êyiptơ păng Pharaôn pơm. Iĕm hăm 'blŏk ưh Kră Yang phak pơmat lu sư thoi yơ, na mah ăn kơ kon pơlei năm.

English: Now therefore, make a new cart, take two milk cows which have never been yoked, and hitch the cows to the cart; and take their calves home, away from them.
Bahnar: Na dang ei lu iĕm athei pơm minh pơm gre 'nao, rôp 'bar tŏ rơmo yŏng kon oei mŏm tam mă lah tah tơ 'long ăt tah hloi tơ gre mă-lei athei puh tơmơ̆t lê̆ kon iĕ lăm hơdrong, 'nĕ ăn druh kiơ̆ yŏng sư.

English: Then take the ark of the LORD and set it on the cart; and put the articles of gold which you are returning to Him as a trespass offering in a chest by its side. Then send it away, and let it go.
Bahnar: Na iĕm tung tah Hom Pơgơ̆p 'Bok Kei-dei tơ lăm gre noh. Tơ gah cheng Hom Pơgơ̆p lu iĕm tah lăm hôp tơmam pơyơ̆r hăm maih mă lu iĕm wă pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi huai đơ̆ng yoch glăi. Na tah rơmo achăng lê̆ năm kơdih.

English: And watch: if it goes up the road to its own territory, to Beth Shemesh, then He has done us this great evil. But if not, then we shall know that it is not His hand that struck us—it happened to us by chance.”
Bahnar: Na lu iĕm lăng hnhoi sư năm; tơdah lu sư năm tơ gah hơdral char sư tơ pơlei Bêt Sêmes, lei 'nâu Kră Yang 'Bok kei-Dei Isơrael boih phak pơrăm bơ̆n; mă-lei tơdah rơmo yak năm trong nai lei ưh kơ trŏ Kră Yang 'bok Kei-Dei phak lu bơ̆n. Tơdrong phak truh noh băt truh kơdih đĕch.

English: Then the men did so; they took two milk cows and hitched them to the cart, and shut up their calves at home.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin pơm kiơ̆ lui, sư rôp 'bar tŏ rơmo yŏng oei tơmŏm kon tah tơmơ̆t tơ gre păng chĭt lê̆ kon sư tơ lăm hơdrong.

English: And they set the ark of the LORD on the cart, and the chest with the gold rats and the images of their tumors.
Bahnar: Lu sư tah Hom Pơgơ̆p lăm gre, hăm tah hôp rup pơtôch đek pơm păng maih păng kơne kư̆m pơm păng maih.

English: Then the cows headed straight for the road to Beth Shemesh, and went along the highway, lowing as they went, and did not turn aside to the right hand or the left. And the lords of the Philistines went after them to the border of Beth Shemesh.
Bahnar: 'Bar tŏ rơmo hor gre yak tơpăt tơ rok trong pơlei Bêt Sêmes, ưh kơ weh tơ 'ma dah tơ 'ngiĕo. Lu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Philistin kiơ̆ lăng đơ̆ng rŏng truh tơ hơdral pơlei Bet Semes.

English: Now the people of Beth Shemesh were reaping their wheat harvest in the valley; and they lifted their eyes and saw the ark, and rejoiced to see it.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei, pơlei Bêt Sêmes oei kĕch 'ba bơyan lăm thŭng, wă lu sư ngơk lăng 'bôh Hom Pơgơ̆p, lu sư chhôk 'nă tơpă.

English: Then the cart came into the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh, and stood there; a large stone was there. So they split the wood of the cart and offered the cows as a burnt offering to the LORD.
Bahnar: Gre rơmo 'nao wă jê̆ dơ̆ng tơ mir 'bok Jôsuê bơngai pơlei Bêt Sêmes dơ̆ng. Tơ noh đei minh pơm tơmo tih. Kon pơlei teng blah gre rơmo noh pơm 'long ŭnh 'buh pơyơ̆r 'bar tŏ rơmo yŏng noh pơm tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: The Levites took down the ark of the LORD and the chest that was with it, in which were the articles of gold, and put them on the large stone. Then the men of Beth Shemesh offered burnt offerings and made sacrifices the same day to the LORD.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Lêwi iŏk tung tơjur Hom Pơgơ̆p păng hôp tah rup yang păng maih noh dan kơpal tơmo tih noh. Lu bơngai pơlei Bêt Sêmes pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang lăm char noh.

English: So when the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.
Bahnar: Pơđăm 'nu lăm Kră pơgơ̆r 'bôh dôm tơdrong noh, lu sư wih brŏk tơ pơlei Ekrôn hloi lăm năr noh.

English: These are the golden tumors which the Philistines returned as a trespass offering to the LORD: one for Ashdod, one for Gaza, one for Ashkelon, one for Gath, one for Ekron
Bahnar: 'Nâu pơđăm tŏ rup pơtôch pơm hăm maih bơngai Philistin pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang pơm tơmam soi huai yoch dơ̆ng glăi. Minh pơm kơ pơlei Asdôt, minh pơm kơ pơlei Gasa, minh pơm kơ pơlei Askalon, minh pơm kơ pơlei Gat, minh pơm kơ pơlei Ekrôn.

English: and the golden rats, according to the number of all the cities of the Philistines belonging to the five lords, both fortified cities and country villages, even as far as the large stone of Abel on which they set the ark of the LORD, which stone remains to this day in the field of Joshua of Beth Shemesh.
Bahnar: Lu rup kơne pơm hăm maih kư̆m asong kơ pơđăm tŏ pơlei kiơ̆ kơ pơđăm 'nu kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Philistin iŏk đơ̆ng pơlei tih kơjăp truh tơ lu pơlei iĕ ataih. Tơmo tih mă đêl dan Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang oei đei truh kơ dang ei lăm mir 'bok Jôsuê bơngai pơlei Bêt Sêmes.

English: Then He struck the men of Beth Shemesh, because they had looked into the ark of the LORD. He struck fifty thousand and seventy men of the people, and the people lamented because the LORD had struck the people with a great slaughter.
Bahnar: Kră Yang phak kon pơlei Bêt Sêmes yua kơ lu sư pơih lăng tơ lăm Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang. Sư pơlôch tơpơh-jĭt 'nu lăm lu sư. Kon pơlei nhơ̆m hmoi yua kơ Kră Yang phak lu sư tih tơpă.

English: And the men of Beth Shemesh said, “Who is able to stand before this holy LORD God? And to whom shall it go up from us?”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Bêt Sêmes khan: Bu kĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei 'lơ̆ng rơgoh 'nâu? Lu bơ̆n wă năm ba Hom Pơgơ̆p âu đơ̆ng lu bơ̆n kơ bu.

English: So they sent messengers to the inhabitants of Kirjath Jearim, saying, “The Philistines have brought back the ark of the LORD; come down and take it up with you.”
Bahnar: Lu sư wơh bơngai năm khan kơ pơlei Kiriat Jêrim, khan lu bơngai Philistin tung ba pơdrâu boih Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, jur năm tơ âu tung iŏk kơ lu iĕm bĕ.

English: Then the men of Kirjath Jearim came and took the ark of the LORD, and brought it into the house of Abinadab on the hill, and consecrated Eleazar his son to keep the ark of the LORD.
Bahnar: Đe Kiriat Jêrim năm tung iŏk Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang, ba tơ hnam Abinađap, tơ kơpal groi, đơ̆ng noh rơih iŏk Êlêasar, kon drŏ-nglo sư, wă wei-lăng Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang.

English: So it was that the ark remained in Kirjath Jearim a long time; it was there twenty years. And all the house of Israel lamented after the LORD.
Bahnar: Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang đe ming lê̆ tơ Kiriat Jêrim đunh 'biơ̆ mơ̆n, mah 'bar-jĭt sơnăm, đĭ-đăng đe Isơrael nhơ̆m 'blŏk wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang.

English: Then Samuel spoke to all the house of Israel, saying, “If you return to the LORD with all your hearts, then put away the foreign gods and the Ashtoreths from among you, and prepare your hearts for the LORD, and serve Him only; and He will deliver you from the hand of the Philistines.”
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael thoi âu: Tơdah đĭ jơhngơ̆m wih brŏk tơ Kră Yang, iĕm athei hŭt lê̆ lu rup yang bơngai tơmoi păng rup yang drŏ-kăn Astarôt đơ̆ng lăm iĕm, na đĭ jơhngơ̆m kiơ̆ Kră Yang, lăp kơ bơ̆jang kơ minh 'nu Sư đĕch. Sư gô dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng bơngai Philistin ngei ngei.

English: So the children of Israel put away the Baals and the Ashtoreths, and served the LORD only.
Bahnar: Na bơngai Isơrael klơ̆m hŭt lu yang Baal păng rup yang Astarôt, kơkuh kơ minh 'nu Kră Yang đĕch.

English: And Samuel said, “Gather all Israel to Mizpah, and I will pray to the LORD for you.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Samuel khan: Athei krao akŭm đĭ bơngai Isơrael tơ pơlei Mispa, inh gô krao apinh Kră Yang tơgŭm ăn kơ lu iĕm.

English: So they gathered together at Mizpah, drew water, and poured it out before the LORD. And they fasted that day, and said there, “We have sinned against the LORD.” And Samuel judged the children of Israel at Mizpah.
Bahnar: Lu sư akŭm đĭ tơ Mispa, chhŏ đak păng tuh đak noh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Lăm năr noh lu sư ơ̆t kơ sŏng sa păng tơbral: Lu nhôn đei pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang. Samuel pơgơ̆r păng pơm 'bok sek tơlang kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now when the Philistines heard that the children of Israel had gathered together at Mizpah, the lords of the Philistines went up against Israel. And when the children of Israel heard of it, they were afraid of the Philistines.
Bahnar: Wă lu bơngai Philistin kơtơ̆ng khan lu bơngai Isơrael akŭm tơ Mispa, na lu yŏng pơgơ̆r lu sư năm blah bơngai Isơrael, lu bơngai Isơrael kơtơ̆ng khan tơdrong âu, lu sư hli kơ lu bơngai Philistin.

English: So the children of Israel said to Samuel, “Do not cease to cry out to the LORD our God for us, that He may save us from the hand of the Philistines.”
Bahnar: Na khan kơ Samuel khan: Apinh ih krao khan kơ Kră Yang ling-lang, wă kơ Sư dŏng pơklaih nhôn đơ̆ng ti bơngai Philistin.

English: And Samuel took a suckling lamb and offered it as a whole burnt offering to the LORD. Then Samuel cried out to the LORD for Israel, and the LORD answered him.
Bahnar: Samuel rôp minh pơm triu kon oei mŏm, pơyơ̆r pơm tơmam soi 'buh kơ Kră Yang. Sư krao khan apinh Kră Yang; Kră Yang tơl nơ̆r sư.

English: Now as Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel. But the LORD thundered with a loud thunder upon the Philistines that day, and so confused them that they were overcome before Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah Samuel oei pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh lu bơngai Philistin năm blah lu bơngai Isơrael. Mă-lei lăm năr ei Kră Yang ăn grơ̆m glaih jruh tơ bơngai Philistin, pơm kơ lu bơngai Philistin hli tơrơ kơdâu tơklah tơklang.

English: And the men of Israel went out of Mizpah and pursued the Philistines, and drove them back as far as below Beth Car.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Isơrael lĕch đơ̆ng Mispa druh blah bơngai Philistin truh tơ ala kơ pơlei Bêtkar đei pơlôch lơ bơngai.

English: Then Samuel took a stone and set it up between Mizpah and Shen, and called its name Ebenezer, saying, “Thus far the LORD has helped us.”
Bahnar: Samuel iŏk pơdơ̆ng minh pơm tơmo tih dan 'bơ̆t sơlam Mispa păng Sen, sư anăn Êbênêser.a Sư khan: Kră Yang đei tơgŭm lu bơ̆n truh tơ âu.

English: So the Philistines were subdued, and they did not come anymore into the territory of Israel. And the hand of the LORD was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.
Bahnar: Philistin thuơ bơih, ưh pă pơ̆n tơgar iŏk teh đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael dơ̆ng. Đĭ chăl arih Samuel, ti Kră Yang găn ưh kơ ăn bơngai Philistin tơgar iŏk dơ̆ng.

English: Then the cities which the Philistines had taken from Israel were restored to Israel, from Ekron to Gath; and Israel recovered its territory from the hands of the Philistines. Also there was peace between Israel and the Amorites.
Bahnar: Lu pơlei mă bơngai Philistin đei blah iŏk đơ̆ng bơngai Isơrael đơ̆ng pơlei Ekrôn truh tơ pơlei Gat, lu sư pơdrâu đĭ kơ bơngai Isơrael; bơngai Isơrael đei iŏk teh noh đơ̆ng bơngai Philistin pơgơ̆r na đei tơdrong rơngei oei hiôk-hian bơngai Isơrael hăm bơngai Amôrit.

English: And Samuel judged Israel all the days of his life.
Bahnar: Samuel pơgơ̆r păng pơm 'bok sek tơlang kơ bơngai Isơrael đĭ chăl arih sư.

English: He went from year to year on a circuit to Bethel, Gilgal, and Mizpah, and judged Israel in all those places.
Bahnar: Rim sơnăm sư chă dăr jơ̆p kơ pơlei tih Bethel, Gilgal păng Mispa chă sek tơlang ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla bơngai Isơrael tơ lăm lu pơlei noh.

English: But he always returned to Ramah, for his home was there. There he judged Israel, and there he built an altar to the LORD.
Bahnar: Na sư wih brŏk tơ pơlei Rama, anih hnam sư oei. Tơ noh sư kư̆m sek tơlang kơ kon pơlei Isơrael păng pơm chơnang soi kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Now it came to pass when Samuel was old that he made his sons judges over Israel.
Bahnar: Kơplah Samuel đĭ kră bơih, na pơjao ăn kơ lu kon drŏ-nglo sư pơgơ̆r pơm 'bok sek tơlang kơ bơngai Isơrael.

English: The name of his firstborn was Joel, and the name of his second, Abijah; they were judges in Beersheba.
Bahnar: Kon kơdră sư anăn Jôel păng kon mă 'bar sư anăn Abija, bre sư pơm 'bok sek tơlang tơ lăm pơlei Bêrsêba.

English: But his sons did not walk in his ways; they turned aside after dishonest gain, took bribes, and perverted justice.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-nglo sư ưh kơ rok kiơ̆ 'bă bre sư ôh, bre sư hưch ham kơ jên tơmam, pơgâm sa tơmam đe păng sek ưh kơ tơpăt.

English: Then all the elders of Israel gathered together and came to Samuel at Ramah
Bahnar: Na đĭ-đăng lu yŏng kră pơgơ̆r bơngai Isơrael akŭm băl, năm chă Samuel tơ hnam Sư tơ pơlei Rama

English: and said to him, “Look, you are old, and your sons do not walk in your ways. Now make us a king to judge us like all the nations.”
Bahnar: Lu sư khan kơ sư: Ih đĭ kră pă kĕ bơih na bre kon drŏ-nglo ih ưh kơ rok thoi ih. Lei na apinh ih chă ăn kơ lu nhôn minh 'nu pơtao wă kơ pơgơ̆r lu nhôn, thoi lu adrĕch adrung nai mă đei pơtao pơgơ̆r.

English: But the thing displeased Samuel when they said, “Give us a king to judge us.” So Samuel prayed to the LORD.
Bahnar: Kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư apinh: Ăn bĕ kơ lu nhôn minh 'nu pơtao wă pơgơ̆r lu nhôn, nơ̆r noh Samuel ưh kơ lap đon ôh; na Samuel krao khan apinh Kră Yang.

English: And the LORD said to Samuel, “Heed the voice of the people in all that they say to you; for they have not rejected you, but they have rejected Me, that I should not reign over them.
Bahnar: Kră Yang tơl Samuel khan: Ih athei pơm kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r kon pơlei apinh ih; noh ưh kơ sĭ lu sư sơngah kơ ih ôh, noh lu sư sơngah kơ Inh, ưh kơ wă kơ Inh pơm pơtao wei-lăng pơgơ̆r lu sư dơ̆ng.

English: According to all the works which they have done since the day that I brought them up out of Egypt, even to this day—with which they have forsaken Me and served other gods—so they are doing to you also.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơm kơ ih kư̆m thoi lu sư juăt kơ pơm kơ Inh iŏk đơ̆ng năr Inh pơklaih lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ truh tơ dang ei, lu sư achăng lê̆ inh na kơkuh kơ yang nai.

English: Now therefore, heed their voice. However, you shall solemnly forewarn them, and show them the behavior of the king who will reign over them.”
Bahnar: Na dang ei, ih athei mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu sư, mă-lei ih 'nĕ hiơt pơma mă trŏ mă 'lơ̆ng păng tơbăt kơ lu sư băt kơ pơtao mă wă pơgơ̆r lu sư noh gô liơ kơnh.

English: So Samuel told all the words of the LORD to the people who asked him for a king.
Bahnar: Samuel roi ăn kơ kon pơlei dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang đei khan gah tơdrong lu sư đei apinh sư wă kơ đei pơtao

English: And he said, “This will be the behavior of the king who will reign over you: He will take your sons and appoint them for his own chariots and to be his horsemen, and some will run before his chariots.
Bahnar: na khan: 'Nâu tơdrong mă pơtao iĕm gô pơgơ̆r lu iĕm. Sư gô rôp kon drŏ-nglo iĕm pơm linh wă huơ̆r gre aseh sư, dah ăn hao aseh, mơ'nah yak jơ̆ng wă kơ năm tơblah adrol kơ gre sư.

English: He will appoint captains over his thousands and captains over his fifties, will set some to plow his ground and reap his harvest, and some to make his weapons of war and equipment for his chariots.
Bahnar: Sư gô ăn pơm yŏng kơ rơbâu 'nu linh păng pơm yŏng kơ pơđăm-jĭt 'nu, dah rôp lu sư choh chŭn sư, kĕch kơ sư 'ba, hơjơ̆m tơmam tơblah ăn kơ sư păng lu tơmam pơm gre aseh tơblah.

English: He will take your daughters to be perfumers, cooks, and bakers.
Bahnar: Sư gô rôp kon adruh lu iĕm pơm pơgang 'bâu phu kơ sư, pai gŏ ăn kơ sư păng thơ̆ pơm 'bĕng mi kơ sư.

English: And he will take the best of your fields, your vineyards, and your olive groves, and give them to his servants.
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk mir chŭn, pơgar hơmu păng mir 'long ôliwơ mă 'lơ̆ng hloh đơ̆ng lu iĕm, na ăn kơ đĭch đam sư.

English: He will take a tenth of your grain and your vintage, and give it to his officers and servants.
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk thuê̆ minh lăm mơjĭt đơ̆ng chŭn mir iĕm păng pơgar hơmu lu iĕm na asong ăn kơ lu pơm 'bok kuan păng đĭch đam sư.

English: And he will take your male servants, your female servants, your finest young men, and your donkeys, and put them to his work.
Bahnar: Sư gô rôp lu đĭch đam drŏ-nglo, drŏ-kăn, lu adruh tơdăm mă pran kơtang đơ̆ng lu iĕm, truh tơ mah rôp iŏk rơmo aseh iĕ iĕm yua lăm tơdrong jang sư.

English: He will take a tenth of your sheep. And you will be his servants.
Bahnar: Sư gô iŏk thuê̆ minh lăm mơjĭt gah bơbe triu lu iĕm păng lu iĕm gô pơm đĭch đam kơ sư.

English: And you will cry out in that day because of your king whom you have chosen for yourselves, and the LORD will not hear you in that day.”
Bahnar: Kơplah ei kơnh lu iĕm gô ôr krao yua kơ đơ̆ng pơtao mă iĕm đei rơih iŏk noh, mă-lei Kră Yang ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r lu iĕm ôh.

English: Nevertheless the people refused to obey the voice of Samuel; and they said, “No, but we will have a king over us
Bahnar: Kon pơlei sơngah ưh kơ wă mơ̆ng nơ̆r Samuel, na khan: Ưh ôh, wă kơ đei minh 'nu pơtao pơgơ̆r lu nhôn.

English: that we also may be like all the nations, and that our king may judge us and go out before us and fight our battles.”
Bahnar: Lu nhôn wă kơ đei pơtao thoi lu adrĕch nai; pơtao pơgơ̆r lu nhôn gô năm adrol kơ lu nhôn, na tơblah ăn kơ lu nhôn.

English: And Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he repeated them in the hearing of the LORD.
Bahnar: Samuel mơ̆ng dôm nơ̆r lu kon pơlei pơla, na sư krao khan roi ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: So the LORD said to Samuel, “Heed their voice, and make them a king.” And Samuel said to the men of Israel, “Every man go to his city.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang drơ̆ng nơ̆r Samuel: Athei chu kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r lu sư păng ăn kơ lu sư minh 'nu pơtao. Kơplah ei Samuel khan kơ lu bơngai Isơrael: Lu iĕm rim 'nu athei wih brŏk tơ pơlei iĕm kơdih.

English: There was a man of Benjamin whose name was Kish the son of Abiel, the son of Zeror, the son of Bechorath, the son of Aphiah, a Benjamite, a mighty man of power.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei, đei minh 'nu adrĕch Bênjamin, anăn sư Kis, kon drŏ-nglo Abiel, sâu tơm Sêrôr, sâu Bêkơrat, sâu ach Aphia, adrĕch bơngai Bênjamin.

English: And he had a choice and handsome son whose name was Saul. There was not a more handsome person than he among the children of Israel. From his shoulders upward he was taller than any of the people.
Bahnar: Kis đei kon drŏ-nglo, anăn sư Sôl, sư oei tơdăm kư̆m 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ. Lăm bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei bu 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ thoi sư; sư bơngai tih kơjung hloh kơ đe.

English: Now the donkeys of Kish, Saul’s father, were lost. And Kish said to his son Saul, “Please take one of the servants with you, and arise, go and look for the donkeys.”
Bahnar: Kis đei lu aseh iĕ akăn wơ̆l jrok. Kis khan kơ Sôl kon sư: Athei chông ba minh 'nu đĭch đam kiơ̆, năm chă lu aseh iĕ akăn jrok.

English: So he passed through the mountains of Ephraim and through the land of Shalisha, but they did not find them. Then they passed through the land of Shaalim, and they were not there. Then he passed through the land of the Benjamites, but they did not find them.
Bahnar: Sư năm chă jơ̆p kơ kông groi Êphraim, jơ̆p kơ tơring Salisa ră, mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh; na sư năm dơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ tơring Salim, jơ̆p kơ dêh Bênjamin, mă-lei kư̆m oei ưh kơ 'bôh 'mơ̆i.

English: When they had come to the land of Zuph, Saul said to his servant who was with him, “Come, let us return, lest my father cease caring about the donkeys and become worried about us.”
Bahnar: Sư năm truh tơ tơring Sup, Sôl khan kơ đam mă kiơ̆ sư ei: Thôi bĕ ba wih brŏk đĕch, hli kơ 'bă inh tơtăm kơ ba hloh kơ sư tơtăm kơ aseh iĕ noh.

English: And he said to him, “Look now, there is in this city a man of God, and he is an honorable man; all that he says surely comes to pass. So let us go there; perhaps he can show us the way that we should go.”
Bahnar: Bơngai đam ei drơ̆ng Sôl: Mơ̆ng bĕ, lăm pơlei âu đei minh 'nu bơngai Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua, bơngai mă đe pơyom; dôm nơ̆r sư pơma adrol trŏ ngăl ưh kơ layơ glăi. Thoi noh, bĕ ba năm tơ ei, rŏ lăng sư gô tơ'bôh kơ ba trong chă aseh jrok noh tơ yơ.

English: Then Saul said to his servant, “But look, if we go, what shall we bring the man? For the bread in our vessels is all gone, and there is no present to bring to the man of God. What do we have?”
Bahnar: Sôl khan kơ đam sư: Mă-lei ba iŏk yă kiơ wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ sư? Lăm kơdŭng ba tơmam sa ba đĭ bơih, ba ưh pă đei tơmam kiơ wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua noh. Ba ưh pă đei yă kiơ?

English: And the servant answered Saul again and said, “Look, I have here at hand one-fourth of a shekel of silver. I will give that to the man of God, to tell us our way.”
Bahnar: Đam sư drơ̆ng dơ̆ng: Kơdih inh oei đei pă pêng gram jên hu, inh gô pơyơ̆r jên hu noh ăn kơ bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua, na sư gô tơ'bôh ăn kơ ba trong.

English: (Formerly in Israel, when a man went to inquire of God, he spoke thus: “Come, let us go to the seer”; for he who is now called a prophet was formerly called a seer.)
Bahnar: Sơ̆ bơngai Isơrael, dah bơngai bu wă krao chă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, ngăl khan: Bĕ bơ̆n năm tơ'bơ̆p 'bok băt lê̆ adrol; bơngai mă bơ̆n krao 'bok khan lê̆ adrol.

English: Then Saul said to his servant, “Well said; come, let us go.” So they went to the city where the man of God was.
Bahnar: Sôl khan kơ đam sư: Trŏ boih bĕ ba năm. Bre sư năm truh tơ pơlei bơngai mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei yua ei oei.

English: As they went up the hill to the city, they met some young women going out to draw water, and said to them, “Is the seer here?”
Bahnar: Kơplah măr sư oei rok trong suan tŏk tơ pơlei, na măr sư tơ'bơ̆p đe hơdruh jur năm sŏ đak, na jet khan: 'Bok mă băt lê̆ adrol hăm tơ âu ưh?

English: And they answered them and said, “Yes, there he is, just ahead of you. Hurry now; for today he came to this city, because there is a sacrifice of the people today on the high place.
Bahnar: Đe hơdruh ei tơl: Đei to, sư tơ anăp măr iĕm. Mă-lei iĕm yak mă tĕnh hŏ, sư 'nao mơ̆t tơ pơlei, yua kơ năr 'nâu kon pơlei pơla wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi tơ kơpal groi.

English: As soon as you come into the city, you will surely find him before he goes up to the high place to eat. For the people will not eat until he comes, because he must bless the sacrifice; afterward those who are invited will eat. Now therefore, go up, for about this time you will find him.”
Bahnar: Mưh mơ̆t lăm pơlei, măr iĕm tơ'bơ̆p sư ngei adrol kơ sư năm tơ groi wă et sa. Kon pơlei ưh kơ et sa ôh adrol kơ sư truh, yua kơ sư gô sơkat ăn pŭn hiôk kơ tơmam soi; đang bơih, na đe năm akŭm ei gơh et sa. Năm bĕ măr iĕm, măr iĕm gô tơ'bơ̆p sư.

English: So they went up to the city. As they were coming into the city, there was Samuel, coming out toward them on his way up to the high place.
Bahnar: Bre sư yak năm 'bơ̆t wă mơ̆t tơ pơlei, na tơ'bơ̆p Samuel wă lĕch năm tơ kơpal kông groi et sa.

English: Now the LORD had told Samuel in his ear the day before Saul came, saying
Bahnar: Na mă adrol kơ Sôl wă truh tơ noh, Kră Yang khan lê̆ bơih kơ Samuel

English: “Tomorrow about this time I will send you a man from the land of Benjamin, and you shall anoint him commander over My people Israel, that he may save My people from the hand of the Philistines; for I have looked upon My people, because their cry has come to Me.”
Bahnar: Năr dơning, kư̆m lăm jơ 'nâu mơ̆n, inh gô wơh minh 'nu bơngai đơ̆ng lăm dêh Bênjamin năm tơ'bơ̆p ih, ih gô tuh đak pơgang ăn kơ sư pơm pơtao đe Isơrael. Sư gô dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei Inh đơ̆ng ti đe Philistin; yua kơ Inh 'blŏk mơnat kơ kon pơlei Inh păng nơ̆r lu sư ôr krao kơtơ̆ng truh tơ Inh.

English: So when Samuel saw Saul, the LORD said to him, “There he is, the man of whom I spoke to you. This one shall reign over My people.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Samuel 'bôh Sôl, Kră Yang khan kơ sư: 'Nâu, bơngai mă Inh đei khan lê̆ kơ ih adrol 'noh bơih bơngai mă wă pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Inh.

English: Then Saul drew near to Samuel in the gate, and said, “Please tell me, where is the seer’s house?”
Bahnar: Sôl năm jê̆ Samuel 'bơ̆t 'măng jang pơlei păng khan: Apinh ih tơ'bôh ăn kơ inh bĕ hnam 'bok mă băt lê̆ adrol tơ yơ.

English: Samuel answered Saul and said, “I am the seer. Go up before me to the high place, for you shall eat with me today; and tomorrow I will let you go and will tell you all that is in your heart.
Bahnar: Samuel tơl: Inh bơih lah 'bok noh. Năm adrol kơ inh bĕ tơ groi to. Năr âu măr iĕm gô sŏng sa hơdai inh; na dơning inh gô roi ăn dôm tơdrong lăm jơhngơ̆m ih, đơ̆ng noh na ih wih.

English: But as for your donkeys that were lost three days ago, do not be anxious about them, for they have been found. And on whom is all the desire of Israel? Is it not on you and on all your father’s house?”
Bahnar: Gah lu aseh iĕ akăn mă ih chă ưh kơ 'bôh đĭ pêng năr kơ 'nâu noh, ih 'nĕ pă hiơ̆k yua kơ đei chă 'bôh bơih. Lu bơngai Isơrael hơpơi chă noh bu? Hăm trŏ kơ ih păng đĭ kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă ih ưh?

English: And Saul answered and said, “Am I not a Benjamite, of the smallest of the tribes of Israel, and my family the least of all the families of the tribe of Benjamin? Why then do you speak like this to me?”
Bahnar: Sôl drơ̆ng: Inh jĭ minh 'nu adrĕch bơngai Bênjamin minh adrĕch iĕ hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lăm Isơrael; hnam dơnŏ inh jĭ hnam dơnŏ iĕ hloh lăm hnam dơnŏ adrĕch Bênjamin. Liơ ih pơma hăm inh khan thoi ei lĕ?

English: Now Samuel took Saul and his servant and brought them into the hall, and had them sit in the place of honor among those who were invited; there were about thirty persons.
Bahnar: Samuel chông Sôl păng đam sư mơ̆t lăm anih să, ba bre sư oei 'bơ̆t anih anăp hloh kơ pêng-jĭt 'nu bơngai năm akŭm et sa ei.

English: And Samuel said to the cook, “Bring the portion which I gave you, of which I said to you, ‘Set it apart.’ ”
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ bơngai pai gŏ: Ih athei hiŏng 'nhĕm sa mă inh ăn kơ ih păng pơkă khan: Athei 'măn lê̆ pha noh.

English: So the cook took up the thigh with its upper part and set it before Saul. And Samuel said, “Here it is, what was kept back. It was set apart for you. Eat; for until this time it has been kept for you, since I said I invited the people.” So Saul ate with Samuel that day.
Bahnar: 'Bok pai gŏ ei iŏk 'nhĕm sĕch blu na dan 'bơ̆t anăp Sôl. Samuel khan: 'Nhĕm mă dan 'bơ̆t anăp ih sa bĕ; 'nâu mă 'nhĕm inh athei 'măn lê̆ pha wă ăn kơ ih sa năr 'nâu hơdai hăm lu bơngai mă inh krao wơ̆n. Lăm năr noh, Sôl sŏng sa hơdai hăm Samuel.

English: When they had come down from the high place into the city, Samuel spoke with Saul on the top of the house.
Bahnar: Na, lu sư brŏk jur đơ̆ng anih akŭm ei mơ̆t tơ pơlei; na Samuel pơma dơnuh hăm Sôl tơ anih tơ kơpal bơbŭng hnam dơnă, Sôl tep hloi tơ noh.

English: They arose early; and it was about the dawning of the day that Samuel called to Saul on the top of the house, saying, “Get up, that I may send you on your way.” And Saul arose, and both of them went outside, he and Samuel.
Bahnar: Truh năr đơ̆ng rŏng, kơplah năr wă lĕch, Samuel krao Sôl tơ anih tơ kơpal na khan kơ sư thoi âu: Iung bĕ inh gô ba ih yak năm. Sôl gruih iung, na Samuel păng Sôl bre sư yak năm hơdai.

English: As they were going down to the outskirts of the city, Samuel said to Saul, “Tell the servant to go on ahead of us.” And he went on. “But you stand here awhile, that I may announce to you the word of God.”
Bahnar: Kơpah yak năm truh tơ hlôi kơ pơlei bơih, Samuel khan kơ Sôl: Ih athei đam ih rai năm adrol kơ ba. Đam sư ei rai năm adrol sư khan dơ̆ng: Dang ei dơ̆ng 'mơ̆i wă kơ inh roi kơ ih kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei khan kơ inh.

English: Then Samuel took a flask of oil and poured it on his head, and kissed him and said: “Is it not because the LORD has anointed you commander over His inheritance?
Bahnar: Samuel iŏk minh gĕl getchai iĕ mong đak rơmă 'bâu phu, na tuh tơ kơ̆l Sôl, đơ̆ng noh chŭm sư păng khan: 'Nâu Kră Yang tuh đak rơmă 'bâu phu kơ ih wă kơ ih pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Sư.

English: When you have departed from me today, you will find two men by Rachel’s tomb in the territory of Benjamin at Zelzah; and they will say to you, ‘The donkeys which you went to look for have been found. And now your father has ceased caring about the donkeys and is worrying about you, saying, “What shall I do about my son?” ’
Bahnar: Năr âu adrol wă weh tơklah đơ̆ng inh, ih gô tơ'bơ̆p 'bar 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo 'bơ̆t bơsat Rachel tơ pơlei Selsa, dêh Bênjamin; bre sư gô khan kơ ih: Lu aseh akăn mă ih chă noh 'bôh bơih; 'nâu 'bă ih ưh pă bơngơ̆t kơ aseh akăn noh dơ̆ng bơih, mă-lei sư bơngơ̆t kơ măr iĕm dơ̆ng na khan: Inh wă pơm liơ kơ kon drŏ-nglo inh âu?

English: Then you shall go on forward from there and come to the terebinth tree of Tabor. There three men going up to God at Bethel will meet you, one carrying three young goats, another carrying three loaves of bread, and another carrying a skin of wine.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh ih kư̆ yak năm, truh tơ tơm 'long kôih Tabôr, ih gô tơ'bơ̆p pêng 'nu năm tơ pơlei Bethel. Wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei, minh 'nu chĕp ba pêng tŏ kon bơbe tơno, minh 'nu chĕp ba pêng tŏ 'bĕng păng bơngai mă pêng chĕp ba minh tŏ get akar sik.

English: And they will greet you and give you two loaves of bread, which you shall receive from their hands.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô kơkuh kơ ih păng ăn kơ ih 'bar tŏ 'bĕng. Lei ih athei iŏk đơ̆ng lu sư.

English: After that you shall come to the hill of God where the Philistine garrison is. And it will happen, when you have come there to the city, that you will meet a group of prophets coming down from the high place with a stringed instrument, a tambourine, a flute, and a harp before them; and they will be prophesying.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh ih gô truh tơ Gibêah Elohima, jơ̆ minh pơm anih kơđông đe Philistin; kơplah ih mơ̆t bơih tơ pơlei, ih gô tơ'bơ̆p minh khŭl 'bok khan lê̆ adrol jur đơ̆ng anih kơkuh, lu sư suang reh brŏ dung teh hơgơ̆r iĕ, hlôm 'lal păng reh tĭng-nĭng năm adrol kơ ih; Lu sư gô khan lê̆ adrol.

English: Then the Spirit of the LORD will come upon you, and you will prophesy with them and be turned into another man.
Bahnar: Yang bơhngol Kră Yang gô mơ̆t lăm ih gô suang khan lê̆ adrol hăm lu sư, ih gô jing bơngai nai.

English: And let it be, when these signs come to you, that you do as the occasion demands; for God is with you.
Bahnar: Kơplah ih 'bôh dôm tơdrong tơdra âu truh, na ih athei pơm kiơ̆ trŏ dôm tơdrong sư tơ'bôh. Ih gô băt Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai ih!

English: You shall go down before me to Gilgal; and surely I will come down to you to offer burnt offerings and make sacrifices of peace offerings. Seven days you shall wait, till I come to you and show you what you should do.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, ih athei năm jur adrol kơ Inh tơ Gilgal, inh gô kiơ̆ ih tơ noh wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi băt bơnê. Ih athei gô Inh truh tơ noh tơpơh năr Inh gô bơtho ih dôm tơdrong ih athei pơm.

English: So it was, when he had turned his back to go from Samuel, that God gave him another heart; and all those signs came to pass that day.
Bahnar: Lăp Sôl wă weh đơ̆ng Samuel, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơplih jơhngơ̆m Sôl păng dôm tơdrong tơdra đei roi lê̆ adrol đĭ-đăng 'blep trŏ kơ lăm năr noh.

English: When they came there to the hill, there was a group of prophets to meet him; then the Spirit of God came upon him, and he prophesied among them.
Bahnar: Wă Sôl truh tơ Gibêah, đei minh khŭl 'bok khan lê̆ adrol sơng sư. Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang mơ̆t lăm sư, sư kư̆m khan lê̆ adrol hơdai lu sư.

English: And it happened, when all who knew him formerly saw that he indeed prophesied among the prophets, that the people said to one another, “What is this that has come upon the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?”
Bahnar: Kơplah lu bơngai đêl juăt băt kơ Sôl adrol, 'bôh sư khan lê̆ adrol hăm lu 'bok khan lê̆ adrol, na tơjet dih băl khan: Đei tơdrong kiơ truh kơ kon drŏ-nglo Kis noh kih? Sôl kư̆m mơ̆t hơdai hăm bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mơ̆n dah kiơ?

English: Then a man from there answered and said, “But who is their father?” Therefore it became a proverb: “Is Saul also among the prophets?”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai lăm Gibêah tơl: 'Bă lu sư bu hah? Na đei nơ̆r đơ̆ng sơ̆ khan: Sôl kư̆m dai bơngai khan lê̆ adrol dah kiơ?

English: And when he had finished prophesying, he went to the high place.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sôl ưh pă khan lê̆ adrol, na sư tŏk tơ anih kơjung kơpal groi.

English: Then Saul’s uncle said to him and his servant, “Where did you go?” So he said, “To look for the donkeys. When we saw that they were nowhere to be found, we went to Samuel.”
Bahnar: Ma Sôl jet sư păng đam sư: Măr iĕm năm tơ yơ? Sôl drơ̆ng sư: Nhi chă lu aseh iĕ akăn Jrok; ưh kơ 'bôh; na nhi năm apinh Samuel.

English: And Saul’s uncle said, “Tell me, please, what Samuel said to you.”
Bahnar: Ma Sôl pơma dơ̆ng: Apinh măr iĕm roi tơbăt kơ inh dôm tơdrong Samuel đei khan kơ măr iĕm.

English: So Saul said to his uncle, “He told us plainly that the donkeys had been found.” But about the matter of the kingdom, he did not tell him what Samuel had said.
Bahnar: Sôl roi kơ ma sư: Sư đei roi kơ nhi khan aseh iĕ akăn măr iĕm 'bôh bơih. Mă-lei Sôl ưh kơ đei roi gah Samuel tơ'bôh kơ sư tơdrong jang wă pơm pơtao ôh.

English: Then Samuel called the people together to the LORD at Mizpah
Bahnar: Samuel krao akŭm đĭ kon pơlei Isơrael năm tơ Kră Yang tơ Mispa

English: and said to the children of Israel, “Thus says the LORD God of Israel: ‘I brought up Israel out of Egypt, and delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians and from the hand of all kingdoms and from those who oppressed you.’
Bahnar: na khan kơ bơngai Isơrael: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael khan thoi âu: Inh đei chông ba bơngai Isơrael lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng Êyiptơ, inh đei dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng ti đe Êyiptơ păng đơ̆ng ti dôm lu pơtao pơgŏ pơđep lu iĕm.

English: But you have today rejected your God, who Himself saved you from all your adversities and your tribulations; and you have said to Him, ‘No, set a king over us!’ Now therefore, present yourselves before the LORD by your tribes and by your clans.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu iĕm sơngah kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, Tơ'ngla mă dŏng pơklaih iĕm đơ̆ng dôm tơdrong pơmat-tat păng hli hlơt; Lu iĕm đei apinh: Ăn kơ nhôn minh 'nu pơtao wă kơ pơgơ̆r lu nhôn! Na dang ei, hơmet bĕ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang pơrĕng kiơ̆ adrĕch adrung păng kiơ̆ kơtum kơtŏng.

English: And when Samuel had caused all the tribes of Israel to come near, the tribe of Benjamin was chosen.
Bahnar: Samuel athei đĭ-đăng adrĕch Isơrael năm jê̆, na sư hlang lăng trŏ kơ adrĕch Bênjamin.

English: When he had caused the tribe of Benjamin to come near by their families, the family of Matri was chosen. And Saul the son of Kish was chosen. But when they sought him, he could not be found.
Bahnar: Sư athei adrĕch Bênjamin năm jê̆ pơrĕng kiơ̆ kơtum kơtŏng, đơ̆ng noh hlang trŏ kơ hnam dơnŏ Matri. Đơ̆ng noh hlang lăng trŏ kơ Sôl kon drŏ-nglo Kis. Đe chă Sôl mă-lei ưh kơ 'bôh.

English: Therefore they inquired of the LORD further, “Has the man come here yet?” And the LORD answered, “There he is, hidden among the equipment.”
Bahnar: Na lu sư jet Kră Yang dơ̆ng: Hăm pă đei bu nai năm tơ âu dơ̆ng? Kră Yang tơl: To, sư ôn lăm anih lê̆ tơmam noh.

English: So they ran and brought him from there; and when he stood among the people, he was taller than any of the people from his shoulders upward.
Bahnar: Đe kơdâu chă sư tơ noh. Na chông Sôl lĕch năm tơ anăp tŏk-bŏk kon pơlei, sư kơjung hloh kơ đe, đe dang kiơ̆ hơngiĕng sư đĕch.

English: And Samuel said to all the people, “Do you see him whom the LORD has chosen, that there is no one like him among all the people?” So all the people shouted and said, “Long live the king!”
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ kon pơlei: Lu iĕm lăng 'nâu bơngai mă Kră Yang rơih iŏk? Lăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei hoh-hoy ưh kơ đei bu dang sư ôh. Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei jreo păng ôr khan: Ăn kơ pơtao arih ling-lang!

English: Then Samuel explained to the people the behavior of royalty, and wrote it in a book and laid it up before the LORD. And Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.
Bahnar: Samuel bơtho tơ'bôh tơdrong juăt kơ pơtao 'bơ̆t anăp kon pơlei, chih tơ sơ̆p hla bơar dan 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng noh, Samuel ăn kơ kon pơlei brŏk tơ hnam lu sư kơdih kơdih.

English: And Saul also went home to Gibeah; and valiant men went with him, whose hearts God had touched.
Bahnar: Sôl kư̆m brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih tơ Gibêah, đei lu linh pran kơtang mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn lu sư kư̆m brŏk kiơ̆ Sôl.

English: But some rebels said, “How can this man save us?” So they despised him, and brought him no presents. But he held his peace.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei lu bơngai mơ'nah pơjăm sư khan: Sư 'noh khan wă dŏng tơgŭm yă kiơ đei đăi? Lu sư pơjăm lăng Sôl ưh kơ rơ-a, ưh kơ wă chĕp ăn kơ sư tơmam kiơ ôh. Mă-lei Sôl sư ngăn hreh đĕch.

English: Then Nahash the Ammonite came up and encamped against Jabesh Gilead; and all the men of Jabesh said to Nahash, “Make a covenant with us, and we will serve you.”
Bahnar: Nahas, pơtao bơngai Ammôn, pơgơ̆r lu linh năm wang dăr pơlei Jabes lăm Gileat. Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei lăm Jabes năm apinh Nahas: Apinh ih ăn kơ nhôn kĭ pơgơ̆p hăm ih, na lu nhôn gô bơ̆jang kơ ih.

English: And Nahash the Ammonite answered them, “On this condition I will make a covenant with you, that I may put out all your right eyes, and bring reproach on all Israel.”
Bahnar: Nahas pơtao bơngai Ammôn tơl: Inh gô kĭ pơgơ̆p hăm lu iĕm kiơ̆ thoi âu: Ăp kơ đĭ-đăng lu iĕm ăn kơ inh kuek lê̆ măt minh pah gah 'ma, wă pơm mơlâu kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael.

English: Then the elders of Jabesh said to him, “Hold off for seven days, that we may send messengers to all the territory of Israel. And then, if there is no one to save us, we will come out to you.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu đe kră pơlei Jabes khan kơ sư: Apinh ih ăn kơ lu nhôn lăm tơpơh năr wă kơ, lu nhôn gô wơh bơngai năm chă khan jơ̆p-jang kon pơlei Isơrael; tơdah ưh kơ đei bu dŏng pơklaih lu nhôn, lei lu nhôn gô kŭp kơ̆l yơ̆r ti kơ ih.

English: So the messengers came to Gibeah of Saul and told the news in the hearing of the people. And all the people lifted up their voices and wept.
Bahnar: Thoi noh lu bơngai đei wơh ei năm tơ Gibêah, pơlei đe Sôl, roi dôm nơ̆r ei ăn kơ kon pơlei pơla kơtơ̆ng. Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei nhơ̆m ôr.

English: Now there was Saul, coming behind the herd from the field; and Saul said, “What troubles the people, that they weep?” And they told him the words of the men of Jabesh.
Bahnar: Kơplah ei, Sôl 'nao wă brŏk đơ̆ng chŭn, năm đơ̆ng rŏng kơ rơmo sư; na sư jet: Iĕm nhơ̆m kơ kiơ hah? Na đe roi kơ sư dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng pơlei Jabes năm chă khan ei.

English: Then the Spirit of God came upon Saul when he heard this news, and his anger was greatly aroused.
Bahnar: Lăp Sôl kơtơ̆ng tơdrong noh, sư đei Yang Bơhngol đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơtrŭt sư păng sư hil blĕk ơh dêh.
