English: So he took a yoke of oxen and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the territory of Israel by the hands of messengers, saying, “Whoever does not go out with Saul and Samuel to battle, so it shall be done to his oxen.” And the fear of the LORD fell on the people, and they came out with one consent.
Bahnar: Sư rôp minh hơgrop rơmo, sư kăt soch lê̆ na wơh bơngai chă asong jơ̆p-jang kơ dêh char Isơrael păng hăm nơ̆r tơbăt: Bơngai bu ưh kơ wă kiơ̆ Sôl păng Samuel, na lu rơmo lu sư kư̆m gô kăt soch thoi noh mơ̆n. Kră Yang pơm kơ kon pơlei băt hli kơ Sôl, na đĭ-đăng lu sư năm kiơ̆ sư.

English: When he numbered them in Bezek, the children of Israel were three hundred thousand, and the men of Judah thirty thousand.
Bahnar: Sôl akŭm lu sư tơ pơlei Bêsek; bơngai Isơrael pêng-hrĕng rơbâu, bơngai Juđa pêng-jĭt rơbâu 'nu.

English: And they said to the messengers who came, “Thus you shall say to the men of Jabesh Gilead: ‘Tomorrow, by the time the sun is hot, you shall have help.’ ” Then the messengers came and reported it to the men of Jabesh, and they were glad.
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ bơngai đe wơh năm đơ̆ng pơlei Jabes lăm char Gileat: Năm roi bĕ: 'Năr dơ̆ng tŏ dơning, lu iĕm gô đei tơdrong dŏng pơklaih. Lu bơngai đe wơh ei wih brŏk roi dôm nơ̆r ei kơ kon pơlei Jabes. Kon pơlei kơtơ̆ng thoi ei na lu sư chơt hiôk

English: Therefore the men of Jabesh said, “Tomorrow we will come out to you, and you may do with us whatever seems good to you.”
Bahnar: păng năm khan kơ Nahas pơtao Ammôn: Năr dơning lu nhôn kŭp kơ̆l yơ̆r ti kơ iĕm, lu iĕm wă pơm kiơ kơ lu nhôn mơ̆ng kơ iĕm wă.

English: So it was, on the next day, that Saul put the people in three companies; and they came into the midst of the camp in the morning watch, and killed Ammonites until the heat of the day. And it happened that those who survived were scattered, so that no two of them were left together.
Bahnar: Mă-lei pơgê dơning, Sôl klah asong kon pơlei pơm pêng khŭl, năm blah đe Ammôn păng pơlôch đĭ lu sư dĭng truh tơ 'năr dơ̆ng. Lu kon pơlei Ammôn kơdâu hơlah hơlang kơdih kơdih.

English: Then the people said to Samuel, “Who is he who said, ‘Shall Saul reign over us?’ Bring the men, that we may put them to death.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei apinh Samuel: Đe bu khan: Sôl khan wă pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r bơ̆n hah? Apinh ih pơjao lu bơngai 'noh ăn kơ nhôn pơlôch bĕ.

English: But Saul said, “Not a man shall be put to death this day, for today the LORD has accomplished salvation in Israel.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Sôl tơl lu sư: Năr âu lu bơ̆n ưh kơ gơh pơlôch bu; yua kơ năr âu Kră Yang đĕch ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael đei jơnei tih.

English: Then Samuel said to the people, “Come, let us go to Gilgal and renew the kingdom there.”
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ kon pơlei pơla thoi âu: Bĕ bơ̆n năm tơ Gilgal wă hơmet ming pơk Sôl pơm pơtao.

English: So all the people went to Gilgal, and there they made Saul king before the LORD in Gilgal. There they made sacrifices of peace offerings before the LORD, and there Saul and all the men of Israel rejoiced greatly.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon pơlei wang năm tơ Gilgal; tơ ei, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang lu sư pơk Sôl pơm pơtao. Tơ ei lu sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi bơnê kơ Kră Yang. Đơ̆ng noh, Sôl păng đĭ-đăng kon pơlei Isơrael et sa chơt hiôk pă băt dang yơ.

English: Now Samuel said to all Israel: “Indeed I have heeded your voice in all that you said to me, and have made a king over you.
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael: Inh chu kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r lu iĕm apinh inh; inh đei pơk minh 'nu pơtao wă pơgơ̆r lu iĕm.

English: And now here is the king, walking before you; and I am old and grayheaded, and look, my sons are with you. I have walked before you from my childhood to this day.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng năr âu pơtao noh gô pơgơ̆r lu iĕm. Gah inh đĭ kră bơih, sŏk ko bơih, mă-lei lu kon drŏ-nglo inh oei hơdai lu iĕm. Inh đei pơgơ̆r lu iĕm đơ̆ng inh oei tơdăm sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei.

English: Here I am. Witness against me before the LORD and before His anointed: Whose ox have I taken, or whose donkey have I taken, or whom have I cheated? Whom have I oppressed, or from whose hand have I received any bribe with which to blind my eyes? I will restore it to you.”
Bahnar: Âu inh dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm, 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang păng 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao mă Kră Yang đei tuh đak rơmă pơk pơm pơtao, wă kơ lu iĕm roi pơdah ăn. Inh hăm đei rôp rơmo bu ưh? Hăm rôp aseh đe bu ưh? Inh hăm hơlĕnh đe bu ưh? Pơm kơnê̆ tôn teh đe bu ưh? Inh hăm pơgâm sa đe wă bơbĭt lê̆ măt đe lăm dôm tơdrong jang kiơ ưh? Tơdah đei pơm thoi noh, gô pơdrâu đĭ kơ iĕm.

English: And they said, “You have not cheated us or oppressed us, nor have you taken anything from any man’s hand.”
Bahnar: Lu sư tơl: Ih ưh kơ đei hơlĕnh lu nhôn ôh, ưh kơ đei tôn teh lu nhôn păng ưh kơ đei iŏk sa pơgâm đơ̆ng ti đe bu ôh.

English: Then he said to them, “The LORD is witness against you, and His anointed is witness this day, that you have not found anything in my hand.” And they answered, “He is witness.”
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng: Kră Yang pơm kơdranh kơ iĕm; bơngai mă Sư tuh đak rơmă kư̆m pơm kơdranh kơ iĕm ưh kơ đei 'bôh kiơ lăm ti inh. Lu sư tơl: Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang pơm kơdranh kơ bơ̆n.

English: Then Samuel said to the people, “It is the LORD who raised up Moses and Aaron, and who brought your fathers up from the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ kon pơlei pơla: Kră Yang jơ̆ Tơ'ngla rơih Môis păng Arôn, chông ba yă 'bok lu iĕm lĕch đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Now therefore, stand still, that I may reason with you before the LORD concerning all the righteous acts of the LORD which He did to you and your fathers
Bahnar: Na dang ei, năm bĕ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, lê̆ inh gô sek tơlang lu iĕm lăm dôm tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt Kră Yang đei pơm tơgŭm lu iĕm păng yă 'bok lu iĕm.

English: When Jacob had gone into Egypt, and your fathers cried out to the LORD, then the LORD sent Moses and Aaron, who brought your fathers out of Egypt and made them dwell in this place.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Jakôp truh tơ Êyiptơ, yă 'bok lu iĕm đei krao apinh Kră Yang; Kră Yang wơh Môis păng Arôn chông anhăk yă 'bok iĕm sơ̆ lĕch đơ̆ng dêh char Êyiptơ, na ăn kơ lu sư oei tơ dêh char âu.

English: And when they forgot the LORD their God, He sold them into the hand of Sisera, commander of the army of Hazor, into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab; and they fought against them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei lu sư hiơt kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu sư, na Sư ăn lu sư kơ Sisêra, yŏng lu linh kơ pơtao đe Hasor, ăn lu sư lăm ti đe Philistin păng ăn kơ pơtao Môap; lu đe noh tơblah pơrăm lu sư.

English: Then they cried out to the LORD, and said, ‘We have sinned, because we have forsaken the LORD and served the Baals and Ashtoreths; but now deliver us from the hand of our enemies, and we will serve You.’
Bahnar: Lu sư ôr krao apinh Kră Yang: Lu nhôn đei pơm yoch, yua kơ lu nhôn achăng lê̆ Kră Yang, na kơkuh kơ yang Baal păng yang Astarôt; dang ei, apinh Ih dŏng pơklaih nhôn đơ̆ng ti bơngai ayăt hăm nhôn, na lu nhôn gô chu kiơ̆ kơ Ih.

English: And the LORD sent Jerubbaal, Bedan, Jephthah, and Samuel, and delivered you out of the hand of your enemies on every side; and you dwelt in safety.
Bahnar: Kră Yang wơh hĭ Jêrup Baal, Barak, Jeptha păng Samuel; lu sư dŏng pơklaih lu iĕm đơ̆ng ti lu ayăt tăp dăr kơ lu iĕm, ăn kơ lu iĕm oei arih hiôk-hian.

English: And when you saw that Nahash king of the Ammonites came against you, you said to me, ‘No, but a king shall reign over us,’ when the LORD your God was your king.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kơplah iĕm 'bôh Nahas, pơtao đe Ammôn, năm blah lu iĕm, lu iĕm năm khan kơ inh: Ưh ôh; lu nhôn athei đei minh 'nu pơtao pơgơ̆r lu nhôn; mă tơpă sư lăm noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơih pơm pơtao lu iĕm.

English: “Now therefore, here is the king whom you have chosen and whom you have desired. And take note, the LORD has set a king over you.
Bahnar: Dang ei, 'nâu pơtao lu iĕm mă đei rơih iŏk păng đei apinh. Kră Yang ăn kơ lu iĕm pơtao wă pơgơ̆r lu iĕm.

English: If you fear the LORD and serve Him and obey His voice, and do not rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then both you and the king who reigns over you will continue following the LORD your God.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu iĕm hli yom kơ Kră Yang, kơkuh kơ Sư, chu dôm nơ̆r Sư pơma, ưh pă kơchu hăm nơ̆r Sư tơtă athei; tơdah lu iĕm păng pơtao mă pơgơ̆r lu iĕm chu yom Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu iĕm, lei tơpă iĕm gô đei tơdrong pŭn hiôk.

English: However, if you do not obey the voice of the LORD, but rebel against the commandment of the LORD, then the hand of the LORD will be against you, as it was against your fathers.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm ưh kơ chu kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Kră Yang, ưh kơ chu nơ̆r sư tơtă athei, na ti Kră Yang gô ăn kơ tơdrong răm rai kơ lu iĕm kư̆m thoi sư ăn kơ yă 'bok iĕm sơ̆.

English: “Now therefore, stand and see this great thing which the LORD will do before your eyes
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm dơ̆ng hreh bĕ, lăng tơdrong tih dêh mă Kră Yang wă pơm 'bơ̆t anăp lu iĕm.

English: Is today not the wheat harvest? I will call to the LORD, and He will send thunder and rain, that you may perceive and see that your wickedness is great, which you have done in the sight of the LORD, in asking a king for yourselves.”
Bahnar: Năr âu, hăm trŏ kơ bơyan kĕch 'ba mi dah kiơ? Inh gô krao khan kơ Kră Yang tơpă đơ̆ng lăm jơhngơ̆m; Sư gô ăn 'mi grơ̆m glaih, wă kơ lu iĕm băt păng 'bôh kơdih iĕm đei pơm yoch tih 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, yua kơ iĕm apinh bơih minh 'nu pơtao.

English: So Samuel called to the LORD, and the LORD sent thunder and rain that day; and all the people greatly feared the LORD and Samuel.
Bahnar: Wă Samuel krao khan kơ Kră Yang; lăm năr noh Kră Yang ăn 'mi grơ̆m glaih; đĭ-đăng kon pơlei hli tơrơ dêh kơ Kră Yang păng Samuel.

English: And all the people said to Samuel, “Pray for your servants to the LORD your God, that we may not die; for we have added to all our sins the evil of asking a king for ourselves.”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu sư khan kơ Samuel: Apinh ih krao khan apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih ăn kơ lu nhôn, wă kơ lu nhôn huay kơ lôch; lu nhôn đei apinh wă kơ đei pơtao noh nhôn pơthim ăn tơdrong yoch kơ lu nhôn.

English: Then Samuel said to the people, “Do not fear. You have done all this wickedness; yet do not turn aside from following the LORD, but serve the LORD with all your heart.
Bahnar: Samuel tơl kon pơlei: 'Nĕ kơ hli. Tơpă iĕm đei pơm dôm tơdrong yoch âu; mă-lei 'nĕ kơ achăng Kră Yang, athei đĭ jơhngơ̆m chu kiơ̆ kơ Kră Yang.

English: And do not turn aside; for then you would go after empty things which cannot profit or deliver, for they are nothing.
Bahnar: 'Nĕ kơ achăng Kră Yang chă kơkuh kơ rup yang hiong răm đĕch, ưh kơ đei yua kiơ, ưh kơ băt pơklaih; yua kơ rup yang jơ̆ hiong răm đĕch.

English: For the LORD will not forsake His people, for His great name’s sake, because it has pleased the LORD to make you His people.
Bahnar: Kră Yang yua kơ anăn Sư tih dêh, na Sư ưh kơ achăng lê̆ kon pơlei Sư: Sư wă kơ lu iĕm pơm kon pơlei Sư.

English: Moreover, as for me, far be it from me that I should sin against the LORD in ceasing to pray for you; but I will teach you the good and the right way.
Bahnar: Gah inh, inh ưh kơ pơdơh kơ krao khan kơ iĕm. Wă kơ inh huay kơ pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang. Inh gô bơtho tơ'bôh lu iĕm băt kơ trong 'lơ̆ng păng tơpăt.

English: Only fear the LORD, and serve Him in truth with all your heart; for consider what great things He has done for you.
Bahnar: Athei băt hli yom kơ Kră Yang đĕch, đĭ jơhngơ̆m bơ̆jang kơ Sư; lu iĕm athei 'blŏk dôm tơdrong Sư pơm tih dêh kơ lu iĕm ưh kơ băt dang yơ!

English: But if you still do wickedly, you shall be swept away, both you and your king.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah lu iĕm hrăn oei pơm kơnê̆ ling-lang, lei lu iĕm păng pơtao lu iĕm tơpă gô hiong răm.

English: Saul reigned one year; and when he had reigned two years over Israel
Bahnar: Kơplah Sôl pơm pơtao, sư 'nao pêng-jĭt sơnăm. Sư đei pơgơ̆r đe Isơrael 'bar sơnăm bơih

English: Saul chose for himself three thousand men of Israel. Two thousand were with Saul in Michmash and in the mountains of Bethel, and a thousand were with Jonathan in Gibeah of Benjamin. The rest of the people he sent away, every man to his tent.
Bahnar: Na sư rơih iŏk pêng-rơbâu 'nu, đơ̆ng lăm bơngai Isơrael 'bar-rơbâu 'nu wă kơ oei hơdai sư tơ Mikmas păng tơ groi kông Bethel, oei pă minh-rơbâu 'nu noh oei hăm Jônathan tơ Gibêah lăm dêh Bênjamin. Kon pơlei mă oei oei dôm yơ noh, sư ăn brŏk, rim 'nu brŏk tơ bơsŭn lu sư kơdih.

English: And Jonathan attacked the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba, and the Philistines heard of it. Then Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, “Let the Hebrews hear!”
Bahnar: Jônathan blah kơđông pơlôch yŏng Philistin kơtơ̆ng tơ Gêba. Kon pơlei Philistin băt tơdrong noh. Sôl athei đe hlôm keng jơ̆p kơ tơring, na khan: Kon pơlei Hêbrơ mơ̆ng bĕ!

English: Now all Israel heard it said that Saul had attacked a garrison of the Philistines, and that Israel had also become an abomination to the Philistines. And the people were called together to Saul at Gilgal.
Bahnar: Wă đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael kơtơ̆ng bơih kơ Sôl blah kơđông pơlôch yŏng Philistin păng băt kơ Philistin areh ayăt kơ Isơrael. Kơplah ei, Sôl krao akŭm đĭ kon pơlei pơla tơ Gilgal.

English: Then the Philistines gathered together to fight with Israel, thirty thousand chariots and six thousand horsemen, and people as the sand which is on the seashore in multitude. And they came up and encamped in Michmash, to the east of Beth Aven.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin kư̆m akŭm pơpôi băl wă blah bơngai Isơrael: Lu sư đei pêng-jĭt rơbâu gre, aseh tơdrâu-rơbâu linh hao aseh păng linh yak jơ̆ng lơ thoi lĕ kơ chuơh tơ đak dơsĭ. Lu sư tŏk năm blah, lu sư pơm kơđông 'bơ̆t Mikmas, tơ gah hơlĕch kơ Bêt Awen.

English: When the men of Israel saw that they were in danger (for the people were distressed), then the people hid in caves, in thickets, in rocks, in holes, and in pits.
Bahnar: Đe Isơrael mơn 'bôh lu sư hli hơmơt dêh. Yua kơ lu bơngai ayăt tŭn gơhret rai jê̆ bơih. Na lu đe Isơrael kơdâu ôn tơ lăm hơgơp tơmo, lăm bri kơdrơ̆ng lăm sơlŭng păng lăm trôm teh.

English: And some of the Hebrews crossed over the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead. As for Saul, he was still in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei Lu bơngai Hêbrơ tŏk găn kơ đak Krong Jôrđăn, truh tơ tơring Gat păng Gileat. Mă-lei Sôl sư oei kơtă tơ Gilgal, đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kiơ̆ sư hli tơtey ngăl.

English: Then he waited seven days, according to the time set by Samuel. But Samuel did not come to Gilgal; and the people were scattered from him.
Bahnar: Sôl gô truh tơpơh năr, kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Samuel pơkă; mă-lei yua kơ Samuel ưh tam truh tơ Gilgal, na kon pơlei tơklah tơklang.

English: So Saul said, “Bring a burnt offering and peace offerings here to me.” And he offered the burnt offering.
Bahnar: Sôl khan: Athei ba kơ inh tơmam soi 'buh păng tơmam soi 'blŏk bơnê; na sư pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh.

English: Now it happened, as soon as he had finished presenting the burnt offering, that Samuel came; and Saul went out to meet him, that he might greet him.
Bahnar: Lăp kơ sư đang kơ pơyơ̆r na blư kơ Samuel truh. Sôl sư kơdâu lĕch wă sơng kơkuh kơ sư.

English: And Samuel said, “What have you done?” Saul said, “When I saw that the people were scattered from me, and that you did not come within the days appointed, and that the Philistines gathered together at Michmash
Bahnar: Samuel jet sư: Ih pơm kiơ boih? Sôl tơl: Inh 'bôh kon pơlei tơklah tơklang achăng lê̆ inh ih ưh kơ năm 'blep kơ năr ih pơkă, bơngai Philistin đĭ hơdrŭm 'bơ̆t Mikmas bơih

English: then I said, ‘The Philistines will now come down on me at Gilgal, and I have not made supplication to the LORD.’ Therefore I felt compelled, and offered a burnt offering.”
Bahnar: na inh hli: Tơpă đe Philistin wă blah inh tơ Gilgal păng inh kư̆m tam mă krao apinh Kră Yang. Yua kơ thoi ei, na inh athei khŏm pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh.

English: And Samuel said to Saul, “You have done foolishly. You have not kept the commandment of the LORD your God, which He commanded you. For now the LORD would have established your kingdom over Israel forever.
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ Sôl: Ih ưh kơ wao tơpă, ưh kơ chu nơ̆r Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih đei tơtă khan lê̆ bơih. Tơdah ih đei chu kiơ̆ nơ̆r Sư, lei Kră Yang gô pơjing dêh char ih kơjăp ling-lang lăm Isơrael

English: But now your kingdom shall not continue. The LORD has sought for Himself a man after His own heart, and the LORD has commanded him to be commander over His people, because you have not kept what the LORD commanded you.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei dang ei, dêh char ih ưh kơ kơjăp ôh. Kră Yang đei rơih iŏk ăn kơ Sư kơdih minh 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ kơ jơhngơ̆m Sư, ăn bơngai noh pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Sư, yua kơ ih ưh kơ wei nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă.

English: Then Samuel arose and went up from Gilgal to Gibeah of Benjamin. And Saul numbered the people present with him, about six hundred men.
Bahnar: Samuel iung, lê̆ Gilgal năm truh tơ Gibêah lăm tơring Bênjamin, na Sôl jơ̆ lăng kon pơlei oei hăm sư, dang pă tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: Saul, Jonathan his son, and the people present with them remained in Gibeah of Benjamin. But the Philistines encamped in Michmash.
Bahnar: Sôl păng Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo sư, hăm lu linh kiơ̆ sư năm oei tơ Gibêah lăm tơring Bênjamin, mă-lei đe Philistin pơm kơđông oei tơ Mikmas.

English: Then raiders came out of the camp of the Philistines in three companies. One company turned onto the road to Ophrah, to the land of Shual
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng lăm kơđông Philistin đei minh khŭl linh blah tơgar lĕch klah song pêng khŭl, Minh khŭl năm tơ gah Ophra, lăm dêh Sual

English: another company turned to the road to Beth Horon, and another company turned to the road of the border that overlooks the Valley of Zeboim toward the wilderness.
Bahnar: khŭl mă 'bar năm tơ gah pơlei Bêt Hôrôn; mă-lei khŭl mă pêng năm rok trong sơlam, trong noh năm tơ gah kơpal groi tơmang 'bôh tơ thŭng Sêbôim, păng char glă.

English: Now there was no blacksmith to be found throughout all the land of Israel, for the Philistines said, “Lest the Hebrews make swords or spears.”
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lăm đĭ dêh char Isơrael ưh kơ đei bơngai hơjơ̆m, yua kơ đe Philistin khan bơih: Athei 'nĕ ăn kơ bơngai Hêbrơ hơjơ̆m đao păng hơlă.

English: But all the Israelites would go down to the Philistines to sharpen each man’s plowshare, his mattock, his ax, and his sickle
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael mưh wă kơ pla 'nhik rơmo, 'nhik choh, sung, wăng săng tơgăk, athei năm chă jang kơ đe Philistin

English: and the charge for a sharpening was a pim for the plowshares, the mattocks, the forks, and the axes, and to set the points of the goads.
Bahnar: păng layơ mă 'nhik, sung, wăng, chơkrơ ưh pă han bơih lu sư năm hơmet tơter tơ bơngai Philistin ngăl. Tơter pat 'nhik rơmo dah 'nhik apah tơhngam gram hu. Pat tơter 'nhik chơkrơ sung, sơnguĕt puh rơmo puăn gram hu.

English: So it came about, on the day of battle, that there was neither sword nor spear found in the hand of any of the people who were with Saul and Jonathan. But they were found with Saul and Jonathan his son.
Bahnar: Lei na lăm năr tơblah, kon pơlei mă kiơ̆ Sôl păng Jônathan ưh kơ đei đao păng hơlă, lăp Sôl păng Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo sư đĕch đei.

English: And the garrison of the Philistines went out to the pass of Michmash.
Bahnar: Minh khŭl linh đe Philistin năm jur tơ trong kuĕl Mikmas.

English: Now it happened one day that Jonathan the son of Saul said to the young man who bore his armor, “Come, let us go over to the Philistines’ garrison that is on the other side.” But he did not tell his father.
Bahnar: Lăm minh năr 'nei, Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo Sôl, khan kơ bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư Bĕ ba, năm tơ kơđông Philistin, oei tơ gah to. Mă-lei sư ưh kơ roi kơ 'bă sư băt.

English: And Saul was sitting in the outskirts of Gibeah under a pomegranate tree which is in Migron. The people who were with him were about six hundred men.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh, Sôl oei tơ 'nguaih kơ pơlei Gibêah, ala kơ tơm 'long plei gărnăt, tơ pơlei Migrôn, na lu linh kiơ̆ sư dang tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu.

English: Ahijah the son of Ahitub, Ichabod’s brother, the son of Phinehas, the son of Eli, the LORD’s priest in Shiloh, was wearing an ephod. But the people did not know that Jonathan had gone.
Bahnar: Ahija, kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup, 'nhŏng Ikabôt, kon drŏ-nglo Phinêhas, kon Hêli, pơm 'bok soi kơ Kră Yang tơ Silô kon pơlei ưh kơ băt kơ Jônathan năm.

English: Between the passes, by which Jonathan sought to go over to the Philistines’ garrison, there was a sharp rock on one side and a sharp rock on the other side. And the name of one was Bozez, and the name of the other Seneh.
Bahnar: Jônathan adrin năm wă kơ truh tơ kơđông Philistin, na athei năm rok trong kuĕl sơlam 'bar pah kông tơmo gah âu anăn kông Bôses,a na gah to anăn kông Sêne.b

English: The front of one faced northward opposite Michmash, and the other southward opposite Gibeah.
Bahnar: Kông kơjung tơ gah yă-nơ̆m, tơklă pơlei Mĭkmas, na kông tơ gah gơal, tơklă pơlei Gêba.

English: Then Jonathan said to the young man who bore his armor, “Come, let us go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised; it may be that the LORD will work for us. For nothing restrains the LORD from saving by many or by few.”
Bahnar: Jônathan khan hăm bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư: Bĕ ba khŏm năm truh tơ kơđông lu bơngai ưh kơ kăt tơdra akar 'noh.c Băt Kră Yang gô tơgŭm kơ ba; ưh kơ đei tơdrong kiơ găn Kră Yang ăn kơ jei bơ̆n mă bơ̆n tŏ sĕt dah lơ.

English: So his armorbearer said to him, “Do all that is in your heart. Go then; here I am with you, according to your heart.”
Bahnar: Bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư khan: Pơm bĕ tơdrong ih hơpơi, inh gô kiơ̆ ih tơ 'noh.

English: Then Jonathan said, “Very well, let us cross over to these men, and we will show ourselves to them.
Bahnar: Jônathan khan dơ̆ng: 'Nâu, ba athei năm tơ lu bơngai 'noh, tơ'bôh akâu ba ăn kơ lu sư.

English: If they say thus to us, ‘Wait until we come to you,’ then we will stand still in our place and not go up to them.
Bahnar: Tơdah lu sư khan: Pơ̆ng tơ noh gô nhôn năm tơ măr iĕm, lei ba gô dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anih ba ưh kơ năm tơ lu sư.

English: But if they say thus, ‘Come up to us,’ then we will go up. For the LORD has delivered them into our hand, and this will be a sign to us.”
Bahnar: Na dah lu sư pơma khan: Năm tơ nhôn bĕ; lei ba gô năm; noh băt tơdra kơ Kră Yang gô pơjao lu sư tơ lăm ti ba boih.

English: So both of them showed themselves to the garrison of the Philistines. And the Philistines said, “Look, the Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they have hidden.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na măr sư năm tơ kơđông bơngai Philistin, tơ'bôh akâu bre sư. Bơngai Philistin pơma tơduă: Lăng to lu bơngai Hêbrơ lĕch đơ̆ng hơgơp tơmo anih mă lu sư ôn.

English: Then the men of the garrison called to Jonathan and his armorbearer, and said, “Come up to us, and we will show you something.” Jonathan said to his armorbearer, “Come up after me, for the LORD has delivered them into the hand of Israel.”
Bahnar: Linh lăm kơđông pơma kơ Jônathan hăm bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư 'noh khan: Năm tơ âu bĕ, nhôn tơ'bôh ăn kơ măr iĕm, băt tơdrong Jônathan pơma hăm bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư khan: Kiơ̆ mă jê̆ inh, yua kơ Kră Yang pơjao lu sư tơ lăm ti bơngai Isơrael boih.

English: And Jonathan climbed up on his hands and knees with his armorbearer after him; and they fell before Jonathan. And as he came after him, his armorbearer killed them.
Bahnar: Jônathan yua jơ̆ng ti sư hao tŏk tơ kơpal păng bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư tŏk kiơ̆ Jônathan teh bơngai Philistin pơ̆k 'bơ̆t anăp Jônathan păng bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư pơlôch lu sư đĭ.

English: That first slaughter which Jonathan and his armorbearer made was about twenty men within about half an acre of land.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t tơblah 'măng blŭng 'nâu, bre Jônathan pơlôch dang 'bar-jĭt 'nu, lăm anih teh să dang pêng-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt hlŏk wơ̆t tor.

English: And there was trembling in the camp, in the field, and among all the people. The garrison and the raiders also trembled; and the earth quaked, so that it was a very great trembling.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng linh lăm kơđông dah tơ 'nguaih hli tơrơ ngăl. Linh lăm lu kơđông nai păng lu bơngai chă blah tơgar iŏk kư̆m hli tơrơ; đei teh tơdrŏ, noh rai pơm kơ đe hli tơrơ noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now the watchmen of Saul in Gibeah of Benjamin looked, and there was the multitude, melting away; and they went here and there.
Bahnar: Lu linh gak pơtao Sôl tơ pơlei Gibêah lăm dêh Bênjamin, dai 'bôh kon pơlei Philistin kơdâu tơklah tơklang bơsuơ̆t bơsuăt.

English: Then Saul said to the people who were with him, “Now call the roll and see who has gone from us.” And when they had called the roll, surprisingly, Jonathan and his armorbearer were not there.
Bahnar: Sôl khan kơ lu linh oei hơdai sư: Chă lăng lăng đe bu mă weh đơ̆ng anih bơ̆n, lu sư chơchă lăng lăng 'bôh ưh kơ tơm, bre Jônathan hăm bơngai chĕp tơmam tơblah sư.

English: And Saul said to Ahijah, “Bring the ark of God here” (for at that time the ark of God was with the children of Israel).
Bahnar: Sôl khan kơ Ahija 'bok soi: Chĕp ba Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ âu. Kơplah noh Hom Pơgơ̆p Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ noh hăm bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now it happened, while Saul talked to the priest, that the noise which was in the camp of the Philistines continued to increase; so Saul said to the priest, “Withdraw your hand.”
Bahnar: Lăm kơplah Sôl oei pơma hăm 'bok soi, lăm kơđông linh Philistin rai tơjrông tơjrang. Sôl khan kơ 'bok soi: 'Nĕ tam mă chĕp.

English: Then Saul and all the people who were with him assembled, and they went to the battle; and indeed every man’s sword was against his neighbor, and there was very great confusion.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t noh, Sôl akŭm đĭ-đăng lu linh oei hơdai sư, năm tơ anih tơblah, na 'bôh bơngai Philistin toh đao pơlôch dih băl bơsuơ̆t bơsuăt krưp dêh.

English: Moreover the Hebrews who were with the Philistines before that time, who went up with them into the camp from the surrounding country, they also joined the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai Hêbrơ sơ̆ kiơ̆ chu jang kơ bơngai Philistin păng kiơ̆ pơm linh lu sư 'nâu wih akŭm minh đon hăm bơngai Isơrael kiơ̆ Sôl păng Jônathan.

English: Likewise all the men of Israel who had hidden in the mountains of Ephraim, when they heard that the Philistines fled, they also followed hard after them in the battle.
Bahnar: Kơplah 'noh đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael oei ôn lăm groi kông Êphraim, kơtơ̆ng khan bơngai Philistin thuơ kơdâu, kư̆m wang druh blah lu linh ayăt 'noh.

English: So the LORD saved Israel that day, and the battle shifted to Beth Aven.
Bahnar: Kră Yang dŏng pơklaih bơngai Isơrael lăm năr 'noh; tơdrong tơblah lanh truh tơ Bêt Awen.

English: And the men of Israel were distressed that day, for Saul had placed the people under oath, saying, “Cursed is the man who eats any food until evening, before I have taken vengeance on my enemies.” So none of the people tasted food.
Bahnar: Kŭm lăm năr 'noh, bơngai Isơrael lap pă kĕ boih yua kơ Sôl athei 'blŏk nơ̆r đei pơkă pơkăm: Trŏ kơ hiap pơtê̆ bơngai ayơ mă sa tơmam kiơ adrol kơ 'năr kơsơ̆ huơ huĭnh wă măng, đang adrol kơ inh blah lu bơngai ayăt kơ inh! Yua kơ noh, na đĭ-đăng kon pơlei kơ̆m kơ pơ̆n sa tơmam kiơ hloi.

English: Now all the people of the land came to a forest; and there was honey on the ground.
Bahnar: Lăp kon pơlei nơnăm lăm bri đei sal sut kơpal teh.

English: And when the people had come into the woods, there was the honey, dripping; but no one put his hand to his mouth, for the people feared the oath.
Bahnar: Kơplah, kon pơlei mơ̆t lăm bri, 'bôh sal sut đei đak sut ro tơ teh ră; kơbĭ bu pơ̆n tôt hơnglâu ti liah tơ 'bơ̆r, yua kơ hli kơ nơ̆r pơkă.

English: But Jonathan had not heard his father charge the people with the oath; therefore he stretched out the end of the rod that was in his hand and dipped it in a honeycomb, and put his hand to his mouth; and his countenance brightened.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Jônathan ưh kơ băt kơ nơ̆r 'bă sư đei pơkă boih hăm kon pơlei, na sư tôt hăm 'long jra sư tơ sal sut đơ̆ng noh iŏk hăm ti sư liah tơ 'bơ̆r, na măt sư 'blêr rai hơdah.

English: Then one of the people said, “Your father strictly charged the people with an oath, saying, ‘Cursed is the man who eats food this day.’ ” And the people were faint.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai lăm kon pơlei khan: 'Bă ih đei pơkă hăm kon pơlei: Trŏ kơ hiap pơtê̆ bơngai bu mă sa tơmam kiơ lăm năr âu. Na kon pơlei rơmơ̆n pă kĕ kơ pơngot.

English: But Jonathan said, “My father has troubled the land. Look now, how my countenance has brightened because I tasted a little of this honey.
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl khan: 'Bă inh pơm ăn kơ kon pơlei hơ'ngon; athei lăng măt inh hơdah hơdong dang yơ, yua kơ đơ̆ng inh liah tŏ sĕt đak sut âu.

English: How much better if the people had eaten freely today of the spoil of their enemies which they found! For now would there not have been a much greater slaughter among the Philistines?”
Bahnar: Ăn dah năr âu kon pơlei mă gơh sa tơmam mă bơ̆n đei tơblah iŏk đơ̆ng bơngai ayăt kơ bơ̆n, lei tơdrong tơblah hăm bơngai Philistin jei bơ̆n hloh loi kơ 'nâu dơ̆ng.

English: Now they had driven back the Philistines that day from Michmash to Aijalon. So the people were very faint.
Bahnar: Na năr 'noh, bơngai Isơrael blah pơrăm bơngai Philistin đơ̆ng pơlei Mikmas truh tơ Aijalôn.

English: And the people rushed on the spoil, and took sheep, oxen, and calves, and slaughtered them on the ground; and the people ate them with the blood.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei pă kĕ kơ pơngot dêh, yoh rôp hloi bơ̆n triu, rơmo, kon rơmo pơlôch đơ̆ng noh sa 'nhĕm hrâu hăm pham 'bơ̆t oei pai.

English: Then they told Saul, saying, “Look, the people are sinning against the LORD by eating with the blood!” So he said, “You have dealt treacherously; roll a large stone to me this day.”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai năm roi kơ Sôl: Kon pơlei pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang, sa 'nhĕm hrâu hăm pham. Sư tơl: 'Noh boih minh tơdrong yoch trăp dêh hăm Kră Yang: Athei jah tơlơ̆ hloi tơmo tih ăn tơ jê̆ inh.

English: Then Saul said, “Disperse yourselves among the people, and say to them, ‘Bring me here every man’s ox and every man’s sheep, slaughter them here, and eat; and do not sin against the LORD by eating with the blood.’ ” So every one of the people brought his ox with him that night, and slaughtered it there.
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng: Athei năm jơ̆p kơ khŭl lu linh roi tơbăt kơ rim 'nu athei anhăk ba triu rơmo sư tơ inh păng pơlôch tơ âu. Sa 'nhĕm 'noh 'nĕ kơ sa 'nhĕm oei pham pơm yoch hăm Kră Yang. Lăm măng 'noh rim 'nu anhăk ba sem dơrong đơ̆ng kơdih sư păng pơlôch 'bơ̆t kơpal tơmo.

English: Then Saul built an altar to the LORD. This was the first altar that he built to the LORD.
Bahnar: Na Sôl pơdơ̆ng hloi minh pơm chơnang soi kơ Kră Yang 'nâu mă blŭng-a mă sư pơm chơnang soi wă kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Now Saul said, “Let us go down after the Philistines by night, and plunder them until the morning light; and let us not leave a man of them.” And they said, “Do whatever seems good to you.” Then the priest said, “Let us draw near to God here.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng 'noh Sôl khan: Bơ̆n athei jur druh bơngai Philistin lăm kơmăng âu, blah tơgar pơrăm lu sư dĭng truh pơgê hơdah păng 'nĕ kơ ăn đei minh 'nu bơngai arih. Lu sư khan: Pơm bĕ dôm tơdrong ih khan trŏ. 'Bok soi khan: Bơ̆n athei năm apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: So Saul asked counsel of God, “Shall I go down after the Philistines? Will You deliver them into the hand of Israel?” But He did not answer him that day.
Bahnar: Sôl krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei: Inh hăm gơh jur druh lu bơngai Philistin ưh? Ih hăm pơjao lu sư lăm ti bơngai Isơrael ưh? Mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei tơl lăm năr noh.

English: And Saul said, “Come over here, all you chiefs of the people, and know and see what this sin was today.
Bahnar: Sôl khan: Ơ lu 'bok tih mă wei pơgơ̆r kon pơlei, đĭ-đăng athei năm jê̆ tơ âu, chă lăng tơdrong yoch đei pơm lăm năr 'nâu thoi yơ.

English: For as the LORD lives, who saves Israel, though it be in Jonathan my son, he shall surely die.” But not a man among all the people answered him.
Bahnar: Inh yua anăn Kră Yang arih ling-lang, dŏng pơklaih Isơrael, inh pơkă khan bơngai bu đei pơm yoch, mă Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo inh kơdih, kư̆m trŏ kơ lôch! Lăm đĭ-đăng kon pơlei ưh kơ đei bu tơl nơ̆r sư.

English: Then he said to all Israel, “You be on one side, and my son Jonathan and I will be on the other side.” And the people said to Saul, “Do what seems good to you.”
Bahnar: Sư khan hloi kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael: Iĕm athei dơ̆ng gah âu; inh păng Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo inh, gô dơ̆ng gah to. Kon pơlei tơl. Pơm bĕ tơdrong ih khan 'lơ̆ng trŏ kơ pơm.

English: Therefore Saul said to the LORD God of Israel, “Give a perfect lot.” So Saul and Jonathan were taken, but the people escaped.
Bahnar: Sôl krao apinh: Ơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei Isơrael: Liơ Ih ưh kơ tơl tơwih nơ̆r inh năr âu? Apinh Ih tơ'bôh ăn tơdrong tơpă. Jônathan kon inh pơm yoch dah inh pơm yoch. Apinh Ih ăn kơ Urim; dah kon pơlei pơm yoch Ih ăn thu minh lai Sôl păng Jônathan đei tơhlâu lê̆ boih, mă-lei kon pơlei ưh kơ đei 'bơm.

English: And Saul said, “Cast lots between my son Jonathan and me.” So Jonathan was taken.
Bahnar: Sôl khan: Athei hlang lăng bĕ wă kơ băt inh dah Jônathan kon drŏ-nglo inh trŏ kơ Jônathan.

English: Then Saul said to Jonathan, “Tell me what you have done.” And Jonathan told him, and said, “I only tasted a little honey with the end of the rod that was in my hand. So now I must die!”
Bahnar: Sôl jet Jônathan: Roi bĕ kơ inh băt ih đei pơm kiơ. Jônathan roi tơpăt: Inh đei tôt tơ sal sut hăm 'long jra inh na liah tŏ sĕt; na inh âu trŏ kơ lôch.

English: Saul answered, “God do so and more also; for you shall surely die, Jonathan.”
Bahnar: Sôl pơkă: Ơ Jônathan, dah ih ưh kơ lôch, apinh Kră Yang tơjur tơdrong truh trăp dêh kơpal inh!

English: But the people said to Saul, “Shall Jonathan die, who has accomplished this great deliverance in Israel? Certainly not! As the LORD lives, not one hair of his head shall fall to the ground, for he has worked with God this day.” So the people rescued Jonathan, and he did not die.
Bahnar: Mă-lei kon pơlei tơl Sôl khan: Ưh ôh! Jônathan jơ̆ bơngai pơm ăn boih kơ bơngai Isơrael kĕ jei dang 'noh, liơ mă gơh trŏ kơ lôch? Tơdrong 'noh ưh kơ gơh! Nhôn apinh Kră Yang arih na pơm kơdranh kơ bơ̆n pơkă khan mă minh ioi sŏk kơpal kơ̆l sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei hơlŭng tơ teh; sư mă gơh kĕ jei năr âu noh đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư. Thoi noh kon pơlei dŏng Jônathan klaih đơ̆ng tơdrong wă pơlôch.

English: Then Saul returned from pursuing the Philistines, and the Philistines went to their own place.
Bahnar: Sôl wih brŏk, ưh kơ đei druh bơngai lu Philistin dơ̆ng; păng bơngai Philistin wơ̆t brŏk tơ dêh sư kơdih.

English: So Saul established his sovereignty over Israel, and fought against all his enemies on every side, against Moab, against the people of Ammon, against Edom, against the kings of Zobah, and against the Philistines. Wherever he turned, he harassed them.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ Sôl pơm pơtao pơgơ̆r teh đak Isơrael, na sư tơblah hăm bơngai ayăt kơ sư puăn pah, wă khan sư tơblah hăm bơngai Môap, Ammôn, Eđôm, lu pơtao Sôba păng hăm bơngai Philistin; sư tơblah tơ yơ, kư̆m jei sư ngăl.

English: And he gathered an army and attacked the Amalekites, and delivered Israel from the hands of those who plundered them.
Bahnar: Sư nuih kơtang tơblah bơngai Amalek păng dŏng pơklaih Isơrael đơ̆ng ti bơngai chă blah tơgar iŏk.

English: The sons of Saul were Jonathan, Jishui, and Malchishua. And the names of his two daughters were these: the name of the firstborn Merab, and the name of the younger Michal.
Bahnar: Pơtao Sôl đei pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Jônathan, Iswi păng Malkisua, sư kư̆m đei 'bar 'nu kon drŏ-kăn; 'lŏ anăn Mêrap, 'lơ̆p anăn Mikal

English: The name of Saul’s wife was Ahinoam the daughter of Ahimaaz. And the name of the commander of his army was Abner the son of Ner, Saul’s uncle.
Bahnar: Akăn Sôl anăn Ahinôam, kon drŏ-kăn Ahimaas. Yŏng lu linh anăn Apner, kon drŏ-nglo Nêr, sư 'noh ma 'bok Sôl.

English: Kish was the father of Saul, and Ner the father of Abner was the son of Abiel.
Bahnar: Kis, 'bă Sôl păng Nêr 'bă Apner kon drŏ-nglo Abiel.

English: Now there was fierce war with the Philistines all the days of Saul. And when Saul saw any strong man or any valiant man, he took him for himself.
Bahnar: Đĭ chăl arih Sôl đei tơdrong tơblah tih hơnơ̆ng hăm bơngai Philistin; dah Sôl 'bôh bơngai pran păng nuih kơtang, sư rôp iŏk bơngai 'noh kiơ̆ sư păng jang hăm sư.

English: Samuel also said to Saul, “The LORD sent me to anoint you king over His people, over Israel. Now therefore, heed the voice of the words of the LORD.
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ Sôl: Kră Yang wơh inh boih tuh ăn kơ ih đak rơmă, pơdơ̆ng ih pơm pơtao kon pơlei Isơrael sư. Thoi noh dang ei mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r Kră Yang.

English: Thus says the LORD of hosts: ‘I will punish Amalek for what he did to Israel, how he ambushed him on the way when he came up from Egypt.
Bahnar: Kră Yang Tih Hloh khan: Inh 'blŏk đơ̆ng tơdrong Amalek pơm kơ lu bơngai Isơrael, găn trong năm kơplah lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Now go and attack Amalek, and utterly destroy all that they have, and do not spare them. But kill both man and woman, infant and nursing child, ox and sheep, camel and donkey.’ ”
Bahnar: Thoi noh, na năm bĕ blah kon pơlei Amalek păng pơlôch pơđĭ lu sư sem dơrong lu sư. Lu iĕm ưh kơ gơh mơnat kơ lu sư, athei pơlôch đĭ drŏ-nglo drŏ-kăn, păng lu 'lơ̆p lu nge oei mŏm, rơmo triu, lăk-đa păng aseh iĕ.

English: So Saul gathered the people together and numbered them in Telaim, two hundred thousand foot soldiers and ten thousand men of Judah.
Bahnar: Na, Sôl krao pơpôi akŭm kon pơlei pơla tơ pơlei Têliam. Đei 'bar-rơbâu 'nu linh yak jơ̆ng păng mơjĭt-rơbâu 'nu bơngai Juđa.

English: And Saul came to a city of Amalek, and lay in wait in the valley.
Bahnar: Sôl năm blah kon pơlei Amalek păng răp lu linh lăm thong.

English: Then Saul said to the Kenites, “Go, depart, get down from among the Amalekites, lest I destroy you with them. For you showed kindness to all the children of Israel when they came up out of Egypt.” So the Kenites departed from among the Amalekites.
Bahnar: Sôl kư̆m wơh bơngai năm tơbăt ăn kơ kon pơlei Kênit: Lu iĕm athei weh bĕ, tơklah lĕch bĕ đơ̆ng kon pơlei Amalek, wă kơ lu nhôn huay kơ pơlôch iĕm hơdai hăm lu sư, yua kơ lu iĕm pơm 'lơ̆ng kơ kon pơlei Isơrael kơplah lu sư 'nao lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng dêh Êyiptơ. Thoi noh, na kon pơlei Kênit tơklah lĕch đơ̆ng kon pơlei Amalek.

English: And Saul attacked the Amalekites, from Havilah all the way to Shur, which is east of Egypt.
Bahnar: Sôl blah lu bơngai Amalek đơ̆ng Hawila truh tơ Sur tơ gah hơlĕch kơ dêh Êyiptơ jei sư.

English: He also took Agag king of the Amalekites alive, and utterly destroyed all the people with the edge of the sword.
Bahnar: Sư rôp arih Agak, pơtao lu bơngai Amalek; đơ̆ng noh iŏk đao pơlôch pơđĭ lu kon pơlei pơla.

English: But Saul and the people spared Agag and the best of the sheep, the oxen, the fatlings, the lambs, and all that was good, and were unwilling to utterly destroy them. But everything despised and worthless, that they utterly destroyed.
Bahnar: Sôl păng kon pơlei achăng mơnat kơ Agak, kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơlôch lu sem dơrong mă 'lơ̆ng hloh lăm lu khŭl rơmo dah triu, rong mă bek, kon triu păng dôm lu sem dơrong 'lơ̆ng hloh, mă-lei pơlôch pơđĭ dôm lu kon sem kiơ kơnê̆ păng ưh kơ gĭt.

English: Now the word of the LORD came to Samuel, saying
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Samuel

English: “I greatly regret that I have set up Saul as king, for he has turned back from following Me, and has not performed My commandments.” And it grieved Samuel, and he cried out to the LORD all night.
Bahnar: Inh hmach dêh pôk boih Sôl pơm pơtao; yua kơ sư achăng lê̆ Inh, ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Inh. Samuel blĕk krao khan kơ Kră Yang prăt măng.

English: So when Samuel rose early in the morning to meet Saul, it was told Samuel, saying, “Saul went to Carmel, and indeed, he set up a monument for himself; and he has gone on around, passed by, and gone down to Gilgal.”
Bahnar: Pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng, sư năm tơ'bơ̆p Sôl, đei bơngai năm roi kơ Samuel: Sôl hlôi năm tơ Karmel boih, pơdơ̆ng tơmo wă tơ'blŏk kơ sư; đơ̆ng noh na wih jur tơ Gilgal.

English: Then Samuel went to Saul, and Saul said to him, “Blessed are you of the LORD! I have performed the commandment of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Samuel năm tơ'bơ̆p Sôl; Sôl kơkuh kơ sư: Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang ăn pŭn hiôk kơ ih! Inh pơm kiơ̆ boih dôm nơ̆r đơ̆ng Kră Yang tơtă.

English: But Samuel said, “What then is this bleating of the sheep in my ears, and the lowing of the oxen which I hear?”
Bahnar: Samuel jet sư: Thoi noh na triu bơbe hmoi krao ôr kơtơ̆ng truh tơ đon inh, hăm inh kơtơ̆ng rơmo hmoi, noh kiơ?

English: And Saul said, “They have brought them from the Amalekites; for the people spared the best of the sheep and the oxen, to sacrifice to the LORD your God; and the rest we have utterly destroyed.”
Bahnar: Sôl tơl: Kon pơlei đei 'mêm rôp dui ba, lu sem dơrong mă 'lơ̆ng, triu bơbe păng rơmo đơ̆ng bơngai Amalek; dui ba sem dơrong 'lơ̆ng hloh triu păng rơmo, wă pơyơ̆r sư pơm tơmam soi ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih; lu sem dơrong oei đei nhôn pơlôch pơđĭ boih.

English: Then Samuel said to Saul, “Be quiet! And I will tell you what the LORD said to me last night.” And he said to him, “Speak on.”
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ Sôl: Thôi! Gô Inh roi ăn kơ ih dôm tơdrong Kră Yang khan boih kơ inh măng âu Sôl tơl: Roi bĕ.

English: So Samuel said, “When you were little in your own eyes, were you not head of the tribes of Israel? And did not the LORD anoint you king over Israel?
Bahnar: Samuel roi khan: Ih adrĕch iĕ ưh kơ hơnhŏ pơm kơ̆l kơ adrĕch adrung bơngai Isơrael dah kiơ? Kră Yang tuh đak rơmă ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now the LORD sent you on a mission, and said, ‘Go, and utterly destroy the sinners, the Amalekites, and fight against them until they are consumed.’
Bahnar: Na, Kră Yang wơh ih năm na khan: Năm bĕ pơlôch đĭ lu bơngai pơm yoch to, noh kon pơlei Amalek păng tơblah hăm lu sư dĭng truh kơ lu iĕm pơlôch đĭ lu sư.

English: Why then did you not obey the voice of the LORD? Why did you swoop down on the spoil, and do evil in the sight of the LORD?”
Bahnar: Liơ ih ưh kơ chu pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan? Liơ ih năm mơ̆t blah tơgar iŏk, pơm dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang?

English: And Saul said to Samuel, “But I have obeyed the voice of the LORD, and gone on the mission on which the LORD sent me, and brought back Agag king of Amalek; I have utterly destroyed the Amalekites.
Bahnar: Sôl tơl nơ̆r Samuel: Mă-lei inh pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang khan, inh năm pơm keh boih nơ̆r tơtă Kră Yang wơh inh năm pơm; inh chĕp ba Agak, pơtao bơngai Amalek păng pơlôch pơđĭ lu kon pơlei Amalek.

English: But the people took of the plunder, sheep and oxen, the best of the things which should have been utterly destroyed, to sacrifice to the LORD your God in Gilgal.”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei đei rơih iŏk lăm lu tơmam mă đei blah tơgar iŏk, triu bơbe păng rơmo, sem dơrong 'lơ̆ng hloh gah tơmam trŏ kơ pơlôch, wă pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih tơ Gilgal.

English: So Samuel said: “Has the LORD as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, As in obeying the voice of the LORD? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, And to heed than the fat of rams.
Bahnar: Samuel khan: Kră Yang lăp đon kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh noh hloh kơ chu yom kơ nơ̆r Sư dah ưh? Chu yom kiơ̆ nơ̆r 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ tơmam soi, mơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ rơmă triu tơno.

English: For rebellion is as the sin of witchcraft, And stubbornness is as iniquity and idolatry. Because you have rejected the word of the LORD, He also has rejected you from being king.”
Bahnar: Hơngah ưh kơ pơm kiơ̆ noh kư̆m yoch thoi bơngai pơjâu hơlĕnh; Pơang kư̆m yoch thoi kơkuh kơ rup yang. Yua kơ đơ̆ng ih achăng lê̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang, na sư kư̆m achăng lê̆ ih ưh kơ ăn kơ ih pơm pơtao.

English: Then Saul said to Samuel, “I have sinned, for I have transgressed the commandment of the LORD and your words, because I feared the people and obeyed their voice.
Bahnar: Sôl chu iŏk nơ̆r Samuel khan: Inh đei pơm yoch boih ưh kơ wă chu nơ̆r Kră Yang tơtă păng đơ̆ng nơ̆r ih bơtho khan. Inh hli kơ lu kon pơlei na mơ̆ng pơm kiơ̆ nơ̆r lu sư.

English: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and return with me, that I may worship the LORD.”
Bahnar: Dang ei, apinh ih mơnat kơ tơdrong yoch inh, jơ̆ inh dơ̆ng hăm wih kiơ̆ inh, na inh gô drap kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang.

English: But Samuel said to Saul, “I will not return with you, for you have rejected the word of the LORD, and the LORD has rejected you from being king over Israel.”
Bahnar: Samuel khan hăm Sôl: Inh ưh pă wih tơ jê̆ ih dơ̆ng; yua kơ ih achăng lê̆ nơ̆r Kră Yang, na Kră Yang kư̆m achăng lê̆ ih, ưh kơ pă wă ih pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael dơ̆ng.

English: And as Samuel turned around to go away, Saul seized the edge of his robe, and it tore.
Bahnar: Samuel wih rŏng wă năm, Sôl rôp tơdrơi ao sư, na ao hiah hloi.

English: So Samuel said to him, “The LORD has torn the kingdom of Israel from you today, and has given it to a neighbor of yours, who is better than you.
Bahnar: Samuel khan kơ sư: Năr 'nâu Kră Yang kư̆m hek teh đak Isơrael đơ̆ng ih kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, na pơjao ăn kơ bơngai nai đơ̆ng, trŏ hloh kơ ih.

English: And also the Strength of Israel will not lie nor relent. For He is not a man, that He should relent.”
Bahnar: Hloh kơ noh Kră Yang arih ling-lang lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ pơma hơlĕnh, kư̆m ưh kơ tơplih nơ̆r; yua kơ ưh kơ trŏ kơ kon bơngai na mă tơplih nơ̆r!

English: Then he said, “I have sinned; yet honor me now, please, before the elders of my people and before Israel, and return with me, that I may worship the LORD your God.”
Bahnar: Sôl apinh lung: Inh đei yoch; mă-lei apinh ih pơyom kơ inh 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe kră wei-lăng kon pơlei inh păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu bơngai Isơrael; apinh ih wih jơ̆ inh dơ̆ng na inh gô kơkuh kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih.

English: So Samuel turned back after Saul, and Saul worshiped the LORD.
Bahnar: Samuel wih jơ̆ dơ̆ng Sôl kiơ̆ thoi sư pơkă; na Sôl drap kơkuh kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then Samuel said, “Bring Agag king of the Amalekites here to me.” So Agag came to him cautiously. And Agag said, “Surely the bitterness of death is past.”
Bahnar: Samuel khan: Chông ba Agak, pơtao bơngai Amalek năm tơ inh: Agak năm hơdar hơdêh truh tơ sư, tơchĕng lăm to khan: Tơdrong lôch pơmat-tat hlôi boih.

English: But Samuel said, “As your sword has made women childless, so shall your mother be childless among women.” And Samuel hacked Agag in pieces before the LORD in Gilgal.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Samuel khan: Dah đao ih pơm boih kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn hiong kon thoi yơ, na mĕ ih kư̆m gô hiong kon thoi noh mơ̆n. Đang kơ pơma, Samuel pơlôch hloi Agak 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang tơ Gilgal.

English: Then Samuel went to Ramah, and Saul went up to his house at Gibeah of Saul.
Bahnar: Na, Samuel wih brŏk tơ Rama; gah Sôl brŏk tơ hnam sư kơdih tơ Gibêah.

English: And Samuel went no more to see Saul until the day of his death. Nevertheless Samuel mourned for Saul, and the LORD regretted that He had made Saul king over Israel.
Bahnar: Samuel ưh pă 'bôh Sôl dơ̆ng truh tơ năr sư lôch; yua kơ sư sơ'ngon dêh gah tơdrong jang Sôl; gah Kră Yang hmach dêh đei pơk Sôl pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: Now the LORD said to Samuel, “How long will you mourn for Saul, seeing I have rejected him from reigning over Israel? Fill your horn with oil, and go; I am sending you to Jesse the Bethlehemite. For I have provided Myself a king among his sons.”
Bahnar: Kră Yang khan kơ Samuel: Ih oei sơ'ngon kơ Sôl dĭng truh dang yơ? Inh achăng lê̆ sư boih, ưh pă ăn sư pơm pơtao bơngai Isơrael dơ̆ng. Tuh bĕ đak rơmă 'bĕnh kơ trôm hơke na ih năm; Inh wơh ih năm tơ'bơ̆p 'bok Jese Betlehem; yua lăm lu kon sư, Inh đei rơih iŏk minh 'nu wă pơm pơtao.

English: And Samuel said, “How can I go? If Saul hears it, he will kill me.” But the LORD said, “Take a heifer with you, and say, ‘I have come to sacrifice to the LORD.’
Bahnar: Samuel tơl: Liơ inh gơh năm tơ noh? Dah Sôl băt, sư gô pơlôch inh. Kră Yang khan: Ih dui ba minh pơm rơmo akăn adruh, na khan: Inh pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh ăn kơ Kră Yang.

English: Then invite Jesse to the sacrifice, and I will show you what you shall do; you shall anoint for Me the one I name to you.”
Bahnar: Ih krao Jese dai năm mơ̆n. Inh gô bơtho ăn kơ ih băt tơdrong kiơ ih gô pơm, Inh tơ'bôh ăn kơ ih bơngai bu ih gô tuh đak rơmă wă pơk sư pơm pơtao bơ̆jang kơ Inh.

English: So Samuel did what the LORD said, and went to Bethlehem. And the elders of the town trembled at his coming, and said, “Do you come peaceably?”
Bahnar: Samuel pơm kiơ̆ dôm tơdrong Kră Yang bơtho khan kơ sư, năm truh tơ pơlei Betlehem. Lu kră pơlei tơkan sơng sư. Lu sư hli na apinh: Ih năm tơ âu ba tơdrong hiôk-hian dah kiơ?

English: And he said, “Peaceably; I have come to sacrifice to the LORD. Sanctify yourselves, and come with me to the sacrifice.” Then he consecrated Jesse and his sons, and invited them to the sacrifice.
Bahnar: Na sư tơl: Hiôk-hian Inh truh tơ âu wă pơyơ̆r tơmam soi 'buh kơ Kră Yang; hơmet bĕ kơdih akâu mă 'lơ̆ng rơgoh păng kư̆m wang năm tơ âu hơdai inh. Sư kư̆m krao wơ̆n Jese lu kon drŏ-nglo sư hơmet akâu kơdih rơgoh 'lơ̆ng na kư̆m năm tơ anih pơyơ̆r.

English: So it was, when they came, that he looked at Eliab and said, “Surely the LORD’s anointed is before Him!”
Bahnar: Wă Jese hăm lu kon sư truh, Samuel 'bôh Êliap, na tơchĕng lăm to khan: 'Nâu boih bơngai mă wă tuh đak rơmă đơ̆ng Kră Yang mă oei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp Sư.

English: But the LORD said to Samuel, “Do not look at his appearance or at his physical stature, because I have refused him. For the LORD does not see as man sees; for man looks at the outward appearance, but the LORD looks at the heart.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang khan kơ Samuel; 'Nĕ kơ lăng akâu rŏ hơbŏ tih bơngai noh, Inh ưh kơ iŏk sư. Inh ưh kơ lăng kiơ thoi kon bơngai lăng, kon bơngai lăng gah 'nguaih; mă-lei Kră Yang lăng 'bôh lăm jơhngơ̆m.

English: So Jesse called Abinadab, and made him pass before Samuel. And he said, “Neither has the LORD chosen this one.”
Bahnar: Jese krao Abinađap păng athei sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp Samuel; mă-lei Samuel khan: Kră Yang kư̆m ưh kơ rơih iŏk bơngai 'nâu.

English: Then Jesse made Shammah pass by. And he said, “Neither has the LORD chosen this one.”
Bahnar: Jese athei Samma năm 'bơ̆t anăp Samuel mă-lei Samuel khan: Kră Yang kư̆m ưh kơ rơih iŏk bơngai 'nâu mơ̆n.

English: Thus Jesse made seven of his sons pass before Samuel. And Samuel said to Jesse, “The LORD has not chosen these.”
Bahnar: Jese athei tơpơh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo sư kơdih năm 'bơ̆t anăp Samuel lei-lăi thoi noh; na Samuel khan kơ Jese thoi âu: Kră Yang ưh kơ rơih iŏk minh 'nu bơngai bu lăm đe noh.

English: And Samuel said to Jesse, “Are all the young men here?” Then he said, “There remains yet the youngest, and there he is, keeping the sheep.” And Samuel said to Jesse, “Send and bring him. For we will not sit down till he comes here.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, Samuel apinh Jese dơ̆ng: Kon drŏ-nglo ih đĭ dôm noh boih hă? Jese tơl thoi âu: Oei pă minh 'nu kon hơdruch inh, mă-lei sư oei wei triu. Samuel khan: Wơh bĕ bơngai năm krao sư. Lu bơ̆n gô 'bôh sư 'mơ̆i na sŏng sa.

English: So he sent and brought him in. Now he was ruddy, with bright eyes, and good-looking. And the LORD said, “Arise, anoint him; for this is the one!”
Bahnar: Na, Jese năm wơh bơngai năm krao iŏk sư. Muh măt akâu jăn sư hơbŏ 'lơ̆ng. Kră Yang khan kơ Samuel: 'Nâu boih; iung bĕ tuh đak rơmă kơ sư.

English: Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the midst of his brothers; and the Spirit of the LORD came upon David from that day forward. So Samuel arose and went to Ramah.
Bahnar: Samuel iŏk hơke đak rơmă, tuh ăn kơ Đawit mă oei tơm măt lu 'nhŏng oh sư. 'Bơ̆t noh hloi Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Kră Yang oei hơdai Đawit ling-lang hloi. Samuel iung brŏk tơ Rama.

English: But the Spirit of the LORD departed from Saul, and a distressing spirit from the LORD troubled him.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Kră Yang lĕch đơ̆ng Sôl; Kră Yang wơh minh 'nu yang kơnê̆ pơm kơ đon sư hơwơ̆l hơwang hli tơrơ.

English: And Saul’s servants said to him, “Surely, a distressing spirit from God is troubling you.
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam sư roi: Đei minh 'nu yang kơnê̆ mă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh truh pơm kơ đon pơtao hơwơ̆l hơwang.

English: Let our master now command your servants, who are before you, to seek out a man who is a skillful player on the harp. And it shall be that he will play it with his hand when the distressing spirit from God is upon you, and you shall be well.”
Bahnar: Apinh pơtao wơh lu nhôn chă kơ ih minh 'nu gơh reh tĭng-nĭng, tơdah layơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh yang kơnê̆ truh tơ ih, na bơngai ei gô reh brŏ, na ih gô oei hiôk hơđơ̆ng.

English: So Saul said to his servants, “Provide me now a man who can play well, and bring him to me.”
Bahnar: Sôl tơl hăm lu đĭch đam sư: Năm bĕ chă kơ inh minh 'nu bơngai reh brŏ hơgei, đơ̆ng noh chông ba sư năm tơ inh âu.

English: Then one of the servants answered and said, “Look, I have seen a son of Jesse the Bethlehemite, who is skillful in playing, a mighty man of valor, a man of war, prudent in speech, and a handsome person; and the LORD is with him.”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu lăm lu đĭch đam sư khan: Inh 'bôh minh 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Jese, bơngai Betlehem; sư reh brŏ hơgei dêh, sư minh 'nu bơngai tơblah nuih, pơma dơnuh hơgei păng muh măt sư hơbŏ 'lơ̆ng. Kră Yang oei hơdai sư.

English: Therefore Saul sent messengers to Jesse, and said, “Send me your son David, who is with the sheep.”
Bahnar: Sôl wơh bơngai năm tơ Jese, na khan: Ăn bĕ kơ inh Đawit, kon drŏ-nglo ih, bơngai mă wei triu.

English: And Jesse took a donkey loaded with bread, a skin of wine, and a young goat, and sent them by his son David to Saul.
Bahnar: Jese rôp minh pơm aseh iĕ iŏk 'bĕng sik minh kơdŭng akar, minh pơm kon bơbe oei mŏm, hơtŏk kơpal kơdŭ aseh iĕ athei kơ Đawit kon drŏ-nglo sư, chĕp ba ăn kơ Sôl.

English: So David came to Saul and stood before him. And he loved him greatly, and he became his armorbearer.
Bahnar: Đawit truh tơ Sôl, păng jang hloi kơ sư. Sôl 'mêm kơ sư dêh mah iŏk ăn kơ sư chĕp tơmam blah.

English: Then Saul sent to Jesse, saying, “Please let David stand before me, for he has found favor in my sight.”
Bahnar: Na Sôl wơh bơngai năm khan kơ Jese: Inh apinh ih ăn kơ Đawit oei tơ âu tơgŭm inh; yua kơ sư pơm kơ jơhngơ̆m inh hiôk.

English: And so it was, whenever the spirit from God was upon Saul, that David would take a harp and play it with his hand. Then Saul would become refreshed and well, and the distressing spirit would depart from him.
Bahnar: Na mưh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t pơm kơ Sôl hli, na Đawit iŏk brŏ tĭng-nĭng reh, pơlung Sôl pran hiôk, na yang kơnê̆ noh lĕch đơ̆ng sư.

English: Now the Philistines gathered their armies together to battle, and were gathered at Sochoh, which belongs to Judah; they encamped between Sochoh and Azekah, in Ephes Dammim.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin krao akŭm lu linh sư wă tơblah lu sư akŭm tơ Sôkô, lăm dêh Juđa păng kơđông sư tơ Êphes Đamim, sơlam Sôkô păng Asêka.

English: And Saul and the men of Israel were gathered together, and they encamped in the Valley of Elah, and drew up in battle array against the Philistines.
Bahnar: Sôl păng lu bơngai Isơrael kư̆m akŭm băl mơ̆n pơm kơđông lăm thŭng Êlah na dă lu linh sư wă tơblah hăm lu kon pơlei bơngai Philistin.

English: The Philistines stood on a mountain on one side, and Israel stood on a mountain on the other side, with a valley between them.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Philistin dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t groi pah âu; gah lu bơngai Isơrael dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t groi pah to; pŭng-lŭng sơlam lu sư.

English: And a champion went out from the camp of the Philistines, named Goliath, from Gath, whose height was six cubits and a span.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai tih kơjung lĕch đơ̆ng kơđông Philistin, anăn sư Gôliat, đơ̆ng pơlei Gat; sư kơjung pêng hlok minh hơđa.

English: He had a bronze helmet on his head, and he was armed with a coat of mail, and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of bronze.
Bahnar: Sư yơ̆l môk kơlăm kong hu rang tơ kơ̆l sư, hrŭk ao hơkar ka kong rang, trăp dang tơdrâu-jĭt kĭ

English: And he had bronze armor on his legs and a bronze javelin between his shoulders.
Bahnar: jơ̆ng pơ̆n chuă hăm kong, sơngiĕng hlok đao hăm kong.

English: Now the staff of his spear was like a weaver’s beam, and his iron spearhead weighed six hundred shekels; and a shield-bearer went before him.
Bahnar: Gôliat kư̆m đei tơju, pla dư tih tŏ khơng đe tanh brai, kơnhŏng tơju trăp loi kơ tơpơh kĭ.

English: Then he stood and cried out to the armies of Israel, and said to them, “Why have you come out to line up for battle? Am I not a Philistine, and you the servants of Saul? Choose a man for yourselves, and let him come down to me.
Bahnar: Gôliat, sư dơ̆ng krao ôr lu bơngai Isơrael khan: Yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm 'maih tơblah? Inh âu bơngai tih kơjung nuih kơtang lăm lu linh Philistin, lu iĕm đĭch đam Sôl dah kiơ? Rơih bĕ minh 'nu đơ̆ng lăm lu iĕm jur năm tơblah inh âu.

English: If he is able to fight with me and kill me, then we will be your servants. But if I prevail against him and kill him, then you shall be our servants and serve us.”
Bahnar: Tơdah tơblah hăm inh jei sư păng sư pơlôch inh, lu nhôn gô pơm đĭch đam lu iĕm; mă-lei tơdah inh pran hloh kơ sư na inh pơlôch sư, lu iĕm gô pơm đĭch đam lu nhôn păng awih awăn kơ lu nhôn.

English: And the Philistine said, “I defy the armies of Israel this day; give me a man, that we may fight together.”
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin pơma hơno dơ̆ng: Tơpă, lăm năr 'nâu inh pơma pơlong lăng lu linh bơngai Isơrael; tơlĕch minh 'nu bơngai wăi, na lu bơ̆n tơblah băl.

English: When Saul and all Israel heard these words of the Philistine, they were dismayed and greatly afraid.
Bahnar: Sôl păng lu bơngai Isơrael mơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r bơngai Philistin, pơma noh jơhngơ̆m lu sư hli tơrơ dêh.

English: Now David was the son of that Ephrathite of Bethlehem Judah, whose name was Jesse, and who had eight sons. And the man was old, advanced in years, in the days of Saul.
Bahnar: Na, Đawit, kon drŏ-nglo Jese bơngai Êphrat, oei lăm pơlei Betlehem dêh Juđa; sư đei tơhngam 'nu kon drŏ-nglo, lăm chăl Sôl, Jese sư bơngai kră mă đe pơyom.

English: The three oldest sons of Jesse had gone to follow Saul to the battle. The names of his three sons who went to the battle were Eliab the firstborn, next to him Abinadab, and the third Shammah.
Bahnar: Pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo Jese kiơ̆ boih Sôl năm tơblah. Anăn pêng 'nu kon drŏ-nglo ei: Kon kơdră Êliap, kon mă 'bar Abinađap păng kon mă pêng Samma.

English: David was the youngest. And the three oldest followed Saul.
Bahnar: Đawit kon hơdruch, pêng 'nu 'nhŏng sư kiơ̆ Sôl.

English: But David occasionally went and returned from Saul to feed his father’s sheep at Bethlehem.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit kư̆m brŏk năm đơ̆ng anih Sôl, brŏk tơ pơlei Betlehem wei triu 'bă sư.

English: And the Philistine drew near and presented himself forty days, morning and evening.
Bahnar: Gôliat bơngai Philistin năm lĕch pơgê kơsơ̆, pơjăm linh bơngai Isơrael thoi noh lăm puăn-jĭt năr.

English: Then Jesse said to his son David, “Take now for your brothers an ephah of this dried grain and these ten loaves, and run to your brothers at the camp.
Bahnar: Na Isai khan kơ Đawit, kon drŏ-nglo sư: Dăm kon e iŏk minh kơthŭnga 'ba mi hơdrĕng păng mơjĭt tŏ 'bĕng âu, kơdâu năm ba truh tơ kơđông chĕp ba ăn kơ lu đe 'nhŏng e.

English: And carry these ten cheeses to the captain of their thousand, and see how your brothers fare, and bring back news of them.”
Bahnar: Dăm kon e chĕp mơjĭt tŏ 'bĕng đak toh âu ăn kơ lu bơngai pơgơ̆r wei-lăng rơbâu 'nu linh, năm lăng lu đe 'nhŏng e hăm oei liĕm akâu dah ưh păng e kư̆m brŏk chĕp ăn kơ 'bă minh tơdra yă kiơ gah lu sư.

English: Now Saul and they and all the men of Israel were in the Valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.
Bahnar: Lu 'nhŏng oei hơdai hăm Sôl păng đĭ-đăng lu linh bơngai Isơrael tơ lăm pŭng-lŭng Êlah, wă tơblah hăm lu linh kon pơlei Philistin.

English: So David rose early in the morning, left the sheep with a keeper, and took the things and went as Jesse had commanded him. And he came to the camp as the army was going out to the fight and shouting for the battle.
Bahnar: Pơgê dơning đơ̆ng hrôih, Đawit lê̆ triu sư ăn kơ minh 'nu bơngai wei, iŏk tơmam na yak năm, thoi 'bă sư pơkă boih. Lăp sư truh tơ anih na kơplah noh hloi lu linh lĕch năm tơblah păng jreo re drŭt tơblah.

English: For Israel and the Philistines had drawn up in battle array, army against army.
Bahnar: Bơngai Isơrael păng lu kon pơlei Philistin sư dă wă tơblah, 'bar pah linh tơklă băl muh măt.

English: And David left his supplies in the hand of the supply keeper, ran to the army, and came and greeted his brothers.
Bahnar: Đawit ming lê̆ tơmam sa sư pơjao kơ minh 'nu bơngai wei tơmam, kơdâu truh tơ anih wă tơblah. Truh jet gia pêng 'nu lu đe 'nhŏng sư hăm oei liĕm kâu dah ưh.

English: Then as he talked with them, there was the champion, the Philistine of Gath, Goliath by name, coming up from the armies of the Philistines; and he spoke according to the same words. So David heard them.
Bahnar: Kơplah sư oei pơma dơnuh hăm 'nhŏng sư, Gôliat, sư bơngai Philistin oei tơ pơlei Gat, đơ̆ng khŭl linh Philistin sư lĕch năm pơma pơjăm pơjuă thoi ki, na Đawit kơtơ̆ng đĭ sư pơma.

English: And all the men of Israel, when they saw the man, fled from him and were dreadfully afraid.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng lu linh bơngai Isơrael 'bôh Gôliat hli tơrơ, chă kơdâu ôn.

English: So the men of Israel said, “Have you seen this man who has come up? Surely he has come up to defy Israel; and it shall be that the man who kills him the king will enrich with great riches, will give him his daughter, and give his father’s house exemption from taxes in Israel.”
Bahnar: Lu Sư khan tơduă: Lu iĕm hăm 'bôh bơngai noh to sư lĕch năm? Sư wă pơjăm che bơle kơ bơngai Isơrael, tơdah bơngai bu kĕ pơlôch sư, na pơtao gô apah mŭk tơmam lơ, rôp ăn kon adruh sư ăn kơ bơngai noh oei păng ưh kơ đei iŏk thuê̆ ăn rơngei kơ hnam 'bă.

English: Then David spoke to the men who stood by him, saying, “What shall be done for the man who kills this Philistine and takes away the reproach from Israel? For who is this uncircumcised Philistine, that he should defy the armies of the living God?”
Bahnar: Đawit jet lu bơngai ngôi jê̆ sư: Đe gô apah kiơ kơ bơngai gơh pơlôch bơngai Philistin 'nâu păng wă kơ huay pă pơjăm lu bơngai Isơrael dơ̆ng? Lu bơngai Philistin 'nâu, lu bơngai ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar, sư bu, na mă pơ̆n pơjăm lu linh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei arih ling-lang?

English: And the people answered him in this manner, saying, “So shall it be done for the man who kills him.”
Bahnar: Linh roi kơ Đawit tơmam apah noh: Bu gơh kĕ pơlôch sư na gô apah tơmam trŏ thoi đei roi boih.

English: Now Eliab his oldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab’s anger was aroused against David, and he said, “Why did you come down here? And with whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride and the insolence of your heart, for you have come down to see the battle.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Êliap 'nhŏng kơdră sư, hil kơ Đawit pơma apinh thoi noh, na khan: E năm chă kiơ tơ âu? E achăng lê̆ lu triu bơ̆n lăm tơmăn glă ăn kơ bu lăng? Inh băt jơhngơ̆m e pơang pơma kơchu lăm jơhngơ̆m. Truh tơ âu e wă lăng tơblah ah.

English: And David said, “What have I done now? Is there not a cause?”
Bahnar: Đawit tơl: Inh đei pơm kiơ? 'Noh inh wă apinh lăng đĕch!

English: Then he turned from him toward another and said the same thing; and these people answered him as the first ones did.
Bahnar: Sư weh ataih đơ̆ng 'nhŏng sư, apinh dơ̆ng lu bơngai nai minh nơ̆r thoi 'noh hei, na đe tơl kư̆m thoi adrol hei.

English: Now when the words which David spoke were heard, they reported them to Saul; and he sent for him.
Bahnar: Đei bơngai kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r Đawit pơma, na plơ̆ roi ăn kơ Sôl băt; Sôl krao sư.

English: Then David said to Saul, “Let no man’s heart fail because of him; your servant will go and fight with this Philistine.”
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Sôl: Apinh 'nĕ ăn bơngai bu mă hli kơ bơngai Philistin noh! Inh đĭch đam pơtao gô năm tơblah hăm sư.

English: And Saul said to David, “You are not able to go against this Philistine to fight with him; for you are a youth, and he a man of war from his youth.”
Bahnar: Sôl găn Đawit: Ih ưh kơ kĕ wă tơblah hăm bơngai Philistin, yua kơ ih minh 'nu bơngai oei 'lơ̆p, sư 'noh bơngai juăt kơ tơblah đơ̆ng oei 'lơ̆p sơ̆.

English: But David said to Saul, “Your servant used to keep his father’s sheep, and when a lion or a bear came and took a lamb out of the flock
Bahnar: Đawit tơl roi kơ Sôl: Kơplah inh wei triu 'bă inh, dah đei dăm-brang, chơgơu wă rôp sa triu đơ̆ng lăm khŭl triu

English: I went out after it and struck it, and delivered the lamb from its mouth; and when it arose against me, I caught it by its beard, and struck and killed it.
Bahnar: na inh druh, teh sư, pơdŭng iŏk triu đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư tơdah sư ôr bruh tơ inh, inh rôp sŏk kang sư, teh pơlôch sư.

English: Your servant has killed both lion and bear; and this uncircumcised Philistine will be like one of them, seeing he has defied the armies of the living God.”
Bahnar: Inh pơlôch boih dăm-brang păng chơgơu, thoi noh na bơngai Philistin to ưh kơ chu kăt tơdra akar tăm dơ̆ng inh kư̆m gô teh pơlôch sư thoi sem brem noh mơ̆n; yua kơ sư pơjăm lu linh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang.

English: Moreover David said, “The LORD, who delivered me from the paw of the lion and from the paw of the bear, He will deliver me from the hand of this Philistine.” And Saul said to David, “Go, and the LORD be with you!”
Bahnar: Đawit khan dơ̆ng: Kră Yang pơklaih boih inh đơ̆ng dăm-brang păng đơ̆ng chơgơu, Sư kư̆m gô pơklaih inh mơ̆n đơ̆ng ti bơngai Philistin to noh, Sôl drơ̆ng: Năm bĕ, hơpơi Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm ih!

English: So Saul clothed David with his armor, and he put a bronze helmet on his head; he also clothed him with a coat of mail.
Bahnar: Sôl iŏk ao tơblah sư pơhrŭk ăn kơ Đawit, pơyơ̆l ăn môk kơlăm kong păng pơhrŭk ăn ao mam.

English: David fastened his sword to his armor and tried to walk, for he had not tested them. And David said to Saul, “I cannot walk with these, for I have not tested them.” So David took them off.
Bahnar: Đawit tơ̆n đao Sôl tơ kơiĕng, 'nguaih, kơ ao tơblah na pơtơ̆p nơnăm, mă-lei ưh kơ gơh yua kơ ưh kơ juăt; sư khan kơ Sôl: Inh ưh kơ chĕp đao 'nâu yua kơ inh ưh kơ juăt yak ưh kơ gơh, Đawit plôh lê̆ ao ei.

English: Then he took his staff in his hand; and he chose for himself five smooth stones from the brook, and put them in a shepherd’s bag, in a pouch which he had, and his sling was in his hand. And he drew near to the Philistine.
Bahnar: Đawit chĕp minh pơm 'long jra, chă dônh rơih iŏk pơđăm tŏ tơmo iêl hlăng tơter thong đak, tah lăm kơdŭng chơbĭ sư wei triu 'băk rim năr păng tơ'bla tơlei akar tơ ti sư, lĕch năm tơ anăp bơngai Philistin noh.

English: So the Philistine came, and began drawing near to David, and the man who bore the shield went before him.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin noh kư̆m lĕch năm tơ jê̆ Đawit rai wă jê̆ đei bơngai chĕp đao nơnăm adrol.

English: And when the Philistine looked about and saw David, he disdained him; for he was only a youth, ruddy and good-looking.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin noh lăng tơ Đawit, pơjăm hloi, 'bôh sư oei mơlôh akâu jăn muh măt sư 'lơ̆ng.

English: So the Philistine said to David, “Am I a dog, that you come to me with sticks?” And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin khan kơ Đawit: Inh ưh kơ sĭ kơ kŏ na ih chĕp 'long băl năm tơ inh? Bơngai Philistin yua anăn yang lu sư na hiap Đawit.

English: And the Philistine said to David, “Come to me, and I will give your flesh to the birds of the air and the beasts of the field!”
Bahnar: Bơngai Philistin hơnganh: Năm tơ âu wăi, inh gô ăn sĕch ih kơ lu sem păr păng lu sem bri sa.

English: Then David said to the Philistine, “You come to me with a sword, with a spear, and with a javelin. But I come to you in the name of the LORD of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied.
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ bơngai Philistin: Ih chĕp đao, năm blah inh, gah inh; inh yua anăn Kră Yang Tih Hloh, noh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu linh bơngai Isơrael, mă lu iĕm pơjăm pơjuă.

English: This day the LORD will deliver you into my hand, and I will strike you and take your head from you. And this day I will give the carcasses of the camp of the Philistines to the birds of the air and the wild beasts of the earth, that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu Kră Yang gô pơjao ih lăm tơpang ti inh, inh gô pơlôch ih, kăt kơ̆l ih păng bơngai Philistin lôch ăn kơ sem păr păng lu sem bri sa sĕch lu linh bơngai Philistin. Jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak gô băt kơ bơngai Isơrael đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: Then all this assembly shall know that the LORD does not save with sword and spear; for the battle is the LORD’s, and He will give you into our hands.”
Bahnar: Đĭ lu bơngai tơ âu gô 'bôh Kră Yang ưh kơ dŏng pơklaih păng đao dah păng tơju yua kơ Kră Yang jơ̆ yŏng kơ tơblah păng Sư gô jao lu iĕm lăm tơpang ti lu nhôn.

English: So it was, when the Philistine arose and came and drew near to meet David, that David hurried and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
Bahnar: Kơplah bơngai Philistin iung, năm sơng jê̆ Đawit, Đawit hăt hot kơdâu năm tơ anăp wă tơblah hăm bơngai Philistin.

English: Then David put his hand in his bag and took out a stone; and he slung it and struck the Philistine in his forehead, so that the stone sank into his forehead, and he fell on his face to the earth.
Bahnar: Đawit 'bot ti lăm kơdŭng sư, iŏk minh găr tơmo tah tơ lăm tơlei akar tơ'bla sư tăr wăr tơmo, 'bơm 'bơ̆t klĕng bơngai Philistin, tơmo mơ̆t đom lăm klĕng, Gôliat pơ̆k kơmŭ brum muh măt tơ teh.

English: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone, and struck the Philistine and killed him. But there was no sword in the hand of David.
Bahnar: Lei na Đawit blah Gôliat bơngai Philistin jei sư, hăm hră tơ'bla, hăm minh găr tơmo. Sư pơlôch Gôliat bơngai Philistin ưh kơ đei hăm đao lăm ti sư.

English: Therefore David ran and stood over the Philistine, took his sword and drew it out of its sheath and killed him, and cut off his head with it. And when the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.
Bahnar: Na Đawit kơdâu juă kơpal akâu bơngai Philistin iŏk đao sư toh đơ̆ng hơnglop, 'bet pơlôch sư, păng kăt kơ̆l sư hloi. Kon pơlei Philistin 'bôh bơngai pran tih kơjung sư lôch bơih, na kơdâu.

English: Now the men of Israel and Judah arose and shouted, and pursued the Philistines as far as the entrance of the valley and to the gates of Ekron. And the wounded of the Philistines fell along the road to Shaaraim, even as far as Gath and Ekron.
Bahnar: Lu linh bơngai Isơrael păng bơngai Juđa iung jreo, tơkĕch, druh kon pơlei Philistin truh tơ trong mơ̆t pơlei Gat păng tơ 'măng jang pơlei Ekrôn. Lu bơngai Philistin jĭ rơka pơ̆k lôch 'bĕnh kơ trong đơ̆ng Saraim truh tơ pơlei Gat păng Êkrôn.

English: Then the children of Israel returned from chasing the Philistines, and they plundered their tents.
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Isơrael đang đơ̆ng druh puh kon pơlei Philistin boih, na hơlơ̆k brŏk blah iŏk pơrăm kơđông sư.

English: And David took the head of the Philistine and brought it to Jerusalem, but he put his armor in his tent.
Bahnar: Đawit dônh iŏk kơ̆l bơngai Philistin chĕp ba truh tơ Jêrusalem; mă-lei gah ao mam, môk kơlăm đao tơju Gôliat lê̆ lăm bơsŭn sư.

English: When Saul saw David going out against the Philistine, he said to Abner, the commander of the army, “Abner, whose son is this youth?” And Abner said, “As your soul lives, O king, I do not know.”
Bahnar: Sôl 'bôh Đawit năm blah bơngai Philistin, na jet Apne yŏng pơgơ̆r linh: Ơ Apner, bơngai tơdăm mơlôh noh kon drŏ-nglo bu? Apner tơl khan: Ơ pơtao inh arih sot! Inh ưh kơ băt.

English: So the king said, “Inquire whose son this young man is.”
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ sư: Apinh lăng drŏ-nglo tơdăm mơlôh noh kon bu.

English: Then, as David returned from the slaughter of the Philistine, Abner took him and brought him before Saul with the head of the Philistine in his hand.
Bahnar: Wă, Đawit pơlôch bơih lu bơngai Philistin wơ̆t brŏk, Apner sơng sư, chông ba sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp Sôl, Đawit oei chĕp kơ̆l bơngai Philistin tơ ti sư.

English: And Saul said to him, “Whose son are you, young man?” So David answered, “I am the son of your servant Jesse the Bethlehemite.”
Bahnar: Sôl pơma dơnuh hăm Đawit: Ơ dăm mơlôh, ih kon bu? Đawit tơl: Inh kon Jese, đĭch đam pơtao, oei tơ pơlei Betlehem.

English: Now when he had finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan was knit to the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.
Bahnar: Đawit pơma dơnuh hăm Sôl đang boih, Jônathan păng Đawit pơm buăl juăt yua, kơ Jônathan 'mêm kơ Đawit dêh thoi akâu sư kơdih.

English: Saul took him that day, and would not let him go home to his father’s house anymore.
Bahnar: Năr noh, Sôl iŏk Đawit oei hloi tơ noh, ưh kơ ăn sư brŏk tơ hnam 'bă sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then Jonathan and David made a covenant, because he loved him as his own soul.
Bahnar: Jônathan pơgơ̆p hăm Đawit, yua kơ sư 'mêm kơ Đawit nhen thoi akâu sư kơdih.

English: And Jonathan took off the robe that was on him and gave it to David, with his armor, even to his sword and his bow and his belt.
Bahnar: Jônathan plôh ao tai sư pơhrŭk ăn kơ Đawit, hăm ao tơblah sư hai, ăn đao, hră păng tơlei tơ̆n sư.

English: So David went out wherever Saul sent him, and behaved wisely. And Saul set him over the men of war, and he was accepted in the sight of all the people and also in the sight of Saul’s servants.
Bahnar: Đawit lơ 'măng năm blah, mă tơ anih ayơ ayơ Sôl wơh sư năm, tơblah jei sư ngăl. Sôl pơjao ăn kơ sư pơgơ̆r linh, kon pơlei păng lu đĭch đam Sôl lăp đon kơ Đawit pơgơ̆r lu sư.

English: Now it had happened as they were coming home, when David was returning from the slaughter of the Philistine, that the women had come out of all the cities of Israel, singing and dancing, to meet King Saul, with tambourines, with joy, and with musical instruments.
Bahnar: Đang kơ Đawit pơlôch bơngai Philistin, wih brŏk hăm lu linh sư, na lu bơngai drŏ-kăn rim kơ pơlei bơngai Isơrael lĕch năm sơng Sôl, hơri suang, teh hơgơ̆r iĕ hăm brŏ tĭng-nĭng păng jreo nơ̆r hiôk chơt.

English: So the women sang as they danced, and said: “Saul has slain his thousands, And David his ten thousands.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai drŏ-kăn suang hơri pơdrơ̆ng băl khan: Sôl pơlôch rơbâu, rơbâu 'nu gah Đawit pơlôch mơjĭt-rơbâu rơbâu 'nu

English: Then Saul was very angry, and the saying displeased him; and he said, “They have ascribed to David ten thousands, and to me they have ascribed only thousands. Now what more can he have but the kingdom?”
Bahnar: Sôl blĕk dêh kơ dôm lu nơ̆r hơri 'nâu ưh kơ lăp jơhngơ̆m sư, sư khan: Đe khan Đawit pơlôch mơjĭt-rơbâu rơbâu 'nu, mă-lei gah inh khan rơbâu rơbâu 'nu đĕch; oei pă minh tam mă gơh pơm pơtao đĕch!

English: So Saul eyed David from that day forward.
Bahnar: Iŏk đơ̆ng năr noh, Sôl klai kơ Đawit dêh

English: And it happened on the next day that the distressing spirit from God came upon Saul, and he prophesied inside the house. So David played music with his hand, as at other times; but there was a spear in Saul’s hand.
Bahnar: Năr đơ̆ng rŏng, Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t lăm Sôl; sư hli tơrơ pơma kư̆ kă lăm hnam sư, thoi bơngai wơnh, na Đawit reh brŏ thoi krô hmă. Sôl chĕp minh hlak tơju tơ ti sư.

English: And Saul cast the spear, for he said, “I will pin David to the wall!” But David escaped his presence twice.
Bahnar: Sôl hrang Đawit, na khan: Inh gô pơ̆ng ih tơ tơnăr. Mă-lei Đawit pĕch kơ tơju 'bar wơ̆t.

English: Now Saul was afraid of David, because the LORD was with him, but had departed from Saul.
Bahnar: Sôl hli kơ Đawit, yua kơ Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm Đawit, na achăng lê̆ sư.

English: Therefore Saul removed him from his presence, and made him his captain over a thousand; and he went out and came in before the people.
Bahnar: Sôl wă puh tơweh Đawit ataih kơ sư, jao ăn kơ Đawit wei pơgơ̆r minh-rơbâu 'nu linh tơblah. Đawit ngăl chông linh năm tơblah.

English: And David behaved wisely in all his ways, and the LORD was with him.
Bahnar: Đawit năm tơblah mă tơ yơ yơ kư̆m jei sư ngăl yua kơ Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm sư.

English: Therefore, when Saul saw that he behaved very wisely, he was afraid of him.
Bahnar: Sôl 'bôh Đawit năm tơblah jei sư ngăl, na Sôl rai hli dêh.

English: But all Israel and Judah loved David, because he went out and came in before them.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đĭ-đăng bơngai Isơrael păng bơngai Juđa 'mêm kơ Đawit, yua kơ sư pơgơ̆r lu sư tơblah.

English: Then Saul said to David, “Here is my older daughter Merab; I will give her to you as a wife. Only be valiant for me, and fight the LORD’s battles.” For Saul thought, “Let my hand not be against him, but let the hand of the Philistines be against him.”
Bahnar: Sôl pơma dơnuh hăm Đawit: 'Nâu Mêrap kon drŏ-kăn kơdră inh. Inh gô ăn kơ ih oei pơm akăn mă-lei ih athei mă nuih tơblah ăn kơ Kră Yang. Sôl tơchĕng lăm jơhngơ̆m khan: Tơpang ti inh ưh kơ gơh pơrăm sư, mă-lei lê̆ kơ tơpang ti lu kon pơlei Philistin pơrăm sư noh trŏ hloh.

English: So David said to Saul, “Who am I, and what is my life or my father’s family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?”
Bahnar: Đawit tơl khan: Ơ pơtao Inh âu bu? Adrĕch adrung inh bu, krung kơtum 'bă inh noh kiơ lăm bơngai Isơrael kiơ na pơk inh pơm ŏng pơtao?

English: But it happened at the time when Merab, Saul’s daughter, should have been given to David, that she was given to Adriel the Meholathite as a wife.
Bahnar: Na, truh tơ khei 'năr Mêrap, kon drŏ-kăn Sôl, wă ăn kơ Đawit oei, na pơtao tă ăn kơ Adriel oei bơngai đơ̆ng pơlei Mêhôta.

English: Now Michal, Saul’s daughter, loved David. And they told Saul, and the thing pleased him.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Mikai, kon drŏ-kăn Sôl, hưch kơ Đawit. Sôl băt tơdrong noh, na jơhngơ̆m sư lăp đon.

English: So Saul said, “I will give her to him, that she may be a snare to him, and that the hand of the Philistines may be against him.” Therefore Saul said to David a second time, “You shall be my son-in-law today.”
Bahnar: Sư tơchĕng khan: Inh gô ăn sư oei kơ Đawit, pơm thoi hơđong wă kơ Đawit 'leh lăm ti bơngai Philistin. Thoi noh Sôl pơma dơnuh 'măng mă 'bar hăm Đawit: Ih gô pơm ŏng inh.

English: And Saul commanded his servants, “Communicate with David secretly, and say, ‘Look, the king has delight in you, and all his servants love you. Now therefore, become the king’s son-in-law.’ ”
Bahnar: Na Sôl athei lu đĭch đam sư: Iĕm năm pơma hơdar hăm Đawit: Ih hăm 'bôh pơtao lăp đon kơ ih păng đĭ-đăng lu đĭch đam pơtao kư̆m 'mêm kơ ih mơ̆n; thoi noh na pơm bĕ ŏng pơtao.

English: So Saul’s servants spoke those words in the hearing of David. And David said, “Does it seem to you a light thing to be a king’s son-in-law, seeing I am a poor and lightly esteemed man?”
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam Sôl roi dơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r ei hăm Đawit. Đawit tơl khan: Pơm ŏng pơtao, iĕm tơchĕng tơdrong iĕ đĕch ah? Inh minh 'nu bơngai dơnuh hin păng răm-'băm.

English: And the servants of Saul told him, saying, “In this manner David spoke.”
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam Sôl roi ăn dơ̆ng kơ pơtao dôm nơ̆r Đawit tơl.

English: Then Saul said, “Thus you shall say to David: ‘The king does not desire any dowry but one hundred foreskins of the Philistines, to take vengeance on the king’s enemies.’ ” But Saul thought to make David fall by the hand of the Philistines.
