Bahnar: Sôl khan kơ lu sư: Lu iĕm năm roi kơ Đawit; Pơtao ưh kơ đei apinh minh tơdrong kiơ ôh, kăl kơ minh-hrĕng tŏ kơ̆l tơmam drŏ-nglo bơngai Philistin, wă kơ pơm 'mong tơwih kơ lu bơngai ayăt kơ sư. Na Sôl chă đon wă pơm ăn kơ Đawit puh hiong lăm tơpang ti kon pơlei Philistin.

English: So when his servants told David these words, it pleased David well to become the king’s son-in-law. Now the days had not expired
Bahnar: Wă Lu đĭch đam roi ăn dơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r 'nâu kơ Đawit mơ̆ng, na Đawit chu kiơ̆ adrol kơ tơm năr pơkă wă pơm ŏng pơtao, adrol kơ năr pơkă.

English: therefore David arose and went, he and his men, and killed two hundred men of the Philistines. And David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full count to the king, that he might become the king’s son-in-law. Then Saul gave him Michal his daughter as a wife.
Bahnar: Đawit năm hăm lu linh sư năm blah pơlôch 'bar-hrĕng 'nu lu bơngai Philistin. Sư chĕp ba tơm kơ̆l tơmam drŏ-nglo ăn kơ pơtao wă kơ gơh pơm ŏng pơtao. Thoi noh, Sôl kư̆m ăn Mikal, kon drŏ-kăn sư kơ Đawit pơm akăn.

English: Thus Saul saw and knew that the LORD was with David, and that Michal, Saul’s daughter, loved him
Bahnar: Wă Sôl lăng băt Kră Yang oei hơdai hăm Đawit, Mikal kon drŏ-kăn Sôl hưch 'mêm kơ Đawit

English: and Saul was still more afraid of David. So Saul became David’s enemy continually.
Bahnar: Sôl rai hli kơ Đawit dơ̆ng păng đĭ chăl arih pơtao ayăt hăm Đawit.

English: Then the princes of the Philistines went out to war. And so it was, whenever they went out, that David behaved more wisely than all the servants of Saul, so that his name became highly esteemed.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t lu kră pơgơ̆r kon pơlei Philistin ngăl năm tơblah, hăm bơngai Isơrael na Đawit tơblah hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu đĭch đam Sôl; thoi noh, anăn sư đe ư-ang rai dêh.

English: Now Saul spoke to Jonathan his son and to all his servants, that they should kill David; but Jonathan, Saul’s son, delighted greatly in David.
Bahnar: Sôl pơđâu chă đon hăm Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo sư păng lu đĭch đam sư wă pơlôch Đawit mă-lei Jônathan, kon drŏ-nglo Sôl, 'mêm dêh kơ Đawit.

English: So Jonathan told David, saying, “My father Saul seeks to kill you. Therefore please be on your guard until morning, and stay in a secret place and hide.
Bahnar: Jônathan roi ăn kơ Đawit băt Sôl, 'bă inh, chă wă pơlôch ih. Thoi noh, pơgê dơning ih lĕch kơdâu tơ anih mă hlơp na ôn tơ noh.

English: And I will go out and stand beside my father in the field where you are, and I will speak with my father about you. Then what I observe, I will tell you.”
Bahnar: Inh gô năm dơ̆ng răp lăng 'bă inh 'bơ̆t anih chŭn mă ih ôn noh păng roi kơ 'bă inh gah ih gô lăng sư pơma thoi yơ, đơ̆ng noh inh roi ăn kơ ih băt.

English: Thus Jonathan spoke well of David to Saul his father, and said to him, “Let not the king sin against his servant, against David, because he has not sinned against you, and because his works have been very good toward you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Jônathan pơma dŏng Đawit khan kơ 'bă sư: Apinh ih 'nĕ pơm tơdrong yoch hăm Đawit, đĭch đam ih, yua kơ sư ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ hăm ih, mă đei tơgŭm tơdrong jang tih ăn kơ ih dơ̆ng.

English: For he took his life in his hands and killed the Philistine, and the LORD brought about a great deliverance for all Israel. You saw it and rejoiced. Why then will you sin against innocent blood, to kill David without a cause?”
Bahnar: Sư hŭt akâu kơdih na mă pơlôch bơngai Philistin, yua kơ sư na Kră Yang đei ăn kơ bơngai Isơrael tơblah jei ngăl. Ih 'bôh boih păng chơt hiôk; lei na khan wă pơlôch pơrăm bơngai ưh kơ pơm yoch wă pơlôch Đawit tơdrong ưh kơđei?

English: So Saul heeded the voice of Jonathan, and Saul swore, “As the LORD lives, he shall not be killed.”
Bahnar: Sôl mơ̆ng nơ̆r Jônathan roi na sư pơkă khan: Inh pao anăn Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang, Đawit gô ưh kơ lôch ôh!

English: Then Jonathan called David, and Jonathan told him all these things. So Jonathan brought David to Saul, and he was in his presence as in times past.
Bahnar: Na, Jônathan krao Đawit, roi ăn dôm lu nơ̆r ei kơ sư, na chông ba Đawit năm tơ Sôl, na Đawit oei bơ̆jang kơ Sôl thoi adrol ki dơ̆ng.

English: And there was war again; and David went out and fought with the Philistines, and struck them with a mighty blow, and they fled from him.
Bahnar: Đei tơdrong tơblah dơ̆ng, Đawit năm blah kon pơlei Philistin, pơm blah ăn kơ lu bơngai Philistin thuơ tih tơpă, lu sư kơdâu đi

English: Now the distressing spirit from the LORD came upon Saul as he sat in his house with his spear in his hand. And David was playing music with his hand.
Bahnar: Kră Yang ăn yang kơnê̆ mơ̆t lăm Sôl kơplah sư oei ngôi lăm hnam chĕp tơju tơ ti sư; 'bơ̆t Đawit oei reh brŏ tĭng-nĭng.

English: Then Saul sought to pin David to the wall with the spear, but he slipped away from Saul’s presence; and he drove the spear into the wall. So David fled and escaped that night.
Bahnar: Sôl iŏk tơju wă hrăng kơtĭt Đawit tơ tơnăr, mă-lei Đawit pĕch, tơju Sôl 'bơm tơ tơnăr. Đawit kơdâu hloi măng noh.

English: Saul also sent messengers to David’s house to watch him and to kill him in the morning. And Michal, David’s wife, told him, saying, “If you do not save your life tonight, tomorrow you will be killed.”
Bahnar: Sôl wơh bơngai năm răp tơ hnam Đawit wă kơ pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng noh gơh pơlôch sư hloi, mă-lei Mikal akăn Đawit roi ăn kơ sư băt: Tơdah măng 'nâu ih ưh kơ kơdâu klĕnh, na pơgê dơning đe gô pơlôch ih.

English: So Michal let David down through a window. And he went and fled and escaped.
Bahnar: Mikal tơjur Đawit trong 'măng-'mŏk; sư kơdâu klĕnh păng hlôi hloi

English: And Michal took an image and laid it in the bed, put a cover of goats’ hair for his head, and covered it with clothes.
Bahnar: Na, Mikal iŏk rup man tơ'bĭch kơpal giơng, iŏk 'long kơn sŏk bơbe hơgơn kơ̆l, tơsu ao kơ akâu rup.

English: So when Saul sent messengers to take David, she said, “He is sick.”
Bahnar: Na Sôl wơh bơngai năm rôp Đawit, na Mikal khan: Klo inh bơlŏ.

English: Then Saul sent the messengers back to see David, saying, “Bring him up to me in the bed, that I may kill him.”
Bahnar: Sôl wơh dơ̆ng bơngai năm ngôi tơ Đawit, na khan kơ lu sư: Athei hiŏng sư hăm giơng noh ba tơ inh tơ âu: Lê̆ inh pơlôch sư.

English: And when the messengers had come in, there was the image in the bed, with a cover of goats’ hair for his head.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai sư wơh năm tơ noh 'bôh rup man tơ'bĭch kơpal giơng, đei 'long kơn păng sŏk bơbe dan ala kơ̆l rup man noh.

English: Then Saul said to Michal, “Why have you deceived me like this, and sent my enemy away, so that he has escaped?” And Michal answered Saul, “He said to me, ‘Let me go! Why should I kill you?’ ”
Bahnar: Sôl pơma hil kơ Mikal: Liơ e gơh hơlĕnh kơ inh thoi noh, lê̆ bơngai ayăt kơ inh kơdâu klĕnh? Mikal tơl 'bă sư: Na sư khan kơ inh: Ăn kơ inh lĕch, dah ưh, inh gô pơlôch e.

English: So David fled and escaped, and went to Samuel at Ramah, and told him all that Saul had done to him. And he and Samuel went and stayed in Naioth.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Đawit kơdâu klĕnh sư năm tơ Samuel tơ Rama, roi ăn kơ Samuel dôm tơdrong mă Sôl pơm kơ sư. Na Đawit hăm Samuel năm, oei tơ Naiôt.

English: Now it was told Saul, saying, “Take note, David is at Naioth in Ramah!”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai roi ăn kơ Sôl băt kơ. Đawit oei tơ Naiôt lăm pơlei Rama.

English: Then Saul sent messengers to take David. And when they saw the group of prophets prophesying, and Samuel standing as leader over them, the Spirit of God came upon the messengers of Saul, and they also prophesied.
Bahnar: Sôl wơh bơngai năm rôp Đawit; na lu sư 'bôh minh khŭl bơngai khan lê̆ adrol oei suang pơma khan lê̆ adrol păng Samuel pơgơ̆r lu bơngai ei, Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆t pơm kơ lu sư lu sư kư̆m suang pơma khan lê̆ adrol mơ̆n.

English: And when Saul was told, he sent other messengers, and they prophesied likewise. Then Saul sent messengers again the third time, and they prophesied also.
Bahnar: Lăp Sôl băt, na sư wơh lu bơngai nai plơ̆ng dơ̆ng; lu sư kư̆m suang pơma khan lê̆ adrol lei lai thoi lu bơngai noh hei. Sôl wơh dơ̆ng lu bơngai năm khŭl mă pêng, lu sư kư̆m suang pơma khan lê̆ adrol.

English: Then he also went to Ramah, and came to the great well that is at Sechu. So he asked, and said, “Where are Samuel and David?” And someone said, “Indeed they are at Naioth in Ramah.”
Bahnar: Na Sôl năm akâu sư kơdih truh tơ pơlei Rama; truh tơ anih sơlŭng mong đak Sêku, na sư jet: Samuel păng Đawit oei tơ yơ? Đe tơl khan: Măr sư oei tơ Naiôt lăm pơlei Rama.

English: So he went there to Naioth in Ramah. Then the Spirit of God was upon him also, and he went on and prophesied until he came to Naioth in Ramah.
Bahnar: Sư năm hloi tơ Naiôt lăm pơlei Rama; Yang Bơhngol Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m mơ̆t tơ sư, sư kư̆m suang pơma khan lê̆ adrol dĭng truh tơ Naiôt lăm pơlei Rama

English: And he also stripped off his clothes and prophesied before Samuel in like manner, and lay down naked all that day and all that night. Therefore they say, “Is Saul also among the prophets?”
Bahnar: Sư kư̆m plôh lê̆ ao sư kơdih, suang pơplŏng pơma khan lê̆ adrol 'bơ̆t anăp Samuel, na pơtao suang pơ̆k 'bĭch hloi tơ teh akâu hoh prăt măng lăm măng noh. Kơlih kơ thoi noh na, đei nơ̆r khan: Sôl kư̆m wang mơ̆t hơdai lu bơngai khan lê̆ adrol mơ̆n hă?

English: Then David fled from Naioth in Ramah, and went and said to Jonathan, “What have I done? What is my iniquity, and what is my sin before your father, that he seeks my life?”
Bahnar: Đawit klĕnh đơ̆ng Naiôt lăm pơlei Rama, năm tơ Jônathan, na apinh Jônathan: Inh đei pơm yoch kiơ, tơdrong kơnê̆ kiơ? Inh pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ hăm 'bă ih, na mă sư chă đon wă pơlôch inh?

English: So Jonathan said to him, “By no means! You shall not die! Indeed, my father will do nothing either great or small without first telling me. And why should my father hide this thing from me? It is not so!”
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl sư: Ưh, ih huay kơ lôch ôh. 'Bă inh ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ, mă tơdrong tih dah tơdrong iĕ, khan ưh kơ roi kơ inh. Na 'bă inh wă ôn kơ inh tơdrong 'nâu ah? Ưh kơ đei ôh.

English: Then David took an oath again, and said, “Your father certainly knows that I have found favor in your eyes, and he has said, ‘Do not let Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved.’ But truly, as the LORD lives and as your soul lives, there is but a step between me and death.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit khan hơđăl: 'Bă ih băt hơđăl ih 'mêm kơ inh, na đei pơma khan: 'Nĕ kơ roi ăn kơ Jônathan băt, kơnh sư hơ'ngon inh pao anăn Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang păng tơdrong arih ih na pơkă: Lăp minh yak đĕch sơlam inh hăm tơdrong lôch.

English: So Jonathan said to David, “Whatever you yourself desire, I will do it for you.”
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl Đawit: Tơdah ih wă kơ inh pơm kiơ, inh gô pơm ăn kơ ih.

English: And David said to Jonathan, “Indeed tomorrow is the New Moon, and I should not fail to sit with the king to eat. But let me go, that I may hide in the field until the third day at evening.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: Dơning năr mă mônh, lăm khei plơ̆ng inh juăt et sa hơdai hăm pơtao, mă-lei lê̆ inh năm ôn lăm tơmăn glă truh tơ kơsơ̆ năr mă pêng.

English: If your father misses me at all, then say, ‘David earnestly asked permission of me that he might run over to Bethlehem, his city, for there is a yearly sacrifice there for all the family.’
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bă ih 'bôh inh krŭl, na athei roi ăn kơ sư: Đawit apinh ih athei song sư brŏk tơ pơlei Betlehem, pơlei sư kơdih, yua kơ tơ noh đĭ hnam sư juăt kơ pơyơ̆r tơmam soi rim sơnăm.

English: If he says thus: ‘It is well,’ your servant will be safe. But if he is very angry, be sure that evil is determined by him.
Bahnar: Tơdah sư tơl: 'Lơ̆ng, lei inh âu đĭch đam ih gô gơh hiôk, mă-lei tơdah sư hil blĕk, 'noh ih băt kơ sư wă pơlôch inh.

English: Therefore you shall deal kindly with your servant, for you have brought your servant into a covenant of the LORD with you. Nevertheless, if there is iniquity in me, kill me yourself, for why should you bring me to your father?”
Bahnar: Apinh ih răk nơ̆r ih pơkă hăm inh đĭch đam ih, yua kơ ih đei pơkă anăn Kră Yang mă pơgơ̆p hăm đĭch đam ih. Dah inh đei yoch kiơ, apinh ih jah pơlôch inh bĕ; ngĕ kơ kiơ ba inh tơ 'bă ih?

English: But Jonathan said, “Far be it from you! For if I knew certainly that evil was determined by my father to come upon you, then would I not tell you?”
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl: 'Nĕ kơ tơchĕng kư̆ kă thoi noh! Tơdah inh băt tơpă kơ 'bă inh chă đon wă pơlôch ih, lei inh kư̆m ưh kơ roi kơ ih hă?

English: Then David said to Jonathan, “Who will tell me, or what if your father answers you roughly?”
Bahnar: Đawit apinh: Tơdah 'bă ih hil blĕk tơl ih, lei bu roi kơ inh băt?

English: And Jonathan said to David, “Come, let us go out into the field.” So both of them went out into the field.
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl: Bĕ, ba năm tơ tơmăn glă. Bre sư lĕch năm tơ tơmăn glă.

English: Then Jonathan said to David: “The LORD God of Israel is witness! When I have sounded out my father sometime tomorrow, or the third day, and indeed there is good toward David, and I do not send to you and tell you
Bahnar: Jônathan khan: Đei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael pơm kơdranh! Dơning dah dơmônh, kư̆m lăm jơ 'nâu inh gô jet lăng 'bă inh, tơdah đei tơdrong kiơ 'lơ̆ng kơ ih, inh wơh bơngai năm roi ăn kơ ih băt.

English: may the LORD do so and much more to Jonathan. But if it pleases my father to do you evil, then I will report it to you and send you away, that you may go in safety. And the LORD be with you as He has been with my father.
Bahnar: Tơdah 'bă inh khŏm pơm wă pơrăm ih, inh gô roi ăn kơ ih băt, athei ih năm mă hiôk-hian, dah ưh, apinh Kră Yang phak inh mă trăp! Hơpơi apinh Kră Yang oei hơdai ih, kư̆m thoi Sư oei hơdai boih hăm 'bă inh.

English: And you shall not only show me the kindness of the LORD while I still live, that I may not die
Bahnar: Kơplah noh dah inh oei arih hăm apinh ih pơm 'lơ̆ng 'mêm mơnat dơ̆ng kơ inh. Wă kơ Inh lôch huay kơ

English: but you shall not cut off your kindness from my house forever, no, not when the LORD has cut off every one of the enemies of David from the face of the earth.”
Bahnar: Apinh ih oei wei tơdrong 'mêm ih hăm lu kon sâu nhôn ling-lang mă khan Kră Yang pơlôch pơđĭ lu bơngai ayăt kơ ih lăm kơpal teh âu.

English: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, “Let the LORD require it at the hand of David’s enemies.”
Bahnar: Na, Jônathan pơgơ̆p hăm Đawit păng hnam dơnŏ sư. Apinh Kră Yang phak lu bơngai ayăt kơ Đawit. Dah lu sư ưh kơ 'blŏk kơ tơdrong pơgơ̆p ba.

English: Now Jonathan again caused David to vow, because he loved him; for he loved him as he loved his own soul.
Bahnar: Jônathan 'mêm kơ Đawit thoi 'mêm kơ akâu sư kơdih, na athei Đawit pơkă. Kŭm 'mêm kơ sư.

English: Then Jonathan said to David, “Tomorrow is the New Moon; and you will be missed, because your seat will be empty.
Bahnar: Jônathan khan dơ̆ng: Dơning năr mă mônh khei plơ̆ng đe ei 'bôh ih krŭl yua kơ 'bơ̆t anih ih ưh kơ đei bơngai oei.

English: And when you have stayed three days, go down quickly and come to the place where you hid on the day of the deed; and remain by the stone Ezel.
Bahnar: Năr mă pêng wă khan năr dơmônh inh gô truh tơ anih ih ôn adrol ki, na gô lăng 'bơ̆t cheng tơmo Êse!

English: Then I will shoot three arrows to the side, as though I shot at a target
Bahnar: Inh gô prah pêng găr 'brơ̆m hră tơklă tơmo tih noh. Thoi đe prah pơđam.

English: and there I will send a lad, saying, ‘Go, find the arrows.’ If I expressly say to the lad, ‘Look, the arrows are on this side of you; get them and come’—then, as the LORD lives, there is safety for you and no harm.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh, inh gô wơh đĭch đam inh na khan kơ sư: Năm dônh lu 'brơ̆m hră to, tơdah inh khan kơ sư: To 'brơ̆m hră pah âu e, iŏk wăi, noh wă khan hiôk hiang na ih athei lĕch: Kră Yang arih ling-lang gô pơm kơdranh. Inh khan kơ ih, ưh kơ đei hli kiơ ôh!

English: But if I say thus to the young man, ‘Look, the arrows are beyond you’—go your way, for the LORD has sent you away.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdah inh khan kơ đĭch đam inh: To, 'brơ̆m hră pah to ataih 'biơ̆, kơplah noh ih athei ôn yua kơ Kră Yang wă kơ ih năm.

English: And as for the matter which you and I have spoken of, indeed the LORD be between you and me forever.”
Bahnar: Gah nơ̆r ba hlôi pơkă pơkăm boih, hơpơi kơ Kră Yang pơm kơdranh tŏk-bŏk ih hăm inh truh ning-mônh ling-lang.

English: Then David hid in the field. And when the New Moon had come, the king sat down to eat the feast.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Đawit ôn lăm tơmăn glă truh tơ giĕng năr mônh, khei plơ̆ng, pơtao hơ-oei wă sŏng sa

English: Now the king sat on his seat, as at other times, on a seat by the wall. And Jonathan arose, and Abner sat by Saul’s side, but David’s place was empty.
Bahnar: Pơtao hơ-oei 'bơ̆t anih juăt kơ hơ-oei jê̆ tơnăr Jônathan muh măt tơklă 'bă sư, na Apner hơ-oei cheng Sôl; 'bơ̆t anih Đawit ưh kơ đei bu hoh-hoy.

English: Nevertheless Saul did not say anything that day, for he thought, “Something has happened to him; he is unclean, surely he is unclean.”
Bahnar: Năr noh, Sôl ưh kơ đei pơma kiơ, tơchĕng khan băt đei tơdrong kiơ truh kơ Đawit boih 'nâu! Hơbŏ sư ưh kơ rơgoh, đei tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach boih 'nâu.

English: And it happened the next day, the second day of the month, that David’s place was empty. And Saul said to Jonathan his son, “Why has the son of Jesse not come to eat, either yesterday or today?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei năr đơ̆ng rŏng, năr 'bar anih Đawit kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu dơ̆ng. Sôl khan kơ Jônathan kon drŏ-nglo sư: Yua kơ kiơ kon drŏ-nglo Jese ưh kơ năm sŏng sa hơdai năr brei păng năr 'nâu hloi?

English: So Jonathan answered Saul, “David earnestly asked permission of me to go to Bethlehem.
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl Sôl khan: Đawit apinh inh asong ăn kơ sư brŏk tơ pơlei Betlehem.

English: And he said, ‘Please let me go, for our family has a sacrifice in the city, and my brother has commanded me to be there. And now, if I have found favor in your eyes, please let me get away and see my brothers.’ Therefore he has not come to the king’s table.”
Bahnar: Lê̆ inh năm; yua kơ hnam nhôn đei tơdrong pơyơ̆r tơmam soi lăm pơlei, na 'nhŏng inh pơkă kơ inh athei năm tơ noh. Dah inh đei mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp ih, apinh ăn kơ inh năm ngôi tơ lu 'nhŏng oh inh. Yua kơ thoi noh sư ưh kơ gơh truh sŏng sa hơdai.

English: Then Saul’s anger was aroused against Jonathan, and he said to him, “You son of a perverse, rebellious woman! Do I not know that you have chosen the son of Jesse to your own shame and to the shame of your mother’s nakedness?
Bahnar: Na, Sôl khan kơ Jônathan: Ơ kon drŏ-nglo hơlĕnh păng ayăt plơ̆ plĕch kơ inh, inh băt kơ e pơm buăl juăt hăm kon drŏ-nglo Jese, wă pơm ăn kơ e mơlâu đĕch păng pơm ăn kơ mĕ e kư̆m mơlâu mơ̆n!

English: For as long as the son of Jesse lives on the earth, you shall not be established, nor your kingdom. Now therefore, send and bring him to me, for he shall surely die.”
Bahnar: Dah kon drŏ-nglo Jese arih sot lăm kơpal teh âu dĭng truh dang yơ, na e păng teh đak e kư̆m ưh kơ đei dang noh mơ̆n; dang ei hloi, chông ba sư tơ inh âu; sư trŏ kơ lôch.

English: And Jonathan answered Saul his father, and said to him, “Why should he be killed? What has he done?”
Bahnar: Jônathan tơl, 'bă sư: Liơ wă pơlôch sư? Sư pơm glăi kiơ?

English: Then Saul cast a spear at him to kill him, by which Jonathan knew that it was determined by his father to kill David.
Bahnar: Sôl hrang dao wă pơlôch; Jônathan băt tơpă kơ 'bă sư wă pơlôch Đawit.

English: So Jonathan arose from the table in fierce anger, and ate no food the second day of the month, for he was grieved for David, because his father had treated him shamefully.
Bahnar: Jônathan iung weh tơ nai, blĕk dêh na lăm năr 'bar khei plơ̆ng noh na ưh kơ đei sa kiơ, hơ'ngon ưh kơ hiôk kơ Đawit, yua kơ 'bă sư pơjăm Đawit.

English: And so it was, in the morning, that Jonathan went out into the field at the time appointed with David, and a little lad was with him.
Bahnar: Pơgê đơ̆ng rŏng, Jônathan lĕch năm tơ tơmăn glă tơ anih pơkă hăm Đawit; đei minh 'nu đĭch tơdăm kiơ̆ sư.

English: Then he said to his lad, “Now run, find the arrows which I shoot.” As the lad ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
Bahnar: Sư athei bơngai noh: E năm dônh lu 'brơ̆m hră mă đêl inh prah, bơngai đĭch noh kơdâu. Jônathan prah minh găr 'brơ̆m hră hlôi kơ sư.

English: When the lad had come to the place where the arrow was which Jonathan had shot, Jonathan cried out after the lad and said, “Is not the arrow beyond you?”
Bahnar: Na bơngai đĭch noh năm truh tơ anih 'brơ̆m hră đêl Jônathan prah, na Jônathan krao khan: 'Brơ̆m hră pah to kơ e ataih 'biơ̆.

English: And Jonathan cried out after the lad, “Make haste, hurry, do not delay!” So Jonathan’s lad gathered up the arrows and came back to his master.
Bahnar: Jônathan krao dơ̆ng bơngai đĭch noh: Năm mă tĕnh, 'nĕ kơ pơhiơ̆! Bơngai đĭch noh dônh 'brơ̆m hră, wơ̆t hơlơ̆k tơ tơ'ngla sư dơ̆ng.

English: But the lad did not know anything. Only Jonathan and David knew of the matter.
Bahnar: Na đĭch sư ưh kơ băt kơ kiơ ôh, mă-lei Đawit hăm Jônathan đei băt.

English: Then Jonathan gave his weapons to his lad, and said to him, “Go, carry them to the city.”
Bahnar: Jônathan ăn kơ đĭch sư hră păng khan: Năm bĕ, chĕp ba brŏk tơ pơlei.

English: As soon as the lad had gone, David arose from a place toward the south, fell on his face to the ground, and bowed down three times. And they kissed one another; and they wept together, but David more so.
Bahnar: Hlôi kơ đĭch sư năm boih, Đawit iung đơ̆ng gah gơal kơ tơmo sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng tơ teh păng kơkuh kơ Jônathan pêng wơ̆t, na bre sư tơkuăr chŭm păng nhơ̆m, Đawit nhơ̆m đunh hloh.

English: Then Jonathan said to David, “Go in peace, since we have both sworn in the name of the LORD, saying, ‘May the LORD be between you and me, and between your descendants and my descendants, forever.’ ” So he arose and departed, and Jonathan went into the city.
Bahnar: Jônathan pơma dơnuh hăm Đawit: Yak năm bĕ kơ ih mă 'lơ̆ng; lu bơ̆n yua anăn Kră Yang pơgơ̆p nơ̆r pơkă băl; Kră Yang gô pơm kơdranh sơlam tŏk-bŏk inh hăm ih tŏk-bŏk adrĕch adrung inh păng adrĕch adrung ih dĭng truh ning-mônh ling-lang.
Thoi noh, Đawit iung yak năm, gah Jônathan brŏk mơ̆t lăm pơlei.

English: Now David came to Nob, to Ahimelech the priest. And Ahimelech was afraid when he met David, and said to him, “Why are you alone, and no one is with you?”
Bahnar: Đawit truh tơ pơlei Nŏp, tơ'bơ̆p 'bok soi tơm Ahimelek. Ahimelek hli tơtơ̆, kơdâu sơng iŏk sư, na jet: Liơ minh drô̆ ih đĕch ưh kơ đei bu kiơ̆ ih?

English: So David said to Ahimelech the priest, “The king has ordered me on some business, and said to me, ‘Do not let anyone know anything about the business on which I send you, or what I have commanded you.’ And I have directed my young men to such and such a place.
Bahnar: Đawit tơl hăm 'bok soi tơm Ahimelek: Pơtao đei wơh inh minh tơdrong jang păng pơkă khan: 'Nĕ kơ roi ăn kơ bu băt gah tơdrong jang inh wơh ih pơm, kư̆m 'nĕ kơ ăn bu băt nơ̆r inh athei ih. Inh hlôi pơkă ăn boih kơ lu đĭch đam inh 'bơ̆t anih tơ'bơ̆p băl.

English: Now therefore, what have you on hand? Give me five loaves of bread in my hand, or whatever can be found.”
Bahnar: Dang ei 'bok soi hăm đei tơmam sa ưh? Asong inh bĕ pơđăm tŏ 'bĕng mi dah tơmam kiơ 'bok soi đei kư̆m bưh.

English: And the priest answered David and said, “There is no common bread on hand; but there is holy bread, if the young men have at least kept themselves from women.”
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm tơl Đawit: Lăm tơpang ti inh ưh kơ đei 'bĕng hmă, mă-lei đei 'bĕng rơgoh đĕch; kư̆ mă lu đĭch đam ih ưh kơ đei jê̆ drŏ-kăn.

English: Then David answered the priest, and said to him, “Truly, women have been kept from us about three days since I came out. And the vessels of the young men are holy, and the bread is in effect common, even though it was consecrated in the vessel this day.”
Bahnar: Đawit tơl hăm 'bok soi: Kơplah nhôn lĕch năm tơblah, lu nhôn ưh kơ đei jê̆ minh 'nu drŏ-kăn ayơ ôh. Lu buăl inh wei rơgoh 'lơ̆ng; mă hơbĕn ao mă dôm lu tơmam tơblah, na mă loi thoi kơ năr âu wă pơm rơgoh ăn kơ lu sư hăm lu tơmam lu sư mă rơgoh?

English: So the priest gave him holy bread; for there was no bread there but the showbread which had been taken from before the LORD, in order to put hot bread in its place on the day when it was taken away.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, 'bok soi tơm ăn kơ Đawit 'bĕng 'lơ̆ng rơgoh yua kơ tơ noh ưh kơ đei 'bĕng nai 'nguaih kơ 'bĕng rơgoh 'lơ̆ng mă đe 'măn lê̆ 'bơ̆t gơ'bang anăp Kră Yang, wă tơplih kơ 'bĕng 'nao plơ̆ng lăm minh năr tơplih.

English: Now a certain man of the servants of Saul was there that day, detained before the LORD. And his name was Doeg, an Edomite, the chief of the herdsmen who belonged to Saul.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh, đei minh 'nu đĭch đam Sôl oei tơ noh mơ̆n, đe gơ̆t lê̆ sư lăm hnam akŭm 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang, anăn sư Đôe bơngai Eđôm, pơgơ̆r lu bơngai wei triu Sôl.

English: And David said to Ahimelech, “Is there not here on hand a spear or a sword? For I have brought neither my sword nor my weapons with me, because the king’s business required haste.”
Bahnar: Đawit jet Ahimelek: 'Bok soi, ih hăm đei tơju đah dao ayơ? Inh ưh kơ đei chĕp ba dao dah tơju tơmam kiơ ôh, yua kơ pơtao wơh inh hăt hot dêh.

English: So the priest said, “The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you killed in the Valley of Elah, there it is, wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod. If you will take that, take it. For there is no other except that one here.” And David said, “There is none like it; give it to me.”
Bahnar: 'Bok soi tơm tơl: Âu 'nâu đei đao Gôliat bơngai Philistin mă đêl ih pơlôch lăm thŭng Êlah oei pôn lê̆ lăm che, lê̆ 'bơ̆t cheng êphot to; tơdah ih wă iŏk, na iŏk wăi; tơ âu ưh kơ đei dao nai. Đawit tơl: Ưh kơ đei dao nai dang đao 'nâu, pơjao ăn kơ inh.

English: Then David arose and fled that day from before Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.
Bahnar: Đawit iung năr noh sư oei ôn kơ Sôl năm truh tơ Akis, pơtao Gat.

English: And the servants of Achish said to him, “Is this not David the king of the land? Did they not sing of him to one another in dances, saying: ‘Saul has slain his thousands, And David his ten thousands’?”
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam Akis jet: 'Nâu hăm trŏ kơ Đawit, pơtao dêh noh dah kiơ? Hăm trŏ kơ Đawit 'nâu mă lu bơngai drŏ-kăn hơri suang khan: Sôl pơlôch rơbâu rơbâu 'nu, gah Đawit pơlôch mơjĭt-rơbâu rơbâu 'nu?

English: Now David took these words to heart, and was very much afraid of Achish the king of Gath.
Bahnar: Đawit tơtăm kơ nơ̆r 'nâu lăm jơhngơ̆m hli dêh kơ Akis, pơtao Gat.

English: So he changed his behavior before them, pretended madness in their hands, scratched on the doors of the gate, and let his saliva fall down on his beard.
Bahnar: Đawit pơm wơnh 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe noh păng thoi bơngai sem brem, Đawit chhơ̆ tơ lu 'măng păng lê̆ đak hai ro tơ sŏk kang sư.

English: Then Achish said to his servants, “Look, you see the man is insane. Why have you brought him to me?
Bahnar: Akis khan kơ lu đĭch đam sư: To lu iĕm hăm 'bôh bơngai noh wơnh, yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm chông ba sư truh tơ inh?

English: Have I need of madmen, that you have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? Shall this fellow come into my house?”
Bahnar: Tơ anih inh âu ưh kơ đei bơngai wơnh hă, na lu iĕm chông ba bơngai 'nâu truh tơ inh wă kơ sư pơyeh inh hă? Na liơ bơngai thoi âu mă mơ̆t lăm hnam inh?

English: David therefore departed from there and escaped to the cave of Adullam. So when his brothers and all his father’s house heard it, they went down there to him.
Bahnar: Đawit weh đơ̆ng noh, năm ôn lăm hơgơp tơmo tơ pơlei Ađulam lu đe 'nhŏng sư păng đĭ-đăng kơ hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư băt, na jur năm tơ sư

English: And everyone who was in distress, everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was discontented gathered to him. So he became captain over them. And there were about four hundred men with him.
Bahnar: Kŭm đei lu bơngai pơmat-tat, lu bơngai hre đom păng lu bơngai đei jơhngơ̆m ơh sơ'ngon kư̆m wang jur akŭm hơdai hăm sư, na sư pơm kơ̆l lu đe ei; thoi noh lu sư đei dang puăn-hrĕng 'nu bơngai.

English: Then David went from there to Mizpah of Moab; and he said to the king of Moab, “Please let my father and mother come here with you, till I know what God will do for me.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh Đawit năm tơ pơlei Mispa lăm dêh Môap, na sư pơma dơnuh hăm pơtao Môap: Apinh ih asong ăn kơ lu mĕ 'bă inh năm oei hơdai hăm ih dĭng truh tơ inh băt dôm tơdrong kiơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei gô pơm ăn kơ inh.

English: So he brought them before the king of Moab, and they dwelt with him all the time that David was in the stronghold.
Bahnar: Thoi noh Đawit chông ba mĕ 'bă sư năm truh 'bơ̆t anăp pơtao Môap, na măr sư oei hơdai hăm pơtao đĭ kơ măng năr Đawit ôn tơ noh.

English: Now the prophet Gad said to David, “Do not stay in the stronghold; depart, and go to the land of Judah.” So David departed and went into the forest of Hereth.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, Gat bơngai khan lê̆ adrol, khan kơ Đawit: Ih 'nĕ pă ôn tơ hơgơp tơmo âu; năm bĕ tơ dêh Juđa; Đawit năm truh tơ bri Hêrêt.

English: When Saul heard that David and the men who were with him had been discovered—now Saul was staying in Gibeah under a tamarisk tree in Ramah, with his spear in his hand, and all his servants standing about him
Bahnar: Sôl băt kơ lu bơngai chă 'bôh tơ'bơ̆p Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư. Kơplah noh Sôl oei ngôi ala yơ̆p 'long hla prai tơ Gibêah, ti sư chĕp tơju, gah lu đĭch đam sư oei tăp dăr kơ sư.

English: then Saul said to his servants who stood about him, “Hear now, you Benjamites! Will the son of Jesse give every one of you fields and vineyards, and make you all captains of thousands and captains of hundreds?
Bahnar: Sôl pơma kơ lu đĭch đam sư mă oei tăp dăr kơ sư: Ơ lu adrĕch bơngai Bênjamin mơ̆ng bĕ. Hăm trŏ kơ kon Jese gô ăn đĭ kơ lu iĕm, chŭn păng lu pơgar hơmu hă? Sư gô pơk ăn kơ iĕm pơm kơ̆l rơbâu 'nu bơngai păng hrĕng 'nu bơngai hă?

English: All of you have conspired against me, and there is no one who reveals to me that my son has made a covenant with the son of Jesse; and there is not one of you who is sorry for me or reveals to me that my son has stirred up my servant against me, to lie in wait, as it is this day.”
Bahnar: Liơ đĭ-đăng kơ lu iĕm pơm đon ayăt kơ inh? Yua kơ kiơ lu iĕm ưh kơ roi ăn kơ inh băt kon drŏ-nglo inh pơgơ̆p pơkă pơm buăl hăm kon drŏ-nglo Jese? Yua kơ kiơ ưh kơ đei bơngai bu 'mêm mơmat kơ inh, roi ăn kơ inh băt lê̆ adrol kon drŏ-nglo inh hlôi pơm ăn kơ đĭch đam inh ayăt hăm inh, chă đon pơrăm inh, thoi sư oei pơm dang ei?

English: Then answered Doeg the Edomite, who was set over the servants of Saul, and said, “I saw the son of Jesse going to Nob, to Ahimelech the son of Ahitub.
Bahnar: Đôe bơngai Eđôm, wei pơgơ̆r lu đĭch đam Sôl tơl thoi âu: Inh 'bôh kon drŏ-nglo Jese năm tơ pơlei Nŏp, mơ̆t lăm hnam Ahimelek, kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup

English: And he inquired of the LORD for him, gave him provisions, and gave him the sword of Goliath the Philistine.”
Bahnar: Ahimelek krao apinh Kră Yang tơgŭm păng đei ăn tơmam sa kơ sư, kư̆m ăn kơ sư tơju Gôliat, bơngai Philistin.

English: So the king sent to call Ahimelech the priest, the son of Ahitub, and all his father’s house, the priests who were in Nob. And they all came to the king.
Bahnar: Pơtao wơh bơngai năm krao Ahimelek, kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup, jơ̆ 'bok soi tơm hăm đĭ-đăng hnam dơnŏ 'bă sư, pơm 'bok soi mă oei lăm pơlei Nŏp; đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư năm tơ pơtao.

English: And Saul said, “Hear now, son of Ahitub!” He answered, “Here I am, my lord.”
Bahnar: Sôl khan: Ơ kon drŏ-nglo Ahitup, mơ̆ng bĕ. Sư tơl: Ô, đei inh âu.

English: Then Saul said to him, “Why have you conspired against me, you and the son of Jesse, in that you have given him bread and a sword, and have inquired of God for him, that he should rise against me, to lie in wait, as it is this day?”
Bahnar: Sôl khan dơ̆ng: Yua kơ kiơ ih pơm đon hăm kon drŏ-nglo Jese mă ayăt hăm inh? Ih asong ăn kơ sư 'bĕng sa, na ăn kơ sư minh hlak tơju, krao apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm sư, wă kơ sư tung blah inh, chă đon wă pơrăm inh, thoi sư oei pơm năr 'nâu?

English: So Ahimelech answered the king and said, “And who among all your servants is as faithful as David, who is the king’s son-in-law, who goes at your bidding, and is honorable in your house?
Bahnar: Ahimelek tơl pơtao: Na, lăm lu đĭch đam ih, bơngai bu tơnăp dang Đawit. Ih pơk sư pơm ŏng ih, yŏng lu bơngai gak ih păng gơh pơyom hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lăm hnam pơtao ih?

English: Did I then begin to inquire of God for him? Far be it from me! Let not the king impute anything to his servant, or to any in the house of my father. For your servant knew nothing of all this, little or much.”
Bahnar: Hăm trŏ kơ 'nao năr 'nâu đĕch inh krao khan, apinh Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ sư? Tơpă inh ưh kơ đei pơm thoi noh! Apinh pơtao 'nĕ kơ ngeh minh nơ̆r ayơ ăn kơ đĭch đam pơtao dah ăn kơ bơngai bu lăm hnam 'bă inh; yua kơ bơngai mă đĭch đam pơtao ưh kơ băt kơ tơdrong kiơ, tŏ sĕt dah lơ, gah tơdrong noh.

English: And the king said, “You shall surely die, Ahimelech, you and all your father’s house!”
Bahnar: Pơtao tơl: Ahimelek, tơpă ih păng lu hnam dơnŏ ih gô lôch!

English: Then the king said to the guards who stood about him, “Turn and kill the priests of the LORD, because their hand also is with David, and because they knew when he fled and did not tell it to me.” But the servants of the king would not lift their hands to strike the priests of the LORD.
Bahnar: Pơtao khan kơ lu bơngai pơm đam kơ'yĕng sư dơ̆ng jê̆ sư thoi âu: Năm pơlôch bĕ, lu 'bok soi đơ̆ng Kră Yang yua kơ lu sư tơgŭm Đawit, băt kơ sư ôn mă ưh kơ roi kơ inh băt; mă-lei lu đĭch đam pơtao ưh kơ pơ̆n wă pơlôch lu 'bok soi đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: And the king said to Doeg, “You turn and kill the priests!” So Doeg the Edomite turned and struck the priests, and killed on that day eighty-five men who wore a linen ephod.
Bahnar: Pơtao, khan kơ Đôe: Ih năm pơlôch lu 'bok soi bĕ. Đôe bơngai Eđôm, pơlôch lu 'bok soi; lăm năr noh đei tơhngam-jĭt pơđăm 'nu bơngai hrŭk ao êphot.

English: Also Nob, the city of the priests, he struck with the edge of the sword, both men and women, children and nursing infants, oxen and donkeys and sheep—with the edge of the sword.
Bahnar: Sôl pơlôch kon pơlei Nop păng đao, pơlei lu 'bok soi, bơngai drŏ-nglo păng bơngai drŏ-kăn, lu hơ'lơ̆p păng lu bơngai oei mŏm, rơmo, aseh iĕ păng triu, pơlôch đĭ-đăng păng đao.

English: Now one of the sons of Ahimelech the son of Ahitub, named Abiathar, escaped and fled after David.
Bahnar: Mă-lei, minh 'nu lăm kon drŏ-nglo Ahimelek, sâu Ahitup anăn sư Abiathar lĕch hlôi klaih na kơdâu truh tơ'bơ̆p Đawit.

English: And Abiathar told David that Saul had killed the LORD’s priests.
Bahnar: Abiathar roi ăn kơ Đawit băt: Sôl hlôi pơlôch boih lu 'bok soi đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: So David said to Abiathar, “I knew that day, when Doeg the Edomite was there, that he would surely tell Saul. I have caused the death of all the persons of your father’s house.
Bahnar: Đawit tơl Abiathar: Lăm năr noh, inh băt hơđăl kơ Đôe, bơngai Eđôm, sư kư̆m đei măt tơ noh mơ̆n, rŏ lăng sư roi ăn kơ Sôl. Inh gô pŭ đĭ kơ tơdrong lôch đĭ-đăng hnam 'bă ih.

English: Stay with me; do not fear. For he who seeks my life seeks your life, but with me you shall be safe.”
Bahnar: Oei hơdai inh, 'nĕ kơ hli; bơngai bu chă pơrăm tơdrong arih inh, kư̆m chă pơrăm tơdrong arih ih mơ̆n; ih oei hơdai inh ih gơh đei hiôk hơđơ̆ng.

English: Then they told David, saying, “Look, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah, and they are robbing the threshing floors.”
Bahnar: Đei bơngai năm roi kơ Đawit: To, lu bơngai Philistin năm blah pơlei Kêila păng tơgar iŏk 'ba đơ̆ng lu cham preh 'ba

English: Therefore David inquired of the LORD, saying, “Shall I go and attack these Philistines?” And the LORD said to David, “Go and attack the Philistines, and save Keilah.”
Bahnar: Đawit krao apinh Kră Yang: Inh hăm gơh blah lu bơngai Philistin 'nâu? Kră Yang tơl Đawit khan: Năm bĕ, blah bơngai Philistin păng dŏng kon pơlei Kêila.

English: But David’s men said to him, “Look, we are afraid here in Judah. How much more then if we go to Keilah against the armies of the Philistines?”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kiơ̆ Đawit khan: Tơ lăm dêh Juđa, lu bơ̆n oei hli dêh, pơma kơ kiơ năm truh tơ pơlei Kêila blah lu linh Philistin!

English: Then David inquired of the LORD once again. And the LORD answered him and said, “Arise, go down to Keilah. For I will deliver the Philistines into your hand.”
Bahnar: Đawit krao apinh dơ̆ng Kră Yang; Kră Yang tơl sư: Iung bĕ, jur năm tơ Kêila; Inh gô jao kon pơlei bơngai Philistin lăm tơpang ti ih.

English: And David and his men went to Keilah and fought with the Philistines, struck them with a mighty blow, and took away their livestock. So David saved the inhabitants of Keilah.
Bahnar: Đawit jur năm hăm bơngai kiơ̆ sư truh tơ pơlei Kêila, tơblah hăm kon pơlei bơngai Philistin, pơm ăn kơ lu sư kĕ jei tih, 'noh boih, Đawit dŏng pơklaih kon pơlei Kêila thoi noh.

English: Now it happened, when Abiathar the son of Ahimelech fled to David at Keilah, that he went down with an ephod in his hand.
Bahnar: Na, kơplah Abiathar, kon drŏ-nglo Ahimelek, kơdâu klĕnh tơ Đawit tơ pơlei Kêila, đei chĕp ba êphot.

English: And Saul was told that David had gone to Keilah. So Saul said, “God has delivered him into my hand, for he has shut himself in by entering a town that has gates and bars.”
Bahnar: Đe kư̆m roi ăn kơ Sôl băt Đawit mơ̆t lăm Kêila; Sôl khan: Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei jao sư lăm tơpang ti inh, yua kơ sư năm ba akâu sư lăm pơlei đei 'măng jang tang chơkăl đĭ.

English: Then Saul called all the people together for war, to go down to Keilah to besiege David and his men.
Bahnar: Sôl krao đĭ lu linh năm jur tơ Kêila, wang tăp dăr kơ Đawit păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư.

English: When David knew that Saul plotted evil against him, he said to Abiathar the priest, “Bring the ephod here.”
Bahnar: Wă Đawit băt Sôl chă wă pơrăm sư, na sư khan kơ 'bok soi tơm Abiathar: Chĕp ba ao êphot tơ âu.

English: Then David said, “O LORD God of Israel, Your servant has certainly heard that Saul seeks to come to Keilah to destroy the city for my sake.
Bahnar: Đawit, krao khan: Kơkuh kơ Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, đĭch đam ih băt kơ Sôl wă năm blah pơrăm kon pơlei Kêila, yua kơ inh.

English: Will the men of Keilah deliver me into his hand? Will Saul come down, as Your servant has heard? O LORD God of Israel, I pray, tell Your servant.” And the LORD said, “He will come down.”
Bahnar: Lu kon pơlei Kêila gô jao inh lăm tơpang ti Sôl hă? Sôl gô jur năm thoi nơ̆r đĭch đam Ih kơtơ̆ng boih? Kơkuh kơ Ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei bơngai Isơrael, apinh ăn kơ đĭch đam ih âu băt. Kră Yang tơl: Sôl gô jur.

English: Then David said, “Will the men of Keilah deliver me and my men into the hand of Saul?” And the LORD said, “They will deliver you.”
Bahnar: Đawit apinh dơ̆ng: Lu kon pơlei Kêila gô jao inh păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ inh lăm tơpang ti Sôl hă? Kră Yang tơl: Lu sư gô jao lu iĕm.

English: So David and his men, about six hundred, arose and departed from Keilah and went wherever they could go. Then it was told Saul that David had escaped from Keilah; so he halted the expedition.
Bahnar: Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư, dang tơdrâu-hrĕng 'nu bơngai lu sư iung lĕch đơ̆ng pơlei Kêila păng năm tơ anih ayơ mă gơh oei. Sôl băt kơ Đawit lĕch hlôi boih đơ̆ng Kêila, na ưh pă năm blah dơ̆ng.

English: And David stayed in strongholds in the wilderness, and remained in the mountains in the Wilderness of Ziph. Saul sought him every day, but God did not deliver him into his hand.
Bahnar: Đawit oei lăm char glă chơngue, hơdrô̆ tơ kơpal groi char glă Sip. Sôl chă sư rim năr ưh kơ pơdơh, mă-lei Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ đei layơ wă jao Đawit lăm tơpang ti Sôl.

English: So David saw that Saul had come out to seek his life. And David was in the Wilderness of Ziph in a forest.
Bahnar: Kơplah Đawit oei tơ Hơres lăm char glă sip Đawit 'bôh Sôl ba linh wă pơrăm tơdrong arih sư.

English: Then Jonathan, Saul’s son, arose and went to David in the woods and strengthened his hand in God.
Bahnar: Na Jônathan kon drŏ-nglo Sôl, iung năm tơ Hơres ngôi tơ Đawit oei lăm bri, pơma pơlung sư oei kơjăp đei đon lui gơnang kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: And he said to him, “Do not fear, for the hand of Saul my father shall not find you. You shall be king over Israel, and I shall be next to you. Even my father Saul knows that.”
Bahnar: Jônathan khan kơ Đawit: Ih 'nĕ kơ hli; ti Sôl, 'bă inh, ưh kơ gơh hơtŭt 'bơm kơ ih ôh. Ih gô pơm pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael, gah inh gô pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r, mă 'bar đơ̆ng rŏng ih Sôl 'bă inh, kư̆m băt hơđăl dôm tơdrong noh.

English: So the two of them made a covenant before the LORD. And David stayed in the woods, and Jonathan went to his own house.
Bahnar: 'Bar 'nu bre sư kư̆m pơgơ̆p pơkă 'bơ̆t anăp Kră Yang; na Đawit oei lăm Hơres dơ̆ng, gah Jônathan wih brŏk tơ hnam sư.

English: Then the Ziphites came up to Saul at Gibeah, saying, “Is David not hiding with us in strongholds in the woods, in the hill of Hachilah, which is on the south of Jeshimon?
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Sip tŏk năm tơ Sôl tơ Gibêah, na roi: Đawit ôn tơ lăm lu nhôn tơ lăm bri, Hơres kơpal groi Hakila, oei tơ gah gơal Jêsimôn.

English: Now therefore, O king, come down according to all the desire of your soul to come down; and our part shall be to deliver him into the king’s hand.”
Bahnar: Na, ơ pơtao dah ih wă jur, jur bĕ tơ tơring lu nhôn, lu nhôn gô rôp sư jao sư ăn kơ ih.

English: And Saul said, “Blessed are you of the LORD, for you have compassion on me.
Bahnar: Sôl tơl: Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang ăn pŭn hiôk kơ lu iĕm, yua kơ lu iĕm đei jơhngơ̆m băt mơnat kơ inh!

English: Please go and find out for sure, and see the place where his hideout is, and who has seen him there. For I am told he is very crafty.
Bahnar: Năm apinh pơnhen lăng dơ̆ng wă kơ băt mă hơđăl anih ayơ sư oei păng bu hlôi 'bôh boih sư oei tơ noh; yua kơ đe đei roi khan sư bơngai hơgei hơlĕnh dêh.

English: See therefore, and take knowledge of all the lurking places where he hides; and come back to me with certainty, and I will go with you. And it shall be, if he is in the land, that I will search for him throughout all the clans of Judah.”
Bahnar: Năm pơnhen lăng dơ̆ng păng wă kơ băt rim anih sư ôn, na wih brŏk roi ăn kơ inh mă hơđăl, na inh gô năm hơdai hăm lu iĕm. Tơdah sư oei oei lăm tơring, na inh gô chơchă sư tơ rim lăm adrĕch bơngai Juđa.

English: So they arose and went to Ziph before Saul. But David and his men were in the Wilderness of Maon, in the plain on the south of Jeshimon.
Bahnar: Na lu sư iung brŏk wih tơ char glă Sip adrol kơ Sôl; gah Đawit păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư oei lăm char glă chơngue Maôn tơ Araba gah gơal Jêsimôn.

English: When Saul and his men went to seek him, they told David. Therefore he went down to the rock, and stayed in the Wilderness of Maon. And when Saul heard that, he pursued David in the Wilderness of Maon.
Bahnar: Sôl hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư năm chă Đawit. Đawit băt kơ tơdrong noh, na jur lăm bri kông, lăm char glă chơngue Maôn, Sôl băt na druh kiơ̆ Đawit lăm char glă chơngue Maôn.

English: Then Saul went on one side of the mountain, and David and his men on the other side of the mountain. So David made haste to get away from Saul, for Saul and his men were encircling David and his men to take them.
Bahnar: Sôl tŏk kông pah âu, Gah Đawit hăm khŭl kiơ̆ sư tŏk kông pah to. Đawit hăt hot kơdâu ôn wă kơ gơh klaih lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng Sôl. Sôl păng lu đĭch đam sư rai jê̆ wang tăp dăr kơ Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư wă rôp lu sư.

English: But a messenger came to Saul, saying, “Hurry and come, for the Philistines have invaded the land!”
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai năm truh tơ Sôl na roi ăn: Jah brŏk tĕnh tĕnh bĕ, lu kon pơlei bơngai Philistin năm mơ̆t blah tơgar iŏk dêh bơ̆n boih.

English: Therefore Saul returned from pursuing David, and went against the Philistines; so they called that place the Rock of Escape.
Bahnar: Na Sôl pă druh Đawit boih, năm brŏk blah kon pơlei bơngai Philistin, thoi ei na, đe khan anih 'nâu jơ̆ Tơmo Tih dŏng pơklaih.

English: Then David went up from there and dwelt in strongholds at En Gedi.
Bahnar: Na, Đawit weh hlôi đơ̆ng anih năm oei tơ anih kơjăp tơ kông Êngêđi.

English: Now it happened, when Saul had returned from following the Philistines, that it was told him, saying, “Take note! David is in the Wilderness of En Gedi.”
Bahnar: Kơplah Sôl druh blah lu bơngai Philistin wih brŏk đei minh 'nu bơngai năm roi kơ Sôl thoi âu: To, Đawit oei lăm char glă Êngêđi.

English: Then Saul took three thousand chosen men from all Israel, and went to seek David and his men on the Rocks of the Wild Goats.
Bahnar: Sôl chĕp ba pêng-rơbâu 'nu linh hơgei rơih đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Isơrael, năm chă Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư, năm truh tơ lu Tơmo Bơbe Bri.

English: So he came to the sheepfolds by the road, where there was a cave; and Saul went in to attend to his needs. (David and his men were staying in the recesses of the cave.)
Bahnar: Sôl năm truh 'bơ̆t jê̆ anih hơdrong bơbe triu, tơ noh đei minh pơm hơgơp tơmo; Sôl mơ̆t lăm noh năm wă kơ chă bơyơ̆ng. Na, Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư oei tơ lăm hơgơp jrŭ.

English: Then the men of David said to him, “This is the day of which the LORD said to you, ‘Behold, I will deliver your enemy into your hand, that you may do to him as it seems good to you.’ ” And David arose and secretly cut off a corner of Saul’s robe.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai kiơ̆ Đawit roi kơ sư: Năr 'nâu jơ̆ năr mă Kră Yang đei khan kơ ih: Inh gô jao lu bơngai ayăt kơ ih lăm tơpang ti ih mơ̆ng kơ ih wă pơm liơ kơ sư; đơ̆ng noh Đawit iung, năm kăt tơtông iŏk tơdrơi ao Sôl.

English: Now it happened afterward that David’s heart troubled him because he had cut Saul’s robe.
Bahnar: 'Blă kơ noh lăm jơhngơ̆m sư hmach kơdih yua kơ kăt iŏk tơdrơi ao pơtao.

English: And he said to his men, “The LORD forbid that I should do this thing to my master, the LORD’s anointed, to stretch out my hand against him, seeing he is the anointed of the LORD.”
Bahnar: Sư khan kơ lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư: Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang phak inh tơdah inh pơm yoch hăm yŏng tơ'ngla inh, bơngai mă chu tuh đak rơmă đơ̆ng Kră Yang, yua kơ sư jơ̆ bơngai chu tuh đak rơmă đơ̆ng Kră Yang.

English: So David restrained his servants with these words, and did not allow them to rise against Saul. And Saul got up from the cave and went on his way.
Bahnar: Đawit khă lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư, 'nĕ kơ pơm kơ akâu Sôl, Sôl iung lĕch đơ̆ng hơgơp tơmo na yak rok trong năm tơ nai.

English: David also arose afterward, went out of the cave, and called out to Saul, saying, “My lord the king!” And when Saul looked behind him, David stooped with his face to the earth, and bowed down.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh Đawit kư̆m iung, lĕch đơ̆ng lăm tơmo, krao Sôl, na khan: Ơ pơtao, yŏng inh! Sôl hue lăng tơ rŏng, na Đawit kŭp kơ̆l tơ teh.

English: And David said to Saul: “Why do you listen to the words of men who say, ‘Indeed David seeks your harm’?
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ Sôl: Yua kơ kiơ pơtao mơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r đe khan: Đawit chă wă pơrăm pơtao?

English: Look, this day your eyes have seen that the LORD delivered you today into my hand in the cave, and someone urged me to kill you. But my eye spared you, and I said, ‘I will not stretch out my hand against my lord, for he is the LORD’s anointed.’
Bahnar: To, lăng bĕ măt ih 'bôh năr 'nâu lăm hơgơp tơmo Kră Yang jao ih lăm tơpang ti inh, đei bơngai athei inh pơlôch ih, mă-lei inh mơnat kơ ih, na khan inh ưh kơ pơm kiơ kơ akâu jăn yŏng inh yua kơ sư jơ̆ đơ̆ng Kră Yang tuh ăn đak rơmă.

English: Moreover, my father, see! Yes, see the corner of your robe in my hand! For in that I cut off the corner of your robe, and did not kill you, know and see that there is neither evil nor rebellion in my hand, and I have not sinned against you. Yet you hunt my life to take it.
Bahnar: Ơ 'bă! Lăng bĕ tơdrơi ao ih mă inh oei chĕp lăm tơpang ti inh; ih 'bôh inh lăp kăt iŏk tơdrơi ao ih mă-lei inh ưh kơ pơlôch ih, băt boih inh ưh kơ đei pơm tơdrong yoch kiơ hăm ih. Mă-lei gah ih, chă wă pơlôch inh.

English: Let the LORD judge between you and me, and let the LORD avenge me on you. But my hand shall not be against you.
Bahnar: Apinh Kră Yang gô sek tơlang ih păng inh. Kră Yang gô pơm 'mong kơ ih ăn kơ inh, mă-lei gah inh ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ truh kơ akâu jăn ih.

English: As the proverb of the ancients says, ‘Wickedness proceeds from the wicked.’ But my hand shall not be against you.
Bahnar: Đe đei nơ̆r khan: Tơdrong kơnê̆ lĕch đơ̆ng bơngai kơnê̆. Mă-lei tơpang ti inh ưh kơ đei layơ wă hơtŭt 'bơm akâu jăn ih.

English: After whom has the king of Israel come out? Whom do you pursue? A dead dog? A flea?
Bahnar: Pơtao Isơrael tơblah hăm bu? Ih druh 'moi bu? Minh pơm kŏ lôch! Minh pơm siso!

English: Therefore let the LORD be judge, and judge between you and me, and see and plead my case, and deliver me out of your hand.”
Bahnar: Apinh, Kră Yang gô pơm kơdranh sek tơlang ih păng inh. Sư gô lăng lăng păng dŏng inh păng sek tơlang tơpăt na dŏng pơklaih inh đơ̆ng tơpang ti ih.

English: So it was, when David had finished speaking these words to Saul, that Saul said, “Is this your voice, my son David?” And Saul lifted up his voice and wept.
Bahnar: Đang kơ Đawit pơma dôm lu nơ̆r 'nâu boih, na Sôl tơl: Ơ Đawit kon inh, hăm trŏ kon dah kiơ? Sôl nhơ̆m ôr

English: Then he said to David: “You are more righteous than I; for you have rewarded me with good, whereas I have rewarded you with evil.
Bahnar: Sôl khan kơ Đawit: Kon pơm tơpăt hloh kơ 'bă, yua kơ iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng, na pơm 'mong tơdrong kơnê̆ 'bă hlôi pơm ăn kơ kon.

English: And you have shown this day how you have dealt well with me; for when the LORD delivered me into your hand, you did not kill me.
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu, kon tơ'bôh kon iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng pơm hăm 'bă; yua kơ Kră Yang hlôi pơjao boih 'bă lăm tơpang ti kon, mă-lei kon ưh kơ đei pơlôch 'bă

English: For if a man finds his enemy, will he let him get away safely? Therefore may the LORD reward you with good for what you have done to me this day.
Bahnar: Hăm đei bu tơ'bơ̆p bơngai ayăt hăm bơ̆n mă khan achăng lê̆ sư brŏk hiôk-hian ưh kơ đei kiơ? Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang iŏk tơdrong 'lơ̆ng pơm ăn kơ kon gah tơdrong kon hlôi pơm ăn kơ 'bă năr 'nâu!

English: And now I know indeed that you shall surely be king, and that the kingdom of Israel shall be established in your hand.
Bahnar: Tơpă inh băt kơ kon gô pơm pơtao păng teh đak Isơrael gô kơjăp sot lăm tơpang ti kon.

English: Therefore swear now to me by the LORD that you will not cut off my descendants after me, and that you will not destroy my name from my father’s house.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei, yua bĕ anăn Kră Yang pơkă hăm inh khan kon ưh kơ gơh wă pơlôch adrĕch adrung inh păng kư̆m ưh kơ gơh wă pơrăm lê̆ anăn inh đơ̆ng lu yă 'bok inh.

English: So David swore to Saul. And Saul went home, but David and his men went up to the stronghold.
Bahnar: Đawit pơkă nơ̆r hăm Sôl. Sôl brŏk wih tơ hnam sư, gah Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư hơlơ̆k tơ anih ôn kơ'nơp dơ̆ng.

English: Then Samuel died; and the Israelites gathered together and lamented for him, and buried him at his home in Ramah. And David arose and went down to the Wilderness of Paran.
Bahnar: Samuel lôch; đĭ-đăng lu bơngai Isơrael akŭm băl nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư, đơ̆ng noh 'bŭ sư tơ lăm pơlei Rama. Đawit iung jur năm tơ char glă Pharan.

English: Now there was a man in Maon whose business was in Carmel, and the man was very rich. He had three thousand sheep and a thousand goats. And he was shearing his sheep in Carmel.
Bahnar: Na, đei minh 'nu bơngai oei tơ pơlei Maôn, mă-lei teh jang sa tơ pơlei Karmel, sư bơngai mơdrŏng, đei pêng-rơbâu triu păng minh-rơbâu bơbe; sư oei tơ Karmel oei yuă sŏk triu sư.

English: The name of the man was Nabal, and the name of his wife Abigail. And she was a woman of good understanding and beautiful appearance; but the man was harsh and evil in his doings. He was of the house of Caleb.
Bahnar: Anăn sư Nabal păng akăn sư anăn Abigail; akăn sư hơgei 'lơ̆ng hơbŏ, gah klo sư bơngai khĕnh; kơnê̆ sư adrĕch Kalep.

English: When David heard in the wilderness that Nabal was shearing his sheep
Bahnar: Đawit oei lăm tơmăn glă khan Nabal yuă sŏk triu

English: David sent ten young men; and David said to the young men, “Go up to Carmel, go to Nabal, and greet him in my name.
Bahnar: Na wơh mơjĭt 'nu tơdăm mơlôh năm pơkă kơ lu sư: Năm bĕ tơ Karmel, tơ'bơ̆p Nabal roi pơtruh nơ̆r inh hơpong hăm sư.

English: And thus you shall say to him who lives in prosperity: ‘Peace be to you, peace to your house, and peace to all that you have!
Bahnar: Lu iĕm khan: Hơpơi kơ ih đei arih sot chơt hiôk, hơpơi kơ hnam dơnŏ ih kư̆m chơt hiôk; tơm!

English: Now I have heard that you have shearers. Your shepherds were with us, and we did not hurt them, nor was there anything missing from them all the while they were in Carmel.
Bahnar: Đawit kơtơ̆ng ang khan ih đei lu bơngai hơgei yuă sŏk triu. Kơplah lu bơngai wei triu ih oei jê̆ lu nhôn kơplah lu nhôn ưh kơ đei pơm kiơ kơ lu sư kơplah tơ Karmel. Lu sư kư̆m ưh kơ đei kiơ hiong ôh.

English: Ask your young men, and they will tell you. Therefore let my young men find favor in your eyes, for we come on a feast day. Please give whatever comes to your hand to your servants and to your son David.’ ”
Bahnar: Ih apinh bĕ lu đĭch đam ih, lu sư gô roi ăn kơ ih. Apinh ih ăn kơ lu tơdăm mơlôh inh đei mơnat 'bơ̆t anăp ih, yua kơ lu nhôn năm tơ âu trŏ kơ năr giĕng 'lơ̆ng rŏ. Đah lăm tơpang ti ih đei tơmam kiơ, asong bĕ kơ lu đĭch đam ih păng ăn kơ kon ih Đawit.

English: So when David’s young men came, they spoke to Nabal according to all these words in the name of David, and waited.
Bahnar: Lu tơdăm mơlôh đơ̆ng Đawit wơh năm truh păng pơtruh nơ̆r Đawit hơpong kơ Nabal. Pơma roi đang boih; lu sư gô.

English: Then Nabal answered David’s servants, and said, “Who is David, and who is the son of Jesse? There are many servants nowadays who break away each one from his master.
Bahnar: Nabal tơl lu đĭch đam Đawit: Đawit noh bu? Kon drŏ-nglo Jese noh bu? Lu đĭch đam klĕnh đơ̆ng yŏng tơ'ngla lăm năr 'nâu lơ dêh!

English: Shall I then take my bread and my water and my meat that I have killed for my shearers, and give it to men when I do not know where they are from?”
Bahnar: Na inh iŏk 'bĕng, đak păng 'nhĕm inh hơmet boih kơ lu bơngai jang yuă sŏk bơbe triu na mă wă ăn kơ lu bơngai ưh kơ băt đơ̆ng yơ truh tơ âu?

English: So David’s young men turned on their heels and went back; and they came and told him all these words.
Bahnar: Lu tơdăm mơlôh đơ̆ng Đawit wơh wih brŏk dơ̆ng, lu sư roi ăn kơ Đawit mơ̆ng dôm lu nơ̆r noh.

English: Then David said to his men, “Every man gird on his sword.” So every man girded on his sword, and David also girded on his sword. And about four hundred men went with David, and two hundred stayed with the supplies.
Bahnar: Đawit khan kơ lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư: Rim 'nu kơ lu bơ̆n athei tơ̆n đao bơ̆n. Lu sư tơ̆n đao păng Đawit kư̆m tơ̆n đao sư; dang puăn-hrĕng 'nu bơngai năm kiơ̆ Đawit, oei pă 'bar-hrĕng 'nu bơngai oei răp gô wei tơmam.

English: Now one of the young men told Abigail, Nabal’s wife, saying, “Look, David sent messengers from the wilderness to greet our master; and he reviled them.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu bơngai đĭch roi ăn kơ Abigail, Akăn Nabal: Đawit đei wơh lu bơngai đơ̆ng char glă năm tơ'bơ̆p yŏng tơ'ngla lu nhôn, mă-lei Nabal pơma re kơ lu sư.

English: But the men were very good to us, and we were not hurt, nor did we miss anything as long as we accompanied them, when we were in the fields.
Bahnar: Kơplah mă lu nhôn oei jê̆ lu sư lăm tơmăn glă, lu sư pơm 'lơ̆ng hăm lu nhôn, lu nhôn huay kơ đei tơdrong kiơ păng kư̆m ưh kơ đei kơ'bah dah hiong minh tơmam kiơ ôh.

English: They were a wall to us both by night and day, all the time we were with them keeping the sheep.
Bahnar: Lu sư bơwei lu nhôn mă kơ'năr păng kơmăng lu sư nhen thoi dur pĕng lu nhôn, kơplah lu nhôn wei triu jê̆ tơ lăm tơring lu sư.

English: Now therefore, know and consider what you will do, for harm is determined against our master and against all his household. For he is such a scoundrel that one cannot speak to him.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh dang ei ih athei tơchĕng lăng wă pơm liơ yua kơ gô đei tơdrong răm truh kơ yŏng tơ'ngla lu nhôn păng kư̆m truh kơ hnam dơnŏ ih; yŏng tơ'ngla khĕnh dêh, ưh kơ đei bu pơ̆n pơma kiơ hăm sư.

English: Then Abigail made haste and took two hundred loaves of bread, two skins of wine, five sheep already dressed, five seahs of roasted grain, one hundred clusters of raisins, and two hundred cakes of figs, and loaded them on donkeys.
Bahnar: Abigail hăt hot iŏk 'bar-hrĕng tŏ tơpei 'bĕng, 'bar kơthŭng akar sik hơmu; 'nhĕm pơđăm tŏ triu pai sĭn boih. Pơđăm kơthŭng phe 'ba mi hơdrĕng. Minh-hrĕng hơie plei hơmu, 'bar-hrĕng tơpei 'bĕng plei hơra kro, sư hơtŏk tơ rŏng aseh iĕ.

English: And she said to her servants, “Go on before me; see, I am coming after you.” But she did not tell her husband Nabal.
Bahnar: Na sư khan kơ lu đĭch đam sư: Bĕ năm adrol kơ inh, inh gô năm kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng, mă-lei sư ưh kơ đei roi ăn kơ Nabal klo sư băt.

English: So it was, as she rode on the donkey, that she went down under cover of the hill; and there were David and his men, coming down toward her, and she met them.
Bahnar: Sư hao aseh iĕ jur lăm thong đei kông tăp dăr na 'bôh Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư kư̆m năm tơklă tơ lu sư.

English: Now David had said, “Surely in vain I have protected all that this fellow has in the wilderness, so that nothing was missed of all that belongs to him. And he has repaid me evil for good.
Bahnar: Đawit đei pơma khan: Tơpă pih pang gleh lap đĕch lu nhôn hlôi bơwei dôm tơmam bơngai 'nâu lăm char glă, sư huay kơ'bah dah hiong minh tơdrong kiơ, mă-lei sư iŏk tơdrong kơnê̆ 'mong tơdrong 'lơ̆ng inh pơm.

English: May God do so, and more also, to the enemies of David, if I leave one male of all who belong to him by morning light.”
Bahnar: Hơpơi kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei phak inh thoi âu dah mă trăp hloh! Tơdah truh tơ dơning inh oei lê̆ minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo ayơ oei arih lăm hnam dơnŏ sư.

English: Now when Abigail saw David, she dismounted quickly from the donkey, fell on her face before David, and bowed down to the ground.
Bahnar: Abigail 'bôh Đawit, jur hloi đơ̆ng aseh iĕ hăt hot, na drap tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp Đawit.

English: So she fell at his feet and said: “On me, my lord, on me let this iniquity be! And please let your maidservant speak in your ears, and hear the words of your maidservant.
Bahnar: Thoi noh sư kŭp kơ̆l 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng na pơma khan thoi âu: Ơ yŏng tơ'ngla, inh glăi, glăi inh! Apinh đĭch đam ih âu gơh pơma roi hăm ih; apinh mơ̆ng bĕ dôm lu nơ̆r đĭch đam ih âu.

English: Please, let not my lord regard this scoundrel Nabal. For as his name is, so is he: Nabal is his name, and folly is with him! But I, your maidservant, did not see the young men of my lord whom you sent.
Bahnar: Apinh ih 'nĕ kơ jơ̆ yo kơ Nabal bơngai khĕnh to 'noh; yua kơ jơhngơ̆m klơm klak sư trŏ kơ anăn sư, anăn sư Nabal yua kơ lăm sư đei ưh kơwao, kơchu; gah inh, inh ưh kơ 'bôh lu bơngai mă ih wơh.

English: Now therefore, my lord, as the LORD lives and as your soul lives, since the LORD has held you back from coming to bloodshed and from avenging yourself with your own hand, now then, let your enemies and those who seek harm for my lord be as Nabal.
Bahnar: Kră Yang găn ih wă pơm tuh pham wă pơm 'mong inh pao anăn Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang păng tơdrong arih ih kơdih na pơkă; hơpơi kơ lu ayăt kơ ih păng lu bơngai chă wă pơrăm ih kư̆m pŭ nhen thoi Nabal!

English: And now this present which your maidservant has brought to my lord, let it be given to the young men who follow my lord.
Bahnar: Na dang ei 'nâu jơ̆ tơmam đĭch đam ih chĕp ba wă ăn kơ ih, kư̆m wă asong ăn kơ lu bơngai kiơ̆ ih.

English: Please forgive the trespass of your maidservant. For the LORD will certainly make for my lord an enduring house, because my lord fights the battles of the LORD, and evil is not found in you throughout your days.
Bahnar: Apinh 'nĕ jơ̆ yo kơ đĭch đam ih âu! Kră Yang tơpă gô ăn kơ teh đak pơtao ih kơjăp sot, yua kơ ih wang tơblah hơdai hăm Kră Yang păng đĭ lăm chăl arih ih ưh kơ đei 'bôh minh tơdrong răm kiơ.

English: Yet a man has risen to pursue you and seek your life, but the life of my lord shall be bound in the bundle of the living with the LORD your God; and the lives of your enemies He shall sling out, as from the pocket of a sling.
Bahnar: Tơdah đei bu wă iung pơm kơnê̆ păng pơrăm tơdrong arih ih Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei ih gô bơwei tơdrong arih lăm hơnŭng lu bơngai arih; gah tơdrong arih lu bơngai ayăt kơ ih, Kră Yang gô klơ̆m tŭk lê̆ mă ataih thoi hră prah 'brơ̆m tơmo.

English: And it shall come to pass, when the LORD has done for my lord according to all the good that He has spoken concerning you, and has appointed you ruler over Israel
Bahnar: Layơ mă Kră Yang pơm 'lơ̆ng mă sư hlôi pơkă wă ăn kơ ih, păng kư̆m pơk ih pơm yŏng pơgơ̆r lu bơngai Isơrael

English: that this will be no grief to you, nor offense of heart to my lord, either that you have shed blood without cause, or that my lord has avenged himself. But when the LORD has dealt well with my lord, then remember your maidservant.”
Bahnar: Hơpơi rŏ kơ ih huay kơ tơtăm dah jơhngơ̆m ưh kơ hiôk yua kơ đei tuh pham mă tơdrong ưh kơ đei pơm 'mong kơ kơdih akâu. Layơ Kră Yang ăn kơ ih đei pŭn hiôk, apinh 'blŏk kơ inh.

English: Then David said to Abigail: “Blessed is the LORD God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me!
Bahnar: Đawit tơl nơ̆r Abigail: Inh kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei lu bơngai Isơrael, đei wơh ih năm truh tơ'bơ̆p inh năr 'nâu!

English: And blessed is your advice and blessed are you, because you have kept me this day from coming to bloodshed and from avenging myself with my own hand.
Bahnar: Inh kơkuh bơnê kơ Kră Yang. Sư ăn pŭn hiôk hlôh wao gơh hơgei kơ ih năr 'nâu găn inh ưh kơ ăn inh pơm tuh pham păng găn inh, ưh kơ wă inh pơm 'mong ăn kơ inh kơdih.

English: For indeed, as the LORD God of Israel lives, who has kept me back from hurting you, unless you had hurried and come to meet me, surely by morning light no males would have been left to Nabal!”
Bahnar: Tơpă Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang lu bơngai Isơrael, jơ̆ Kră Yang găn inh ưh ăn kơ inh pơrăm ih, tơdah ih ưh kơ hăt hot tơ'bơ̆p inh, na truh pơgê dơning ưh kơ đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo ayơ mă oei arih lăm hnam Nabal.

English: So David received from her hand what she had brought him, and said to her, “Go up in peace to your house. See, I have heeded your voice and respected your person.”
Bahnar: Đawit iŏk dôm tơmam đơ̆ng ti sư chĕp ba na pơkă khan: Brŏk wih bĕ tơ hnam dơnŏ ih hiôk hơđơ̆ng, inh kơtơ̆ng boih dôm nơ̆r ih apinh păng inh kư̆m răk kiơ̆ thoi nơ̆r hơpơi.

English: Now Abigail went to Nabal, and there he was, holding a feast in his house, like the feast of a king. And Nabal’s heart was merry within him, for he was very drunk; therefore she told him nothing, little or much, until morning light.
Bahnar: Wă Abigail brŏk truh tơ Nabal, na 'bôh Nabal oei et sa tih lăm hnam sư, et sa tih nhen thoi pơtao mơ̆n. Nabal đei jơhngơ̆m hiôk chơt păng suai dêh. Abigail ưh kơ đei roi ăn kơ sư băt dôm tơdrong kiơ tih dah iĕ, gô truh kơ pơgê.

English: So it was, in the morning, when the wine had gone from Nabal, and his wife had told him these things, that his heart died within him, and he became like a stone.
Bahnar: Pơgê năr đơ̆ng rŏng gô Nabal huay pă suai boih, akăn sư roi ăn kơ sư dôm tơdrong noh, na sư hli dêh akâu sư arănga nhen thoi tơmo.

English: Then it happened, after about ten days, that the LORD struck Nabal, and he died.
Bahnar: Dang mơjĭt năr đơ̆ng rŏng Kră Yang pơlôch Nabal na sư lôch hloi.

English: So when David heard that Nabal was dead, he said, “Blessed be the LORD, who has pleaded the cause of my reproach from the hand of Nabal, and has kept His servant from evil! For the LORD has returned the wickedness of Nabal on his own head.” And David sent and proposed to Abigail, to take her as his wife.
Bahnar: Đawit kơtơ̆ng ang Nabal lôch boih, sư khan: Trŏ kơkuh bơnê ư-ang kơ Kră Yang. Sư dŏng tơgŭm inh pơm mong kơ Nabal yua kơ sư pơm kơnê̆ kơ inh păng bơwei inh đĭch đam Sư wă kơ huay kơ pơm kơnê̆! Kră Yang tuh boih tơdrong kơnê̆ Nabal tơ kơ̆l sư kơdih! Na, Đawit wơh bơngai năm apinh Abigail pơm akăn sư

English: When the servants of David had come to Abigail at Carmel, they spoke to her saying, “David sent us to you, to ask you to become his wife.”
Bahnar: Lu đĭch đam Đawit năm chă Abigail, tơ Karmel, na khan: Đawit wơh lu nhôn năm truh tơ ih, năm iŏk ih sư wă iŏk ih pơm akăn.

English: Then she arose, bowed her face to the earth, and said, “Here is your maidservant, a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.”
Bahnar: Abigail, drap kơkuh hloi, na khan: Inh âu wă pơm đĭch đam Đawit pơm bơngai ôp jơ̆ng yŏng tơ'ngla inh.

English: So Abigail rose in haste and rode on a donkey, attended by five of her maidens; and she followed the messengers of David, and became his wife.
Bahnar: Abigail iung hloi, hao aseh iĕ sư, đei pơđăm 'nu đĭch drŏ-kăn sư năm kiơ̆ sư, na năm hơdai hăm lu bơngai Đawit wơh, pơm akăn Đawit.

English: David also took Ahinoam of Jezreel, and so both of them were his wives.
Bahnar: Đawit adrol noh kư̆m iŏk oei kơ Ahinôam, oei tơ Jesreel na 'bar 'nu bre noh kư̆m pơm akăn sư.

English: But Saul had given Michal his daughter, David’s wife, to Palti the son of Laish, who was from Gallim.
Bahnar: Mikal kon drŏ-kăn Sôl, đêl akăn Đawit Sôl ăn oei kơ Phaltiel kon Lais, bơngai đơ̆ng pơlei Galim.

English: Now the Ziphites came to Saul at Gibeah, saying, “Is David not hiding in the hill of Hachilah, opposite Jeshimon?”
Bahnar: Kon pơlei Sip năm chă Sôl tơ Gibêah, na roi khan: Đawit oei ôn tơ kơpal groi Hakila, tơklă char Jêsimôn.

English: Then Saul arose and went down to the Wilderness of Ziph, having three thousand chosen men of Israel with him, to seek David in the Wilderness of Ziph.
Bahnar: Sôl iung năm chĕp ba pêng-rơbâu linh rơih iŏk đơ̆ng lăm lu bơngai Isơrael, năm jur tơ lăm char glă Sip chă Đawit.

English: And Saul encamped in the hill of Hachilah, which is opposite Jeshimon, by the road. But David stayed in the wilderness, and he saw that Saul came after him into the wilderness.
Bahnar: Sôl pơm kơđông kơpal groi Hakila 'bơ̆t cheng trong tơklă char glă Jêsimôn.

English: David therefore sent out spies, and understood that Saul had indeed come.
Bahnar: Na wơh bơngai năm lăng tơng păng băt tơpă Sôl truh boih

English: So David arose and came to the place where Saul had encamped. And David saw the place where Saul lay, and Abner the son of Ner, the commander of his army. Now Saul lay within the camp, with the people encamped all around him.
Bahnar: Đawit iung, năm truh 'bơ̆t anih Sôl pơm kơđông; sư 'bôh anih tep Sôl păng Apner kon drŏ-nglo Nêr, bơngai mă pơgơ̆r linh; Sôl tep lăm kơđông đei lu linh tep tăp dăr kơ sư.

English: Then David answered, and said to Ahimelech the Hittite and to Abishai the son of Zeruiah, brother of Joab, saying, “Who will go down with me to Saul in the camp?” And Abishai said, “I will go down with you.”
Bahnar: Đawit jet Ahimelek, bơngai Hêtit păng Abisai kon drŏ-nglo Sêruia, oh Jôap: Bu 'maih năm hăm inh jur năm tơ anih Sôl? Abisai tơl: Inh gô năm jur hăm ih.

English: So David and Abishai came to the people by night; and there Saul lay sleeping within the camp, with his spear stuck in the ground by his head. And Abner and the people lay all around him.
Bahnar: Na Đawit păng Abisai oei măng năm mơ̆t lăm kơđông, 'bôh Sôl oei tep lăm kơđông, tơju hlôt tơ teh cheng kơ̆l sư. Apner hăm lu linh tep tăp dăr kơ sư.

English: Then Abishai said to David, “God has delivered your enemy into your hand this day. Now therefore, please, let me strike him at once with the spear, right to the earth; and I will not have to strike him a second time!”
Bahnar: Abisai khan kơ Đawit: Năr 'nâu Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao bơngai ayăt kơ ih lăm tơpang ti ih. Ăn kơ inh iŏk tơju sư 'bet hơtơ̆p sư tơ teh; ưh kơ kăl kơ 'bet pơlơ̆k mă 'bar dơ̆ng.

English: But David said to Abishai, “Do not destroy him; for who can stretch out his hand against the LORD’s anointed, and be guiltless?”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Đawit khan kơ Abisai: 'Nĕ kơ pơlôch sư, kơnh ih đei tơdrong glăi, yua kơ sư bơngai mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tuh ăn đak rơmă.

English: David said furthermore, “As the LORD lives, the LORD shall strike him, or his day shall come to die, or he shall go out to battle and perish.
Bahnar: Sư khan dơ̆ng: Đei Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang, inh pơkă hăm ih, tơpă Kră Yang gô ăn kơ sư lôch, dah trŏ kơ măng năr sư gô lôch, dah sư lôch kơ tơblah

English: The LORD forbid that I should stretch out my hand against the LORD’s anointed. But please, take now the spear and the jug of water that are by his head, and let us go.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei Kră Yang wei inh, ưh kơ ăn tơpang ti inh pơlôch bơngai mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang tuh ăn đak rơmă! Inh apinh ih iŏk tơpu hăm get đak đơ̆ng kơ̆l giơng sư hăm get đak sư, đơ̆ng noh ba weh.

English: So David took the spear and the jug of water by Saul’s head, and they got away; and no man saw or knew it or awoke. For they were all asleep, because a deep sleep from the LORD had fallen on them.
Bahnar: Na, Đawit iŏk tơju hăm get đak sư 'bơ̆t cheng kơ̆l sư, đơ̆ng noh bre sư weh, ưh kơ đe bu 'bôh dah băt păng kư̆m ưh kơ đe bu hơđơ̆r; yua kơ Kră Yang pơm ăn kơ lu sư tep blêk.

English: Now David went over to the other side, and stood on the top of a hill afar off, a great distance being between them.
Bahnar: Na, Đawit tŏk hlôi pah to, pơdơh 'bơ̆t kơpal kơ̆l kông, ataih tơpă đơ̆ng kơđông linh sơlam lu sư.

English: And David called out to the people and to Abner the son of Ner, saying, “Do you not answer, Abner?” Then Abner answered and said, “Who are you, calling out to the king?”
Bahnar: Đawit sư krao ôr lu linh Sôl păng Apner, kon drŏ-nglo Nêr, na khan: Apner ih ưh kơ tơl nơ̆r hă? Apner tơl: Ih bu na mă pơ̆n krao ôr pơtao?

English: So David said to Abner, “Are you not a man? And who is like you in Israel? Why then have you not guarded your lord the king? For one of the people came in to destroy your lord the king.
Bahnar: Đawit tơl Apner: Ih minh 'nu bơngai nuih pran dah kiơ? Lăm lu bơngai Isơrael ưh kơ đei bu dang ih Na lơliơ ih ưh kơ wei gak pơtao, jơ̆ yŏng tơ'ngla ih? Đei bơngai năm pơlôch pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla ih.

English: This thing that you have done is not good. As the LORD lives, you deserve to die, because you have not guarded your master, the LORD’s anointed. And now see where the king’s spear is, and the jug of water that was by his head.”
Bahnar: Ih pơm thoi noh ưh pă trŏ boih. Đei anăn Kră Yang mă arih ling-lang pơm kơdranh đĭ-đăng lu iĕm trŏ kơ lôch, yua kơ ưh kơ wei gak yŏng tơ'ngla ih, bơngai mă Kră Yang tuh ăn đak rơmă. Na dang ei ih lăng lăng, tơju pơtao păng get đak 'bơ̆t kơ̆l tơ yơ boih?

English: Then Saul knew David’s voice, and said, “Is that your voice, my son David?” David said, “It is my voice, my lord, O king.”
Bahnar: Sôl kơnăl kơ 'bơ̆r Đawit, na jet khan: Ơ Đawit, kon inh, hăm trŏ kơ nơ̆r kon pơma noh? Đawit tơl khan: Ơ pơtao yŏng tơ'ngla inh, 'noh jơ̆ nơ̆r inh.

English: And he said, “Why does my lord thus pursue his servant? For what have I done, or what evil is in my hand?
Bahnar: Sư pơma dơ̆ng: Yua kơ kiơ yŏng tơ'ngla inh druh 'moi wă rôp đĭch đam ih thoi noh? Inh đei pơm tơdrong kiơ păng tơpang ti inh đei pơm boih tơdrong yoch kơnê̆ yă kiơ?

English: Now therefore, please, let my lord the king hear the words of his servant: If the LORD has stirred you up against me, let Him accept an offering. But if it is the children of men, may they be cursed before the LORD, for they have driven me out this day from sharing in the inheritance of the LORD, saying, ‘Go, serve other gods.’
Bahnar: Dang ei apinh inh mơ̆ng bĕ nơ̆r đĭch đam ih roi. Tơdah Kră Yang pơdrŭt ih pơrăm inh, hơpơi kơ Sư iŏk tơmam soi pơyơ̆r 'bâu phu; mă-lei dah đơ̆ng kon bơngai đĕch pơdrŭt Kră Yang gô hiap pơtê̆ lu sư; yua kơ năr 'nâu lu sư druh puh tơweh inh, ưh kơ ăn inh lăm teh đak mă Kră Yang ăn kơ lu kon pơlei pơla sư bơ̆jang sa păng lu sư khan: Năm, kơkuh kơ yang nai bĕ.

English: So now, do not let my blood fall to the earth before the face of the LORD. For the king of Israel has come out to seek a flea, as when one hunts a partridge in the mountains.”
Bahnar: Ô! Hơpơi rŏ kơ pham inh 'nĕ ăn ro kơpal teh ataih đơ̆ng muh măt Kră Yang; yua kơ kiơ pơtao lu bơngai Isơrael năm chă wă rôp inh, thoi minh pơm siso, nhen thoi đe druh sem trăk-tra? Lăm kông.

English: Then Saul said, “I have sinned. Return, my son David. For I will harm you no more, because my life was precious in your eyes this day. Indeed I have played the fool and erred exceedingly.”
Bahnar: Sôl tơl: Inh đei tơdrong yoch tơpă Ơ Đawit, kon inh, wih brŏk bĕ! Inh ưh pă wă pơrăm kon dơ̆ng, yua kơ năr 'nâu, kon lăng gĭt kơ tơdrong arih inh. Tơpă, inh hlôi pơm boih thoi bơngai wơnh, pơm glăi tih dêh.

English: And David answered and said, “Here is the king’s spear. Let one of the young men come over and get it.
Bahnar: Đawit khan: 'Nâu tơju ih pơtao; wơh bĕ minh 'nu bơngai tơdăm năm tŏk pah âu na iŏk tơju ih.

English: May the LORD repay every man for his righteousness and his faithfulness; for the LORD delivered you into my hand today, but I would not stretch out my hand against the LORD’s anointed.
Bahnar: Kră Yang gô apah ăn kơ rim 'nu, kiơ̆ thoi tơdrong 'lơ̆ng tơpăt đơ̆ng sư pơm. Năr 'nâu Sư pơjao ih lăm tơpang ti inh, mă-lei inh ưh kơ wă pơm kơ yŏng tơ'ngla inh mă đơ̆ng Kră Yang tuh ăn đak rơmă.

English: And indeed, as your life was valued much this day in my eyes, so let my life be valued much in the eyes of the LORD, and let Him deliver me out of all tribulation.”
Bahnar: Năr 'nâu inh lăng gĭt kơ tơdrong arih pơtao thoi yơ, na apinh Kră Yang kư̆m gô lăng gĭt kơ tơdrong arih kon thoi ei mơ̆n. Păng dŏng pơklaih kon gơh lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng tơdrong hli pơmat-tat.

English: Then Saul said to David, “May you be blessed, my son David! You shall both do great things and also still prevail.” So David went on his way, and Saul returned to his place.
Bahnar: Sôl tơl Đawit: Ơ Đawit, kon inh, hơpơi kơ Kră Yang ăn kơ kon đei pŭn hiôk! Tơpă, kon gô bơ̆jang tơdrong tih păng gơh kĕ jei hloh. Na Đawit kư̆ kơ năm trong sư kơdih, gah Sôl wih brŏk tơ anih sư.

English: And David said in his heart, “Now I shall perish someday by the hand of Saul. There is nothing better for me than that I should speedily escape to the land of the Philistines; and Saul will despair of me, to seek me anymore in any part of Israel. So I shall escape out of his hand.”
Bahnar: Đawit tơchĕng lăm đon khan: Tơpă lăm minh năr ayơ kơnh, inh gô lôch kơ tơpang ti Sôl. Ưh kơ đei kiơ 'lơ̆ng hloh kơ inh năm kơdâu ôn lăm dêh Philistin, na Sôl huay pă chă inh lăm teh đak lu bơngai Isơrael dơ̆ng. Thoi noh na, inh gơh klĕch lĕch hlôi đơ̆ng tơpang ti sư.

English: Then David arose and went over with the six hundred men who were with him to Achish the son of Maoch, king of Gath.
Bahnar: Thoi noh, Đawit iung năm hăm tơdrong hrĕng 'nu bơngai kiơ̆ sư, tŏk hlôi năm truh tơ Akis, sư pơtao Gat kon drŏ-nglo Maok.

English: So David dwelt with Achish at Gath, he and his men, each man with his household, and David with his two wives, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the Carmelitess, Nabal’s widow.
Bahnar: Đawit păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư oei hăm Akis tơ Gat, rim 'nu đei hnam dơnŏ lu sư kơdih. Đawit đei 'bar 'nu akăn kiơ̆, Ahinôam đơ̆ng Jêsreel păng Abigail, mă đêl akăn Nabal oei tơ Karmel.

English: And it was told Saul that David had fled to Gath; so he sought him no more.
Bahnar: Sôl băt kơ Đawit ôn tơ Gat, na ưh pă druh chă 'moi wă rôp sư dơ̆ng.

English: Then David said to Achish, “If I have now found favor in your eyes, let them give me a place in some town in the country, that I may dwell there. For why should your servant dwell in the royal city with you?”
Bahnar: Đawit pơma dơnuh hăm Akis: Tơdah ih mơnat kơ inh, apinh ih asong ăn kơ inh oei tơ minh pơlei ayơ 'nguaih kơ lu pơlei tih 'lơ̆ng, lê̆ inh oei tơ noh. Inh đĭch đam ih liơ mă gơh oei lăm pơlei tih hơdai hăm ih?

English: So Achish gave him Ziklag that day. Therefore Ziklag has belonged to the kings of Judah to this day.
Bahnar: Lăm năr noh Akis asong ăn kơ Đawit oei tơ pơlei Siklak gah pơtao Juđa truh tơ dang ei.

English: Now the time that David dwelt in the country of the Philistines was one full year and four months.
Bahnar: Đawit oei lăm teh đak bơngai Philistin lăp minh sơnăm puăn khei.

English: And David and his men went up and raided the Geshurites, the Girzites, and the Amalekites. For those nations were the inhabitants of the land from of old, as you go to Shur, even as far as the land of Egypt.
Bahnar: Đawit păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư năm blah iŏk teh bơngai Gêsurit, kon pơlei bơngai Girsi păng kon pơlei bơngai Amalek, lu bơngai mă oei đơ̆ng sơ̆ rok dêh Sur dĭng truh tơ dêh Êyiptơ.

English: Whenever David attacked the land, he left neither man nor woman alive, but took away the sheep, the oxen, the donkeys, the camels, and the apparel, and returned and came to Achish.
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t Đawit blah iŏk tơring ayơ, sư ưh kơ đei lê̆ minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo dah bơngai drŏ-kăn mă oei arih. Tơgar iŏk đĭ triu bơbe rơmo, aseh iĕ, lăk-đa păng lu ao tai; na, hơlơ̆k wih brŏk tơ'bơ̆p Akis.

English: Then Achish would say, “Where have you made a raid today?” And David would say, “Against the southern area of Judah, or against the southern area of the Jerahmeelites, or against the southern area of the Kenites.”
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t Akis jet: Năr 'nâu, ih năm blah tơgar iŏk tơring ayơ? Đawit tơl: Lăm tơring gah gơal teh đak Juđa, gah gơal teh đak kon pơlei bơngai Jêrahmêel păng gah gơal teh đak kon pơlei bơngai Kênit.

English: David would save neither man nor woman alive, to bring news to Gath, saying, “Lest they should inform on us, saying, ‘Thus David did.’ ” And thus was his behavior all the time he dwelt in the country of the Philistines.
Bahnar: Đawit ưh kơ đei lê̆ minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-nglo dah bơngai drŏ-kăn mă oei arih wă chông ba brŏk tơ Gat; hli kơ lu sư gô roi kơ dôm tơdrong Đawit hăm lu bơngai kiơ̆ sư pơm. Kơplah Đawit oei lăm dêh kon pơlei bơngai Philistin sư juăt kơ pơm thoi noh ling-lang.

English: So Achish believed David, saying, “He has made his people Israel utterly abhor him; therefore he will be my servant forever.”
Bahnar: Akis lui kơ Đawit, na khan: Sư pơm ăn kơ lu bơngai Isơrael lăng sư krưp dêh, jơ̆ kon pơlei pơla sư, na sĭt tơpă sư gô pơm đĭch đam inh ling-lang ling-lang.

English: Now it happened in those days that the Philistines gathered their armies together for war, to fight with Israel. And Achish said to David, “You assuredly know that you will go out with me to battle, you and your men.”
Bahnar: Kơplah ei, kon pơlei bơngai Philistin akŭm pơpôi jơhngơ̆m pran wă năm tơblah hăm bơngai Isơrael. Akis khan kơ Đawit: Ih athei băt ih păng lu bơngai kiơ̆ ih gô lĕch hơdai hăm inh năm tơblah.

English: So David said to Achish, “Surely you know what your servant can do.” And Achish said to David, “Therefore I will make you one of my chief guardians forever.”
Bahnar: Đawit tơl nơ̆r Akis: Pơtao gô 'bôh dôm tơdrong đĭch đam pơtao pơm. Akis khan kơ Đawit dơ̆ng: Na inh gô iŏk ih pơm đam kơiĕng inh ling-lang.

English: Now Samuel had died, and all Israel had lamented for him and buried him in Ramah, in his own city. And Saul had put the mediums and the spiritists out of the land.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh, Samuel lôch boih đĭ lu bơngai Isơrael nhơ̆m hmoi kơ sư păng 'bŭ sư tơ Rama, pơlei sư kơdih. Sôl puh tơweh đĭ lu bơngai pơm pơjâu.

English: Then the Philistines gathered together, and came and encamped at Shunem. So Saul gathered all Israel together, and they encamped at Gilboa.
